text: Best pizza in town! The omg pizza is really omg big! Everything is fresh and there special dressing is so good. I will recommend this place to Anyone the likes real pizza.
Hands down one of the best pizza in town, they have good customer service and everything's tasty, pepperoni monster slice and calzone are my favorites.

Excellent food, excellent service, excellent atmosphere. I started coming here about two years ago and make it a point to get in there at least once a month. Everything on the menu is cooked perfectly, everytime. The only issue I have ever had is the place being too packed during lunch, but it should be packed cause the food is so good! Get a classic combo monster slice, grab one of the mason jars of lemonade, and get some garlic knots. You will leave full, happy, and they will thank you as you exit. Old School Pizzeria is exactly what a pizza joint should be.
Went back for another shot. Pie was great. Service was ok. I think I just have bad luck there. Everyone else seems to get good service.

The pizza here was delicious!!! It took around 15 mins to get our pizza because they make the pizza dough right before our eyes!!! We also tried the cannoli's .. They were delicious as well!! I will recommend this place to anyone who likes homemade pizza!
I really loved Old School Pizzeria. The pizza was so great even the crust!! So many choices. I also love the rosemary lemonade. This is a must try pizza place.

We have been looking for a good pizza place near Nellis AFB with little success.  Then a friend (from NY) recommended this place.   It's a little hole in the wall.  Blink and you'll miss it.  It only has 4 tables.  The decor is a little grungy.  The service was excellent. You can watch them make the pizza.  We ordered rosemary garlic knots and a 14in with pepperoni, sausage, olives, mushrooms, green pepper, and garlic.  The garlic knots came first.  They were amazing!  A good start that had us excited to try the pizza.  We would not be disappointed.  The pizza was absolutely delicious.  The crust is soft and fluffy on top and crispy on bottom. The toppings were perfect.  It was one of the best pizzas we have ever tasted.  This will definitely be our go to place for pizza from now on.
They were a lil expensive, but we thought it was delicious!! We ate the whole thing. Went back months later and tried the Vegas meets Italy, ohhhhhh my goodness...yeah, we'll be back.

This place is awesome. I was in town with my band this last spring and a bunch of us came in for dinner. They handled us very well. We ordered some garlic bread sticks and a bunch of pizzas. These are much better than your topical pizza. The owner personally came out to serve us and to make sure our orders were up to our expectations. Next time I am in town I will be visiting this place.

Old School is stepping it up ! Didn't have to wait for a table tonight. New seating and more tables makes coming here even better. We usually take our pizza home but now we don't have to. Fresh from the oven into my mouth ! OLD SCHOOL PIZZERIA is the BEST PIZZA IN TOWN !
First time trying here I don't regret it.. It's bomb!!! Good pizza and the salad so good. Definitely coming back

I have been coming to this pizzeria for over a year now, and I have to say, I am NEVER disappointed! The staff is very nice and attentive. The place may look a little rough on the outside, but please don't let that stop you.

I am one of those people who usually sticks to one thing on the menu (the original 5 cheese with red sauce, not pesto), but yesterday, I decided to take a suggestion from another yelper and try the Vegas meets Italy. OH MY. I think it may be the best pizza I've ever had. It was perfect in every single way.. Sweet, salty, rich, delicious. Their homemade ricotta is so heavenly. And while it may seem weird to put dates on a pizza, it was the perfect accompaniment  to the prosciutto.

Come and support your small businesses. This pizzeria is truly a gem!

LOVE love love it here. It's a lil rustic country inside with benches and chalkboard walls. The pizzas are fresh so it takes just a little bit, but it's worth the wait. 
The garlic knots are a must!

Decent pie.  They do make it right in front of you and it is decent pizza.  Fresh ingredients as well.  Could use just a bit more saucewhen making the pies; sauce is what gives it the base flavor.

I liked it, but will try the other myriad offerings in my quest fur the best pie in the area.

Some if the best pizza anywhere. Fantastic crust, unbelievable ingredients/toppings and some of the best cannoli ever. The pork reigns pizza, for example, is a wonderfully innovative pizza. Piling on the pork, but with each type adding a special flavor, as opposed to just checking the "tons of pork" box. Great spot.

Oh my god, Old School is the best pizza I've ever had. I love getting the solo combo with a garden salad. The presentation of the meal is beautiful. The ribbon of carrot on top of the salad is a classy touch but the dressing on the salad is amazing. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant is also great. They play old music-like Sinatra- and the lighting is great. There is a big chalkboard wall for kids to draw on and there's seating in front of the kitchen so you can watch them cook. 

My only complaint is the lack of seating--if don't go before the lunch rush, you probably won't have a place to sit. Otherwise, I would've given 5 stars.

All we can say is wow. 

This was our first visit to Old School Pizzeria - from a 1st choice recommendation from Siri. We read through a handful of the Yelp reviews and decided that 4.5 stars by over 500 people was a good sign. 

We went in on a Tuesday night just before 8pm. About half the restaurant was full. We walked up to the counter and told the guy (Jose) that we were first timers. He walked us through the menu which was great since we didn't really know what to expect. 

We ordered garlic knots and a small carnivore pizza. Knots came out first. Piping hot which was great. (Our only suggestion is to ask for marinara for dipping since you get a side of ranch with it.) They were slightly crispy and soft in the middle. 

The pizza came a little bit after. It was a little greasy, but nothing less should be expected with all that meat and cheese. Nothing a napkin couldn't help with. The pizza was nice and hot also.

The toppings, what can I say about the toppings... as a first timer. I was impressed. There were strips of chicken, strips of bacon... and sure enough, the menu says homemade meatballs (that were sliced.) It was amazing. We were thinking cubed chicken with the bacon bits - like what you would get at a dominos/pizza hut setting, but this was NOTHING close to that. 

After the delightful app and entree we had to try the cannoli. Sure enough - it was just like the rest of the food - Spectacular!

And of course, I think Jose should get a lot of the credit too. He staff always makes or breaks the experience as a whole. He was our greeter, cashier, waiter, etc. We only talked to him a little bit each time he came to the table, and each of those times we learned a new piece of info... the conversation really rounded the whole dining experience. 

The only thing I would change is I wish you could have the option to pay at the end instead of upfront. I think we would've tipped more on the back end, then upfront when we ordered (before even trying the food or experiencing the service.)

We will DEFINITELY be coming back.
Just moved to town. Tried a handful of other places before finding this gem!!!!! The search is over. They know how to make pizza. Oh yeah their cannolis are amazing!!!!

It's always tough to find GOOD pizza and I mean really good. Old school knocks it out of the park. It is so fresh. The dough is made daily, the sauce tastes fantastic and the guys working here are so down to earth. Great spot. 10/10 would eat again...and again...and again.
Just tried this place for the first time last week and it is 100% on the money. Best pizza place I've found in Las Vegas so far.

Writing this review based on a sandwich! I haven't even tried the pizza yet. This place is located down the street from my work so I went to check it out. I walked in thinking I was going to get the pizza, but when I looked up at the menu, I saw a sandwich called the Darrin. I don't remember everything on it, but it had applewood smoked chicken, pears, carrots, and some exotic cheeses all on a pizza crust/foccacia style bread. I thought it read delicious so I ordered it. Went over and sat by the window in the sun. Noticed a Tv with remote to my left. Also, there were toys for kids. Let me tell you this sandwich is AMAZING. Probably the most unique sandwich I've had. The bread first of all is delicious, but then you get the sweet taste of the pears balanced with the old time vintage flavors of the cheese. Every bite is a bit different. And to top it off,.. the guy, Darrin was cool as shit. He did tell me that the sandwich is only going to be around for about one more week tho, since he feels it is time to change up the menu. I'm excited to see what masterpiece will replace this badass sammich. Go and get one right now!. Let me know what you think!!!!!! This place is one of the few places that has surprised me since being in Vegas. no idea such good food at this unassuming location.

Great tasting pizza! Definitely not your ordinary pizza place. They are very friendly and have fairly good prices. The best part of all they use square credit carder reader which is awesome!

I just wish they delivered on more days!

Happened along this place and saw the owner who used to cook at another favorite restaurant we love.. the anitpasto salad, and crazy good chicken are our faves. The garlic knots and pizza are out of this world.. we will be back for sure the service was impeccable..

I found this business through yelp (yay yelp!) and I started looking through their pics and got curious about their grilled Rosemary lemonade. I read some reviews and for interested a this business is about 35-40 mins on freeway from my place but I really wanted to check it out and I am glad I decided to go because it definitely did not disappoint! I got my lemonade and a tea to share, I ordered the small Vegas meets Italy pizza, and the half order of bread knots. 
The tea was good... The lemonade was refreshing and very different, I love rosemary and I wanted to try this... The pizza had really good flavor and had crispy crust, everything on it was delicious! And the garlic Rosemary bread knots were my favorite!!! Definitely  a must try!!! Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside with a taste I haven't tasted anywhere else! 
The place is small and cozy, it's very clean and the decorations are nice, not overdone or distracting but it invites you get lost in the atmosphere of the restaurant. 
We got some cannoli to go. Those were delicious too!

This place is a joke! I was in vegas with my friend and his family and we decided to get pizza. When I was trying to order, the employees kept messing around and paid no attention to us. After a long wait, we finally got our pizza. We started to dig in and my friends wife noticed there was, what appeared to be pubic hair, all over the pizza. I took it up to complain and the employee told me that it is what it is and went in the back and started making jokes about it with the other employees. We left disgusted and completely unsatisfied! I'll never be back there if that's the way they treat their customers!

I ordered three 24 in. pizzas with everything on it including hot peppers, after picking up the pizzas and a $144 dollars later they completely botched my order! Old school needs to be the new school, this place is OVERRATED and OVERPRICED!

If this is your first time here, get the Vegas Meets Italy Pizza. I have ordered other things from their menu and they have always been great.  I have had the Crazy Good Chicken, Five Cheese Pizza, Antipasto in a Bread Bowl; Cannoli; Grilled Rosemary Lemonade; Garlic Rosemary Bread Knots. They were all wonderful, but it's hard to try something else when the Vegas Meets Italy Pizza is so unique and so out of this world. And when you're ordering for one, you can only handle one choice unless you are eating pizza for breakfast, lunch and dinner for the next week (which I have done). I ordered one for a pot luck that I was going to and the owner squared up the shape and cut it into pieces for me. Everyone raved about it, asking for the address and trying to guess the ingredients. Try Old School Pizzeria and order the Vegas Meets Italy Pizza and it will be the yardstick that you measure all other pizzas by.

Place is small and cozy. Old school jars are used for lemonades and tea. The menu was my favorite. Everything is done exactly as the menu says it "old school". Nothing in their menu is fried. 
We started with the Gio salad which was served on top of sourdough bread. Very different and very tasty. We ordered chicken wings. 1 order has two large wings. They are stuffed with sausage. These were delicious. I would definitely order more next time. Last but not least the pizza was to die for. We created our own however they have a selection of specialty pizzas. Definitely worth the price!!

From the moment you step into Old School Pizzeria you know you're in for a treat. The pizza starts with a 36 hour dough process that lays the foundation for their house made sauce and fresh ingredients. Leave the soda, take the Cannoli & Grilled Rosemary Lemonade- both are incredible. The menu is engaging and has you thinking about your order for the next time you visit-which will be soon!

Picked it on Whim as we were staying close to LVMS, and needed a great vegetarian option. Didn't know what to expect, but was blown away! Awesome pizza, staff and ambiance!  Don't waste time looking around the area, head right over and taste what pizza should be like!

Visiting from So. Cal and decided to stop in and have some dinner. First off the staff is very friendly. The place is clean & nicely decorated. The pizza and garlic knots were so yummy. You can definitely tell they use fresh ingredients, the dough was fantastic. Hope to visit again on a future visit.

Holy cow, how did I not get here sooner?

I found myself at The Cannery last week for the Blues, Brews, and BBQ festival.  As a vegetarian, I was enjoying the Blues and Brews, but found myself rather hungry and not having much to do about it.  I'm not one to visit restaurants in the local casinos, and then I remembered many a fellow Yelper recommending Old School Pizzeria which happens to be just across the street.  So off we went for dinner.

It's a tiny place, but nicely decorated.  My husband and I considered just ordering slices until we realized we could get a whole pie for a little more.  We got a 14-inch for $10 and added two toppings for $1 apiece.  They offer many specialty pizzas as well.

With all the glowing Yelp reviews, I had high expectations for this pizza.  My goodness did it meet them.  The crust was perfect- a little crunch on the outside but soft and chewy on the inside.  The sauce was fresh and had a nice flavor.  And the best part?  The just-delivered-super-amazing heirloom tomatoes that topped my pizza.  My only complaint is that I wanted more of those delicious tomatoes on my pie.

We capped off our meal with a homemade cannoli.  Over the years I have found that a cannoli is a tricky thing at a restaurant- they are either really, really good or really, really not good.  So I mentally prepared myself expecting the latter.  Well, guess who was trying to talk her husband into ordering 3 dozen more of these babies?  This girl.

The food was great and the service was even better.  I'm not sure who was taking care of our order, but he was one of the friendliest people I've met.  He alone deserves a five-star rating.

Thanks, Yelpers, for your help!  Looks like I've found yet another place to add to my rotation!

The pizza here is so good and the dough they use taste so fresh. The pizza size I order is usually a small and it's a great deal, plus I have leftovers for like three days!! The service is also really good here too!

Pizza was GREAT!  Atmosphere is okay - but, hey, you're in North Las Vegas across from the Cannery in a strip mall.  What do you expect? This is a REALLY small place.  Maybe 20 seats... a couple of tables against the front window and a couple more along the side. Not comfortable seats.

Not really happy with the plastic bag tablecloths that were neither cleaned off or changed between customers. And, not too happy about the silverware sitting on the table in a cleaned out huge tomato can.  What bothered me the most was that when the pizza came out of the oven it was set on the same counter you order from to be brought to your table.  Not necessarily a big deal, you say?  Well it is if someone is standing there about to order.  My husband pushed passed someone on line to get the pizza as she approached to breath all over it and smack her purse down on the counter right next to it.  YUCK. The guy came out of the back yelling he would get it and bring it to the table, but really, guys?  C'mon.  Carry it around through the back.  No one wants everybody waiting to order breathing all over their pizza. (If not for these issues I would have given it 5 stars.)

All that aside, pizza is GREAT!... Not thing stiff, NY style, but delious sauce and cheese.  Fantastic crust. Made fresh to order.

They have take out, but I suggest you go eat it there.  My husband brought it home once and it just wasn't the same

The entire experience was AMAZING. They didn't even flinch when two carloads of us stopped. All 8 of us on our way to Cali. The Calabrese pizza, the garlic knots, the entire meal was good. The kids played with clean toys and drew with chalk. It was awesomely delicious and VERY refreshing in friendliness and convenience for Vegas. I'm seriously telling all my friends about Old School Pizzaria!

I walked in considering dessert. When I walked in I was told they only had one dessert, which is the Cannoli. I am def one not too open to trying new things so I was considering leaving. The young gentlemen offered to pay for my first Cannoli and insisted I dined in to let him know if I liked it. Sure enough I loved it and ordered three more and Mac and Cheese. ZEB is his name. Shout out to him.

Normally I don't trust 5 star reviews, but I feel like this place is one of the few that actually deserves it. We purchased the large garden salad (lettuce, tomato, and dressing on top of a bread bowl), a half an order of garlic knots, and a build your own pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms and roasted garlic. All very delicious, generous portions and freshly made. They also gave us a lot of ranch dressing that tasted fresh. The staff was attentive to our requests. The owner seemed a little stern and gruff with the employees, trying to keep them on their toes to provide the best product and service. I think they're doing a fine job aleady, so please ease up a bit on them!
Next time we're in Vegas, this will be definitely be on our family's must go to list.

WOW!!! Josh and Jim ROCK!! I entered their restaurant longing for pizza at 9:10. (They closed at 9.) They still had customers so Josh said..if you can wait 15 minutes, we will have a pizza for you. YAY!! I had just seen their article about their pizza from the LV Weekly and was craving to try it. Thank you Josh!!!! I got the "Pork Reigns" YUMMY....get it...consumed it..and made my stomach the happiest it has been in a LONG time!!!! The pepperoni is thinly sliced and had homemade sausage. I'm glad I got a menu!! I'm  trying every one of their pizzas!!! Yummy guys!!!! Above and beyond customer service. They thanked every customer as they were leaving. I thank you for great service and great pizza. I can't wait to try your wings:-)

Been here 3 times now and not once have a been disappointed!  The veggie pizza-Wow! Their home made dough- moist and yummy. The cheese- its cheesetastic!  And their olives.. watch out now- they're not your regular black olives. Zucchini,  cloves of garlic,  yellow tomatos.. made my veggie pizza out of this world. Also too i want to personally thank the chef and his staff for the complimentary ranch (also VERY YUMMY) dressing not only do i get one but i get two sides of ranch. Some pizza places dont even sell ranch. That's craziness but the only thing crazy about this place is how spicy the Italian sausage is.

This place is great and I highly recommend it.

I have tried all the salads and approve of all, except the one with fennel is a little strong.

Do yourself a favor and try the stuffed chicken wing. The mac and cheese is amazing; and will give you heart desease.

My only complaint is that they sometimes cook the pizza too long (monster slices). I prefer a softer rather than a crunchy crust.

They also recently installed a new soda/cola/pop machine and it has soda with lemon by Dasani. I recommend that to go with your pizza.

In Las Vegas for work and yelped places near work;  Old School came up. I am really glad it did. 

If you like beautifully made, delicious, Italian food and pizza. Get in your car, boat or fly here; try the food at Old School....You will not regret it!

I had the Grilled Rosemary Lemonade and now I'm ruined. I will only drink lemonade like this for the rest of my life. The taste of the char on the slices of lemon add a dimension to the lemonade I can not describe, other than YOU have to try it. And rosemary in lemonade....Yes it works...I will now spend the rest of the weekend trying to duplicate that lemonade....As the guy behind the counter was describing how they make it I impulsively reached into my wallet and dropped a $20 into their tip jar. 

The Lentil soup was delicious, small dice(s) of ham, lots of lentils and other veggies, a great texture; seasoned perfectly. I licked the bowl clean and used those incredible roasted garlic/rosemary bread knots to make the bowl clean enough to use again. I've made lentil soup, and this is great lentil soup.

As I was plowing through that wonderful pizza with pepperoni, grilled onions, grilled italian peppers I commented on the great tasting pizza crust. Just then I noticed on the wall a sign that states they use only wild yeasts and long fermentation for their pizza dough..Right then I knew this was no ordinary pizza place....Doing that takes much too much time; so this owner must really love the details of making excellent quality food.

And it shows in the flavor of everything I ate here.

I'm baffled by the great reviews for this place. We ordered a half and half pizza with veggies on one side and meat on the other - beware, the meatballs taste more like gyro meat than meatballs.  The crust was chewy and soggy and had a weird sour taste to it.  The pizza had zero "pizza" flavor in general, and even adding my own spices and garlic didn't help. I am giving two stars specifically for the fact that the large pizza was huge, but we ended up throwing most of it away because it was just not worth saving. Next.

Amazing food!  The owner is from Italy and he has created a fantastic little pizzeria with outstanding pizza and salad.  We always go here when getting our oil changed at the car repair store next door.  His food is outstanding!

My first order was carry out and had a not so good experience so the owner invited us back to try them again so here we are.
The dining room is small but very old school so it's great. The light fixtures give great light and the music sets the mood. Large plastic wall lets you see the pizza being made...my kids loved that. 

Bought a jar of rosemary lemonade and it was pleasant to the taste. Not powerfully sweet like regular but good tasting.  

The pizza arrived pipping hot and the plates were hot too so it stayed hot longer. The 24 inch pizza will fill your belly quickly. This time around it was a lot better....no paper  This time around we were impressed with the explosions of taste while devouring the slices.

Then to our surprise the five cheese baked mac came over. Sublime is the only word that comes to mind. You must, nay, have to order this dish. We were all full from the pizza but the mac made us eat it. Talk about good torture, this is the only way to die.

Great joint to sit and enjoy good food. This is a must visit if you want to be amazed. Thank you for the wonderful tastebud vacation to chesseville.

5+ stars!!
I'm always up for trying new places to eat, but after trying Old School Pizzeria last September, I'll avoid going anywhere else for pizza.  They have the most amazing garlic knots, with some kind of magical sauce that makes two people order more than they would normally eat.
And their pizza...lets just say "addicting" is an understatement.  It doesn't really matter what time of the week or day you go, they are usually always busy...but the wait isn't usually too bad...it just means lots of people know about this gem.  Best pizza in Las Vegas!

This pizza was great!!! We got the huge OMG pizza and some garlic knots with homemade garlic cream sauce that was amazing. The owner was awesome and delivered to us with no problems at the exact time we needed for a huge party. 
The only negative is that it is not close to my house.

Don't judge this place by the way it looks on the outside. Once you pass through their front doors, you'll quickly notice that you're in a quality establishment.  These guys are serious about running a restaurant. The Decor is traditional and modern at the same time, the staff is helpful, and the pizza might be the best in Vegas - and I've had most. The dough is perfect.  Slightly crispy and full of layered flavors, this pizza is the dominatrix of my submissive palate.  I want more!!  And I'll chew through that rubber ball to get it.

Too bad I live up in hendo.

The pork sandwich on old world bread was simple and tasty. The pizza was done very well. 
As an executive chef for Hilton I most definitely go back

It's something you eat w a lot of beer & friends watching a game @ home-
not a destination for pizza fans of Neapolitan style.

They are using a gas oven ;the crust should be chewy Inside & crisp/thin outside
Using coal or wood.

The peperoni was not high quality nor artisanal. Straight up a greasy mess-

Excellent pizza with fresh ingredients.  Thin crispy crust. We had the classic combo - pepperoni, homemade sausage, and various veggies. Good ratio of meat to veggies. While the pizza was really, really good, the cannoli was better. Best cannoli I've had in the US. It's a pretty small place, maybe 7 tables but you can eat there or take out.  The staff was really nice and the place was clean. Definitely low key with plastic table clothes. Maybe not a date place but an excellent pizza joint.

My new favorite pizza joint in Vegas! Fantastic fresh toppings, the best dough I've  had in memory and delicious cannoli. For lunch I had a monster slice of the veggie with Gio's salad. The roasted veggies were perfect! I am already planning my next order...the hard core old school!
Pizza was authentic with the best ingredients. They are not kidding when the say the large is big enough for four people.
Tonight was our first time here and we will definitely be back.  The calabrese pizza was fantastic as well as the large salad served inside of their artisan bread. Pride in their service as well!
The Best pizza and Salad in Town!!! The OMG is good enough to feed the whole Family!

My husband I were feeling particularly lazy this Friday afternoon, so we decided to order some pizza.  After reading the reviews for OSP, it seemed the logical choice for us.  Good job us...thanks Yelpers...great decision.
We ordered the Pork Rules pizza, the Five Cheese pizza and garlic knots.  I'm not a huge overload of meat pizza kinda girl, but the Pork Rules was delish!  From whole strips of bacon (my husband is an enormous bacon enthusiast) to the pork all the meats were tasty and plentiful.  
The Five Cheese pizza, more my speed usually, was STELLAR!  I couldn't eat enough.  I wish I had a bigger stomach and my husband agreed (about both pizzas actually).  We spread the ricotta out over the slices and devoured them.  The sauce was light and flavorful and the crust was OUT OF THIS WORLD.
As other Yelpers have mentioned the garlic knots were fabulous as well.  However, after noshing on the pizza, I could barely get one down.
The delivery time was quite good and the food was still piping hot when it arrived.
My four-year-old proclaimed "Mom, you made a GREAT decision for dinner!"
OSP absolutely will be our new pizza destination!!

My husband and I decided to go here one night when we were craving carbs, and we are thrilled a pizza place of this caliber is right in our neighborhood!  I want to try more things in the menu, but I CRAVE the Vegas Meets Italy and can't bring myself to order anything else. Great atmosphere. I feel like it's my kitchen and my family. On each of our visits, the owner has brought out something tasty for us to simply try. The customer service combined with the food make this perfect. I don't understand how this isn't consistently voted the best pizza place in town. Spread the word!

Can't say enough about this place. I wish there were more stars. We go every time we visit Vegas and try not to eat any pizza at home because it's not Old School. No exaggeration. Everything we've tried has been unforgettable. The staff and ambiance transport you to another place in time. Bravo to the creators of this delightful dive.

Few days ago I stopped for lunch and I am glad I did. Pizza was awesome...I am glad that did not order two slices as I've seen the size before ordering...They are huge and that is not an exaggeration. Will be back to try the rest on your menu.

My husband and I stopped here on our way home on a road trip based on the reviews. The ice tea is a mason jar was very good. It lasted the rest of our trip to San Diego. The pizza slices are HUGE - and it was $5 and the size of a small pizza actually. I wasn't a big fan of the crust. It had a sourdough flavor to it and the sauce was just okay. But I definitely recommend if you are hungry and in a hurry for a slice.

My favorite pizza in Vegas, I love the Vegas meets Italy- it's the best combo of toppings I've ever tried. Our kids love the cheese pizza. The omg size is perfect for parties. The veggie is a large step above other pizza places, really flavorful adventure! They also give you complimentary house ranch doing sauce- which is the best I've ever had & perfectly compliments the sourdough crust. We've also tried the chicken, pastas, garlic balls, and salads all of which were excellent. You can't go wrong, try it out!

HERS: OMG. Okay this place is amazing!!! We came for lunch/dinner after I got out of work. I have been eyeing this place for at least a year and a half and have never came. BIG MISTAKE! The outdoor aesthetics aren't appealing but the inside is cute. When you walk in to the left there is a wall with chalkboard paint that you get to write all over and around the restaurant there are riddles written in chalk. The light fixtures are cute and give this place the homey feel is deserves. Okay on to food, we ordered the garden salad and small pizza. I don't recall what the name of the pizza was but it had prosciutto, cherry tomatoes, arugula, date cream sauce, and ricotta cheese. This pizza was definitely one of the BEST pizzas I've had in Las Vegas. The crust was crunchy but soft and not dense. The flavors played off of each other so well and you could taste all of the toppings in every bite! I promise you won't be disappointed.

Tried the Vegas meets Italy pizza tonight. Wow what a combination of flavors! The slightly bitter taste of the cheese broken up by the smooth sweetness of those China Ranch dates made this the most wonderfully complex pizza I've ever tasted. An instant favorite!
My husband and I went here for lunch and absolutely fell in love with the pizza. I now come here to order our pies. The cannoli's are to die for as well.

Great pizza! I would take this over the "Big three" any day. Fresh ingredients and I love the sausage! Missing that last star for location and ease of use, they only take cash and they are located in a auto repair shop. BUT, they do deliver in the local area. YUM! Also, there is a corner with toys for kids while you wait for your pizza.

Lots of Great Options - From Calzones to Pizza to Salads. Very high quality Pizza - a true gem! Now if your are looking for one of those Bargain Places where the Oil is oozing out of the Low Quality Cheese, Or Tomato Paste out of a Can instead of Freshly made, or No Dipping Sauce for their incredible Crust or Garlic knots - then this is Not for you Bargain Hunters. Just expect high quality food at a competitive price - this is unique for North Las Vegas where Dollar Burger Wonders Rule !

Did not have a crowd to feed today, just myself so I decided to order a meatball calzone.  Crust was delicious, loaded with lots of cheese. Only complaint is the meatballs were slightly cold and only in the center otherwise it was outstanding. Also ordered 3 cannolis, they were fresh and awesome. Once again, highly recommend.

The solo meals are ridiculous! So much food! And it's good! They have a chalk drawing of the slice of pizza and it's actually that big. Maybe bigger. $8 for two meals. Definitely get the garlic knots. They don't mess around with their bread. If the pizza weren't so good, I'd come here just for the garlic knots.
This is some of the best pizza I have ever had. The dough is amazing. You can tell that it is fresh, the fact that you can watch them make your pie doesn't hurt.

I love everything about this place and I especially love how they make the pizza right in front of you. All of their ingredients are fresh and you really can't go wrong with any of their choices. 

The owner is very passionate about his pizza and he thrives for customer satisfaction. This makes me very happy and I will be coming back.

On our long drive from Phoenix to Provo, we looked up restaurants as we were driving through vegas and wanted to stop somewhere and grab some lunch.  We looked on our phones and found Old School in north vegas.  not sure what we were getting ourselves into we decided to stop in and have a bite.  We got the vegas meets Italy pizza and we were absolutely impressed.  The blend of cheeses, tomatoes and date sauce was a great change of pace.  We liked it so much we will surely stop by on our way home.
I had the handmade sausage pizza slice with the bread knots and a cannoli. It was absolutely amazing! The sausage was definitely fresh and the can plus were amazing. I will definitely be coming back!

I was really disappointed in this restaurant. I live near here and normally go to Manhattans but I heard good things so I thought I'd try it out. I walked in at 12:05 (five minutes after they opened and twenty five minutes ago) and they asked us to have a seat because they were short staffed. We smiled and understood, no problem. It happens. After 25 minutes they still hadn't even taken out order and four people walked in and they helped all four people before us. Terrible experience and I don't think that I'd go back. I was just sad when I left because I was really excited. Overall I thought it looked and smelled great but it just made me and my partner feed like crap that they waited on four men and made us wait until after all those people before even acknowledging our existence. Just sad.
Great pizza and garlic knots, awesome service.  I wish they delivered!
Exactly what I have always wanted in a pizza.  Fresh local ingredients, great service, unique options.

What a great spot to grab a pizza! We made the trip from the southwest just to try it. So worth it! The grilled rosemary lemonade is awesome, just try it. Don't think about it, just get some. Thanks. 

As for the pizza, I've lived in Vegas my whole life. There aren't any good pizza places anymore. However, I will be making many more trips, until I've had it all! Nice to have a place to crave when  I want pizza in this town.

Decided to try this spot since my favorite pizzeria is closed today, and it had great reviews. Service was quick and I was greeted when I walked in, but this pizza just didn't do it for me. My sweetie loved his garden salad, said it was the best he ever had.

I visited Old School for the first time for lunch . Had a slice of pizza and the lentil soup.  The pizza is made from sourdough bread and it was obvious the ingredients were of high quality.  The owner waited on me and was very pleasant.  Place is clean and the employees hustle to get the food out.  I thought the price of the menu items  was high, but I will return to try the salads which looked really good and the garlic knots.  Lots of testosterone in the restaurant as it is patronized by Nellis Air Force Base employees and construction workers and run by men--
 I enjoyed the view!!

2nd road trip, 4th visit.  Don't ask anyone here about pizza, they love their food so much, that you'll end up in a 45 minute discussion about the intricacies of dough and varieties of flour.  But, actually, if you love food as much as they do, it will be a well spent 45 minutes. The Chef gave me pointers on sour dough starters and my own homemade bread and pizzas are thankful.  Awesome place.  Will be back whenever we are in the area.  Try the homemade lemonade.  Best I've ever had.

I absolutely love this place. I have gotten take out and ate there several times. The stuffed chicken thighs are AMAZING. The fennel salad is AWSOME. The pizza is HUGE and a crowd pleaser especially with that creamy dipping sauce and the sourdough crust. The atmosphere is relaxed and inviting. The staff are always so kind and make you feel like a true valued patron of there establishment.

I got the smaller family deal. Food was great and inexpensive for the amount of food we got. Good place to bring your kids. They have a wall for them to write on with chalk and the guy working there let my little girl try some of their gellato.

Can you say AMAZING??!!!  I actually found this place by accident.  The outside didn't look like much, but I'm glad I didn't judge a book by its' cover.  Boy was I surprised!  I had the Slice and Salad Solo Meal with a mason glass of Grilled Rosemary Lemonade, and a Cannoli for dessert!  Everything was delicious, fresh, and "Oh, so goooood!  I will definitely be going back...like tomorrow. 

The sign in the shop reads that they make their dough the old fashioned way, which is a 36-hour process.  I'm not sure what that means, but the pizza crust was some of the best I've ever eaten, and I grew up in the Pizza Mecca of Upstate NY.  The salad was their house salad with their homemade creamy garlic dressing.  My mouth is watering just writing about this meal. 

I had never heard of Grilled Rosemary Lemonade, but it was love at first sip.  I was really stuffed, but just had to try dessert.  I have no words for that Cannoli.  It literally melted in my mouth.  It was a bit embarrassing to hear the sounds I was making as I savored every bite. LOL. 

Last, but certainly not least, the service was great.  I was acknowledged as soon as I walked in, even though the cashier was finishing up with another customer.  While I viewed the menu, the cashier was patient and answered all my questions.  The plating for my pizza and salad, and dessert was much nicer than I've ever experienced at a pizza shop. I even got to keep my quart sized mason jar from the lemonade.  

I'd say that the only slight negative is that the shop is on the smaller size and I felt like I was really close to the table next to me.  I'm looking forward to going back and trying some more things on the menu!

I am updating my review from the one I wrote last year because Old School has the best pizza in Vegas. I've tried several different pizza places who "specialize" in pizza making and they have all fallen short, no other restaurant has even come close. I absolutely love the upgrades that they've made to the resturant. One of the best things about this resturant is that you can taste and smell the freshness in their ingredients. I've even eaten this pizza cold from my fridge, still good! Great food, Great service this resturant deserves 5 stars!

I'm a fan of Chicago style pizza so wasn't sure if I'd like this because it looks like NY style, but I couldn't be further from the truth.  They cook everything in house and is so amazing it deserves it's own category.  Their service is just as good and their homemade ranch is unbeatable.

If you are looking for a great pizza off the beaten path, this is your spot.  They start with a great sourdough crust and elevate with bomb tangy tomatoes and have every combination available including homemade sausage and smoked BBQ.  What, BBQ at a legit Italian pizza spot?  YES!!!   Don't worry, the classics aren't missed with the Margarita and others.

Just tried this place and it's great!! Homemade meatballs. Perfect crust!  Finally!!  We also had a stuffed chicken wing appetizer. Crazy! Excellent job with texting communication. They make their own lemonade and iced tea and serve in mason jars. If you bring the jar back you get a discount on the refill.

The pepperoni pizza is seriously bombin good. But the garlic knots and sauce, best I've ever had. I could probably just go for a Large order of those and call it good. Super nice owner/chef that cares about your experience at Old School Pizza.

Excellent! That one word goes for everything..... well everything except the soda. WHY DO 90% OF RESTAURANTS HAVE COKE PRODUCTS? But I digress.

The pizza was excellent. Even the olives that were only supposed to be on half the pizza were excellent. Not the black sliced outovacan olives, but small whole wonderfully briny olives..... me thinks calamata! The pepperoni was excellent. The sausage was excellent. I had my doubts at first. I do love chunks of sausage on my pizza and the sausage on this pizza was large flat ribbons............. BUT EXCELLENT! Excellent crust. The rosemary garlic knots were........ you guessed it...... EXCELLENT! The best knots hands down we have ever had. The antipasto salad........... wait for it.......... EXCELLENT!

Other than the soda, the only real issue I have with Old School is that it is soooo far away from my home. But no doubt, moving forward, when the night, or the day for that matter, calls for the best pizza in Vegas, it's over the river and through the woods to Old School Pizza we go.

One last thing, the owner needs to keep his son away from the Magic Mike video. Although we do enjoy dinner and show from time to time, that was one show we didn't expect. That said, the owner as well as his son have something to be proud of.

Really disappointed!  We have been here before and the food was great.  Unfortunately, we did not have the same experience this time.   We ordered a pizza, two calzones, and three canolis.  The cook dropped one of the calzones so we had to wait for him to cook another.  I totally understand that mistakes happen, but they did nothing to rectify the error.  We were starving and bad to wait another 20 minutes for a new calzone.   In the meantime...... Our other calzone and pizza sat.  So - by the time we got home the pizza was burnt, presumably from sitting on the top of the pizza oven and the calzone was soggy and cold.  BAD!  Additionally, the canoli cream was watery and ran out of the shell.  The guy told us it was because it was just made but I have made canolis and the cream shouldn't need to set -  not sure why that was?   Overall, just disappointed.  For $50 worth of pizza, it was not good.
This is a little gem. I came here for the first time with my family and the pizza is amazing. Whenever I think about you pizza I think of this place. Best pizza I have ever had I promise!

This place has the absolute best pizza in Las Vegas. We ordered a large cheese with mushroom and of course another to go. Every time we are in town we make sure to visit old school pizzeria. Josh, the owner/manager/chef runs makes sure everyone is happy and well fed! Thank You Josh!

Never thought about even wanting to try this place after seeing the location and having had many other business fail in that location. After reading the amazing reviews my husband and I decided to give it a try. I really wanted to like it but it was just OK...It's super small and the decorating could have been better....We did not order pizza tho, we opted for the GIO salad which wasn't mixed greens like I was expecting...and we ordered a calzone which was just OK..the sausage in it I had to pick out cause it tasted funny to me. The plus about this place was the very nice guy that worked there...didn't ask his name, but he was helpful and nice and even gave us free fresh garlic knots while we were waiting for our food! l Also you must try the peanut butter gelato, it's BOMB! We might be back to try the pizza...one day.
This place has the most amazing staff they are so helpful. If you stop by you have to Ty the rosemary lemonade.

This place has the most delicious pizza I've had in Vegas. It's a little more pricey but well with the price. Way better than any fast food chain. Everything that I've tried has been amazing, and I continue to go whenever I want a good slice.

Found this gem on our drive home to Utah. Great service and delicious food! We had the Garlic knots, baked Mac and cheese, monster pizza slices and side salad. The kids loved the pizza which the slices were really monster!- and probably best Mac and cheese I've ever had.. garlic knots are sour dough with a garlic sauce and wow- so good. Oh and the rosemary lemonade was super yummy. For sure coming back!

AMAZING FOOD!!! when they don't burn your Pizza
Owner can't take constructive criticism to help his store out as I eat there all the time.. Getto employees that don't belong at pizza hut...New lady working there steels tips and doesn't put it in the tip jar to share...Black kid works at night speaks in hoo-bon-ics and curses.....Salad is good and pizza the best in Vegas... There cheap with the special sauce give you 2 for a 25 buck pizza that has amazing ingredients. The 2 sauces cover 1 slice ask for more... Go at lunch time better service with exception to the owners slouchie not happy frowny ass look on his face ... laugh when they call there 8 dollar an hour helpers chef's hahaha...
Anyways food is good don't rest your back on the chalk board wall as it ruined my black Blouse ....

Good Pizza 
Poor Staff
Owner Un pleasant 
Forgot one  little Mexican boy at night constantly eating out of the salad bar!!!

There best employee is the short guy at night older Grey hair ultra nice 

Thanks
Old School Pizzeria is a treat and a fun place to take our out of town company. Tonight we celebrated for a birthday. Service is above and beyond
So good---so full...Had Garlic knots,  salad and a monster slice.  Can't wait to try the new place in the SW!

This place is absolutely amazing and nothing less! The customer service is great, the food is wonderful, and the price ain't too bad either.  :) I wish I could give old school pizzeria 6 stars or just an unlimited number of stars! Every time I've ever been here I've been treated like family.  If you want an overall fantastic dining experience, get to Old School Pizzeria!!
Still killing it after all these years! The latest pleasure for me if the lemonade sooo amazing especially with great pizza on a hot Las Vegas summer day. Keep up the good work!

A few times a month I go to North Las Vegas for work. Food options nearby are pretty limited since I don't care for fast food. Once you start heading west of I-15 on Craig options greatly improve. Yelp led me to Old School Pizzeria. 

It's across from The Cannery. It's a quaint space that sits no more than 30. The have a slew of toppings and very large slices. I find one to be plenty for lunch. I've tried the pepperoni and a combination of veggies. I like the pepperoni a bit better than my choice of veggie slice with mushrooms, onions and tomatoes. Slices come with a side of garlic dipping sauce. A slice and drink is about eight bucks.

The crust is crisp and the crust to sauce and cheese ratio is pretty balanced. It's a good slice of pie. They also dish up salads, pastas and a few daily specials. They are pretty famous for their garlic knots, but I'm yet to try them.
Big variety of choices good pizza & beer. Ate here about a month ago.  Had a group of 9 & easily accommodated us. Pretzel & dip was great

love this little gem. We have tried several different dishes.  Vegas  meets Italy  is amazing . Busy place but the wait is worth  it. The staff is friendly and inviting. I have never been disappointed by any of the dishes and always  looking forward to the next visit. Give them a try I guarantee you won't be disappointed.

Tired of ordinary store front pizza or questionable pizza from the national chains Old School Pizza is the perfect place to jump off from the bandwagon.  The slice of Anchovies spinach olives and egg was delicious.  Great service and atmosphere.   The cannoli was perfect.  Right across from the Cannery.  You will not be disappointed.

I can honestly say that since eating at Old School Pizzeria, this is why I cannot bring myself to give many other pizza joints a 5 star rating. This is the pizza by which all others are compared. (in L.V. at least)

Pizza crust is light and crispy, sauce is delicious, ingredients are fresh... I haven't found a single thing that they could improve upon. Oh, and the garlic knots... the best I have tasted.

I hear the other food is good as well but I just can't get past the pizza to give anything else a try.

My only complaint - They are closed on Sunday and yes, today is Sunday damn it!

The Vegas meets Italy pizza is one of the best tasting pizzas in the neighborhood. Also the guys there really care about the food they sell and will gladly elaborate on any questions you might have. Go, eat, and be merry.

This little gem is "Old School" with flavors guaranteed to induce old fashioned food-gasms. 
  The Garlic Knots, served with fresh Rosemary and roasted cloves of Garlic, are a personal favorite.  I highly recommend a combination of Garlic Knots and Gio's House Salad to wake your tastebuds and provide multiple mouthfuls of happiness. This salad is a combination of fresh Cucumber, Fennel, Caramelized White Onion, Cherry Tomatoes, Basil, and chunks of freshly made Mozzarella, tossed in a light, delicious, House Vinaigrette Dressing. Incredible! 
  The pizzas are covered with a variety of fresh ingredients, full of mouthwatering flavor, sitting upon a delicious House-made Tomato Sauce. The Classic Combo is a personal favorite, but you must try several pies for yourself before deciding upon your personal favorite. I will guarantee this, the freshly made, hand-tossed dough creates a wonderful crust. It is thin and crispy, but just thick enough to offer a soft bite of delectable deliciousness.  Amazing!

The salmon I ordered was good with the fried spinach that it sat on. The salmon had an orange sauce, which was a bit too sweet for me, but it wasn't a big deal.. I wasn't expecting it, but the salmon came with a small bowel of plain spaghetti. I liked the buttery garlic bread they served before your meal. The service wasn't bad although I felt a bit rushed by the waitress on occasion. What I didn't like was the fact that they didn't offer my favorites, such as gnocchi and risotto (she did say later that they had gnocchi, but it wasn't on the menu). There were other things that I like that I didn't see, such as garlic prawns.

Happened upon this place while I was on my way to school and I was starving. Oh my god. This is some of the freshest, classic pizza I've ever had. Got two monster slices with pepperoni. I only finished one because they were so damn big (good thing). The sauce is incredible. So fresh and tomato-y. You can really tell that the chef takes pride in serving healthy, but incredibly tasty food. The pizza came with this white garlic sauce. At first I thought it was ranch, but the nice gentleman told me it wasn't as we were having a great conversation. What an amazing supplement to the pizza sauce, they complement each other perfectly. Great pizza, great people, would come again.

The slice that changed my life. Wasn't in the mood for pizza, but everything else was closed. Huge slice with half a salad was $8.50...a lot of food. Antipasto salad was perfectly dressed, super fresh with multi colored cherri tomatoes, arugula, and meats. The crust is a thick, almost sour dough; crunchy on the outside, soft inside, and really flavorful. Tangy crushed tomato sauce paired perfect. I added a few toppings for $0.40 each and all were really high quality (caramelized onions, roasted eggplant, house sausage). The house pies also look incredible-I saw truffle cured egg yolks as a topping on the old school...what?! This is artisan food on a layman's budget. Also, for ranch lovers, you will like the house to be sure
Ate there last night and it was great! Monster slice and salad was plenty to fill me up. The roasted garlic was awesome!

The pizza crust was crunchy and tasty although the margarita pizza was somewhat soggy. Sauce was really good. The Gio salad was yummy. The Crazy Good Chicken was excellent with the potato's. Very small place located in a small strip mall next to a barber. The staff was split, the girl very friendly and helpful, the small guy not so much. He seemed irritated that we had come shortly after they opened. Overall good pizza and chicken and would recommend.
Great food great atmosphere when in North Las Vegas must come try the handcrafted and special brewed lemonade and iced tea.    Food is fresh and fast.

I walked in last Wednesday with some co-workers, expecting to get my usual slice and a cannolo (Gio recently taught me the singular form of cannoli... lunch and a lesson, haha!).  Much to my surprise, they had a special treat that day that they don't make often:  porchetta, or Italian pork roast, with an au jus type sauce.  Offered in the form of a sandwich on their signature sourdough, my mind was changed instantly.  Why not try something I'd never had before, especially when it smelled so heavenly?

And what a good decision it was!  Juicy with a crispy outer layer and full of flavor from the herb mixture it was stuffed with, it had a bit of the "au jus" poured over it that soaked into the bread.  All the flavors mixed together into one of the most delicious dishes I've had in a very long time.  I rarely eat my entire meal, but this was one I couldn't stand to let go to waste.

The moral of the story:  If you ever happen to stop in on a porchetta day, forget about pizza and eat the pork.  :)

Recently ordered, & picked for local customer factory crews. Crust is a flatbread type; not thick crust, but certainly not a thin crust. The OMG is 24"; huge! I heard it was very good. Small business with just a few workers, so may need some patience.

I love pizza, garlic knots, and friendly people. Old school pizza has all 3. Chef Gio is as friendly as they come. Our waitress forgot out garlic knots and so Gio made another batch. She brought them to the wrong table and he quickly pulled her a aside and professionally corrected her with out causing a scene. Good price. Also it's a pizza place where you can personally get to know the employees. They're more than willing to chat if you're there by yourself or will ask how everybody is doing if you're there with your family. Only complaint is its a little small. If it were bigger he'd have more people in there at once. WAY TO GO OSP!!!!!
This place is not messing around. Had every variety of food this place offers and it's all amazing. Welcome to food heaven. Hope y'all enjoy!

The customer service here is enough to come back for. I have dreams about their sourdough crust and the garlic sauce. You have to try the grilled rosemary lemonade. This is hands down, my favorite pizza place

Wow...I was really impressed.  I just started working in the area and wanted pizza for lunch.  Of course I turned to Yelp, and I will be coming back...often.  

I just had a Monster Slice and a soda, only a little over $5 for both, great value. ..but I will be back to try the other options like their "crazy good chicken."  It looked and smelled fantastic and apparently it is cooked sous-vide, and then roasted...nice! 

They make their own dough and sauce, and the choices on your topping are above and beyond your typical pizza joints.  They have all the usual toppings, but many other great options such as Pulled Pork, House made Sausage, artisan made salame Calabrese, Canadian Bacon, apple-wood smoked Bacon, guanciale, etc.

Make the trip here if you can, I think you'll find it as good as I.

We've driven past this place for a long time, and had a recommendation from friends as well. Yesterday I discovered all the Yelp reviews so we had to try. We were not disappointed. We submitted an order online and picked it up to bring home.

We got the Slice and Knots, Slice and Stuffed Chicken Wing, and half order of Knots. 

It was all delicious and I believe it was around $20. After this place I can't imagine eating at those other pizza chains again. I've never had an actual "pie" before, but this place is better than I've ever tasted. Everything was so fresh and the flavor was amazing. BTW, one slice of pizza is big enough that I would consider it 2 regular slices. MORE than enough for one person.

Moved about 3 years ago from NJ to N. Las Vegas, tried many places and this is by far the best pizza out here, the pizza dough is great, service is quick and this is our go to place when ever we want pizza.

Just a note to owner, since I figure he may read these from time to time, make sure all of your male employees wear a belt, because the last thing I want to see is someone's rear end when I am eating

Old School Pizzeria where have you been all my life!!! I almost lost my love of pizza! 
I started with the Gio salad featuring fennel and cucumbers. The presentation was classic and elegant not to mention delicious.  
Let me say that the pizza here is absolutely inspiring. We ordered a small pizza with sausage, red bell peppers and mushrooms. I can safely say that it was the best pizza I have ever had. The house made sausage and cheese were indescribable and the mushrooms were a blend of shiitake, oyster, and more sautéed in garlic and cracked pepper, all on a sourdough crust! Yummy!!
Then they go and top all the impeccable Italian cuisine with a true, old pizzeria ambiance complete with old, old school music. 
Simply delightful!!
Great pizza spot love the atmosphere  here. Feels like I'm in a old Italian cafe felt comfortable  like home.
Delicious baked ziti. Would love to live closer to here to be able to treat myself to it more often.

Over rated. The pizza was not bad but it was expensive and there was very little meat on the pizza. For the price I was expecting more. The tea was good and so was the Ranch/Garlic sauce but I'm not sure if I would eat there again.

Two visits, two home runs. I tried the "crazy good" chicken on the first trip and found it moist and holding a lot of good flavor. I actually found the roasted potatoes and garlic that came with the chicken to be even a little better than the chicken itself. My next visit included two of the monster slices, one with meatballs. The ingredients all are high quality, from the cheese to the sauce to the dough. The meatballs clearly are made in-house as well. The crust is thin like New York pizza, but has a little more crunch. The service is friendly and helpful, and it's pretty hard not to like the place. I only wish I lived a little closer.
Super bomb huge pizza slices. Authentic Italian history lessons accompany each meal. Very good times.

I grew up in Jersey and after moving our here and trying all the recommended pie shops i was always disapointed. Then by chance i stimbled into old school. I thoight it would be another dud but i was wromg as could ve.  My hats off to this pizzeria staying true to our Italian heritage.  This pizzeria is the best in las vegas by far and puts demarcos to complete and utter shame and is tied for 1st for any pie i have had in a good shop in Jersey or New York.  Thank you sir and staff. Gratsi

There are plenty of good pizza places in Las Vegas, and depending on what type of pizza you like, you can probably find it here. But this small restaurant in North Las Vegas is one of the best in the Valley, especially if you like New York-sized artisan pies that you can order whole or by the slice.

I went to lunch with three co-workers, and we each had a "monster slice" -- and they're not kidding with the name. These pieces were HUGE! I can't imagine what a "double slice" would be! I had The Veggie, which was a melange of fresh vegetables (including one of my favorites, roasted garlic). My boss had a traditional sausage and pepperoni, and my other co-workers each had the College Favorite (ham and pineapple) and the Calabrese (salami, peppers, and olives). 

These were all pretty tasty, and I didn't even go near the two menu items that piqued my interest the most: the Vegas Meets Italy (dates, pistachios, prosciutto, and triple-cream gorgonzola) and the Pork Reigns (name a pork product, and it's probably on there). But my husband is pork's biggest fan, so I thought I'd save that latter order for him next time we see a movie across the street at the Galaxy Theater. (LOVE that place!)

Our lunch quartet also shared some garlic rosemary bread knots (delicious) and cannoli (even better). Service was quick and pleasant, although I felt like a heel because I didn't leave a tip. (I didn't notice a tip jar on the counter, although my boss later said he saw it and tipped. Now THAT'S a first for Vegas -- an inconspicuous tip jar!)

As I said earlier, this place is small, so you might have to wait for a table. But it is definitely worth the wait. And next time I'll definitely tip!
Not impressed. Still looking for the perfect pizza. The sauce needs more flavor. It was better then most.The people are fantastic with customer service.

This is the best pizza in las vegas period and the crew has the best personalty they really make the place. I had lost all hope for conolli but when i tryed it omg it was good the stuffed chicken wings are awesome everything is just great. already been there a couple of time. Best cheat day food ever. Thanks guys.
Great quality! Foodies dream!! We get different stuff each time and never disappointed! Still love this place and the awesome vibe!

Wow, thank god we missed our movie, because instead we found this place!
You will notice this place from the road from the nonconformast lighting and font used for their signage.
Once inside, you are greeted by the fresh herbs and chalkboards announcing the pizzas and other amazing treats.
We ordered the Vegas beats Italy pizza  as well as a plain slice for our 4 yearold.  A salad came along as well and It should not be missed.  Their pizza comes as slices and huge Pies! 
Our pizzas were devoured and even the 4 year old said it was the best pizza ever!
Fresh Pizza with fresh ingredients! Non commercial yeast. 
Amazing Cannoli made fresh for each order...
Lemonaid with fresh roasted rosemary was delightful.

Wow I can't believe this place has been here 4 years and I am just getting here...The love being shown in this resturant for the customer and food is detectable in the beautifuly prepared foods...as well as the care that is being made on the selection of what is being offered.  I wish more resturants took this much care.

I can't wait to come back and try the chicken and the others dishes.

Tried this place last week at the last minute due to yelp reviews.  This place is great and we will definitely be going back.  It doesn't look like much from the outside (I would really recommend new signage!) but we were pleasantly surprised with our dining experience.  We shared a large antipasta salad and a pizza. It came in a huge bread bowl and could easily be a meal by itself.  The pizza was fabulous.  You can tell it is made fresh, and we loved the open kitchen design.  The place is not very large which make dining in a little less comfortable than a typical sit down restaurant but we liked the unique decor and layout. The prices were very reasonable, especially for the quantity and quality of food.  Highly recommend!

Jan, 1 2016!
I haven't been in a while but the place just gets better and more innovative!
They sell beer now and Anchor was the perfect fit with the pizza I pulled off the toppings from the board. We tried their chicken wings that are stuffed with Geo's sausage and man were they good. I took my two kids and my seventy year old ma from green bay land and for an old fashioned girl like her she LOVED IT! She could tell that everything was homemade and was loving the fresh cannolis. I was impressed that Geo's boys were doing such a quality job!
A monster slice of pepperoni is enough for a teen and a five year old. I still can't solve Geo's wall puzzles without cheating.

Wow home made sauce!, it was great!
Ordered the Pork Rules pizza online.
Walked into the front door and there was a few people waiting for there orders, but I walked in and the owner says, " are you Jason?, your pie is in the hole and out shortly." Offered a drink while I waited only 5 minutes. 
Pizza looked, smelled, and tasted GREAT! Fast service, GOOD quality product, Great normal price!. I'LL BE BACK!!! 
P.S. Hole in the wall joints are always better, and this is one of those!

You MUST ask why there name is Old School! You NEED TO LEARN ABOUT YEAST AND THE HISTORY OF, or if you are a wine, or beer brewer you will understand completely and realize your at the best pizza place in town!

Gio is not just a salad he is the head Chef that is in charge of chef's.

The Cannolis are freshly made I have NEVER!, NEVER!, had one fresh and thought that they were the most daft thing's on the planet earth till I had 4 of these things, now I have to run around the block due to the GREAT REAL Cannoli experience, "they are really good!.

I have been just recently going to Old School(3-2013 4-2013) and asking the person taking my order to just make me the slice they feel fit to me...I just told that person whom ever what I liked and said make it what ever way chef's choice. EVERY TIME I had something that was tasty good full of flavor and hit the spot!  I asked one chef the convince me that anchovies can be baked on a pizza without over powering it and make it the most delicious subtle flavored piece of pie, and it was done!
The BY THE SLICE is the best value and the most flavored, I can NOT eat 2 but I have crammed 2 down and couldn't eat the rest of the day.
I now can say I HAVE ordered everything on the menu and never have I been disappointed. 
They have a really good thing going and I hope if  they make any changes they are subtle!, and  don't do like some businesses I have seen, get greedy and end up gone.  The way I see it this pizza place has a responsibility and a public service to remain part of the community.

The owners of this pizzeria have an absolute gold mine. Dont let the location fool you. There is seating for about 32 people and the atmosphere is inviting and authentic. I had the Antipasto and my husband had the Gio. They were both served on top of fresh baked italian sour dough rolls and were full of really fresh authentic produce. All of the other dishes we saw come out were incredible looking and judging from the faces of the patrons eating them, i would say they were. Maybe I was super hungry but if this place was in my home town I would eat here alot!

So, since this review I was contacted by the owner apologizing for the experience, I've been back since and enjoyed my time. 

Sincerely hoping that the berating of people is over with. 

The food is really good.

A great place to get a huge slice of pizza! We had the solo meal which was a monster slice w/ one topping and garlic knots. The cashier misunderstood us when we placed our order and one meal came without the garlic knots. They were kind enough to make us an order of garlic knots at no cost to us. The pizza and knots are delicious! Slices are huge! Wish we could have taken a pic. The service is excellent! If you are looking for a great pizza place, Old School Pizzeria is it!

Hole in the wall pizza place. Pretty big slices and it matches with the price. More of an east-coast vibe and flavor. Pretty tasty. Love their signature rosemary lemonade that come in a jar. Return the jar and you get $.50 back. Really close to Nellis AFB and will be back again for another lunch date
It may be that NY style pizza does not do much for me, but after hearing so many rave reviews about this place, I gave it a go and it was underwhelming. It is model NY pizza and nothing more.

This pizza joint is to legit let me tell you I tried it for my first time a few days ago and I cant stop thinking about it amazing I tried a small pepperoni pizza conlies and a calzone. I have personally worked for many pizzerias and have never been this impressed by the flavors of enjoyment this  place brought to my life if you havnt tried it I recommend it and if you have your a lucky person you deserve every inch of that monster slice deep in your flavor taster

Amazing, dare I say "life-changing" pizza. We make a point of dining here anytime we visit Vegas, and while its not on the trip, its definitely worth the Uber-ride North. Have the grilled rosemary lemonade, have the garlic knots, and have at least one of every pizza on the menu (we're working our way through). This place will COMPLETELY redefine your idea of pizza!!

Love the food and service!! Authentic flavors will delight your senses! We tried a Specialty pizza, garlic knots, and Cannoli! it was fabulous! The Cannoli was the best I have ever eaten! Will definitely return and share will all I our friends!

Hands down the best pizza in Las Vegas. The food here is always top notch, made with fresh ingredients! If that wasn't enough I've always had great customer service here. When you eat here don't neglect the daily specials for the pizza. If you're lucky enough to show up on an Osso Bucco day...DON'T PASS IT UP! 

Please support this awesome local business so they can continue to thrive and I can continue to eat here!!

Sometimes the diamonds are right under your feet. A wonderful atmosphere. Very inviting & cozy. Alright,  let's get to most important part as my NY style pizza quest continues here in Las Vegas! I don't give 5 stars easily, however, the Old School Pizzeria got it today. I ordered a slice with pepperoni & sausage. The slice was one of the best slices that I've had in a while in general; definitely a home run as far as pizza in Las Vegas. The crust was practically baked to perfection! The quest still continues... This joint moves into the Top 3 category. Until next time...

The best pizza I have had in a long time. Got the carnivore and a salad. I'm from the east coast and the pizza reminded me of the pizza back home, except better! The owner thanked us for coming when we left. I thought that was a nice touch. They are going to need a bigger building soon.

I have not idea why this fine establishment is located in North Las Vegas. This is by far the best pizza in Las Vegas. This is a five star establishment. The dough reminds me of my grandmothers. Treat yourself and friends and take a drive out to old school pizzeria. They are located across the street from the cannery casino in NLV.

We were out shopping and decided to find a Pizza place near home. 
Looked on YELP our go to online search,  and found Old School Pizzeria not too far away.

 It was Fantastic.
 (Most in the area suck big time, sorry I'm from NY where we know our PIZZA!) 

We entered the shop which had 4 tables with tablecloths and leather chairs. A big blackboard covered one full wall with the menu written out. 

So many interesting item to choose from. They have a fennel, mozz, grape/heirloom tomato and basil in a vinaigrette called Gio's Salad, It was delicious. 

Then our pizza came. So far I haven't never gotten roasted whole cloves of garlic on a pizza but this one had it. It was the 14inch veggie. More heirloom tomatoes, grilled mushrooms, roasted peppers, caramelized onions, eggplant and more stuff. The crust was crusty!! :) and really good. 

Loved the decor. 

If you find yourself in the area, you must get a pizza or any of the fantastic dinner selections.. They had osso buco, roasted chicken with a savory bread pudding.. stuff just sounds great. Need to try something else next time! 

Definitely a new spot for us. 

NLV is finally getting some good restaurants.

What a gem! The cannoli is in my top three ever, easily one of the best you'll find. The cream has an absolute perfect construction and the cracker has just a pinch of heaven. Get a smaller meal and two cannoli, they're that good. Onto the calzone; I got meatball and my buddies got meatball/sausage/ham. There was no grease in the calzone! The highest quality mozzarella mixed with a perfect crust with just a little flour on the outside to cost your fingers! The pizza dipping sauce was on point and warm. The setting is quaint, seven or eight tables with a soda machine and a television. Great music and the kitchen is right there to watch the dough fly into the air. Great service and good prices on top of it all!
The staff is great and the 5 Cheese Baked Mac is worth driving from L.A. to get!

This is the best pizza I've eaten in 3 years.  Light, airy crust, beautiful toppings, cooked perfectly.  Now, this is light and thin, fresh, beautiful pizza.  It's not Chicago or any bastardized pizza.  This is a New Haven style, even more so than NY, due to its lightness and flavorful crust. 

I thought the prices were inexpensive and have def paid more for slop.  Small (2-3) people is around 20 bucks which includes two toppings.  

Their menu is small and compact.  They have sandwiches and some chicken dishes.  Nice tap beers and a few wines.  Nice workers too!   I can't wait to try another pizza topping.
Great pizza, great homemade sausage!  Best pizza I've found in Vegas so far.

Delicious! Amazing pizza's and rosemary garlic knots. For $5.99 you get a huge basket of the cute knots that are seasoned to perfection. The pizza's are priced fairly for the quality and freshness that you are actually receiving in exchange. Seating can be a bit of a wait, but they accommodate you as much as possible! We had to wait at most 15 minutes but our food was just ordered so it didn't really matter too much as diners come and go. I planned to take it to go if nothing had opened, but alas, a nice table did! They also have a wine bottle deal if you take your order to go, so there's that extra if you do find yourself unwilling to wait for an open table. Everyone here is very nice, excellent customer service. The cashier even let us taste the wines so that we could pick the best one! How awesome is that?!

Sometimes those hole in the wall places are gold mines. I have two favorite pizza places close to home that I frequent because they offer a great priced pizza and awesome service. However, this place offers a gourmet pizza with a side of sticker shock....ouch, a $30.00 pizza! But, what you are getting is not your typical pizza. 

I was amazed by the fresh ingredients, the amazing flavor of the cheese, and the fact that the pizza didn't ooze with oil all over my hands and face. All the sauces are made in the restaurant, they are organic, and the dough is made daily. I had the Vegas Meets Italy - this is a must try.

While there, I decided to try a couple other things. I had the Gio Salad. It is made with fennel instead of lettuce and was served in a sour dough bowl. I loved it! I also had the stuffed chicken wings. Curiosity got me on this one, as I had to try it just because it was such a foriegn concept. I was absolutely amazed by the flavor of this stuffed chicken wing. You will be too! 

I washed everything down with their homemade lemonade in a mason jar! Another big hit with me.

Somewhere between leaving a pizzeria restaurant and arriving at home, I usually have a stomach ache from too much dairy and bread. I firmly believe there must be some truth to the intolerance to gluten being in the gliadin and glutanin process, because I feel great. Honestly, I had just thought suffering to have pizza was a way of life :) 

I will be back!

I can't say enough how thankful I am to have found this place. The owner AND the employees all are passionate about creating amazing food. Probably bar none some of the most creative pizzas I've ever had and far and away the "most healthy"... beyond that the daily specials are some of the best food I've had in Vegas and that includes some very overpriced meals from strip restaurants. I'm writing a review because I hope other people get lucky enough to stumble upon what is now my favorite place to eat out. Thanks guys for good food and conversation!

As far as the menu is concerned the best part is amazing options. The favorites are always available (vegas meets italy pizza for example).  And then there are the daily specials like Osobuco or home made macaroni and cheese (five different cheeses I believe). I'm still working through the menu and just can't get enough.

I can't recommend this enough if you are in Las Vegas / North Las Vegas.
Top 3 best pizzerias in Las Vegas. One of the best doughs I ever had in Vegas or New York. If I lived closer I would at least once a month. Highly recommend this place. Excellent pizza.

By the slice. Amazing. 
You probably don't need a second slice. They are HUGE! Non descriptive building on the outside. Real nice on the inside. Great staff and service. They have a couple draft beers and a nice wine selection. If in the area, we highly recommend. 
And we will be back.

This place is amazing.  I've had pizza, calzones and the chef special (crazy good chicken).  All the food is amazing (really amazing).  The best and most unique thing about this place is the pride that the employees take in preparing the food, greeting the guests and just taking care of the establishment.  I'm very impressed with this place and always make myself a regular when in town.

I went last night with my family after rave reviews from trusted foodie friends.  I thought it was fine.  Just that- fine.  We had a our nephew's kids with us so we got a few pies.  A large cheese for the kiddos and a  large half Vegas meets Italy/ half Pork Reigns.  We also ordered a full order of the knots.  I will start with those.  The dipping sauce was delicious and the knots were good.  Ours were a little over done, but I like thinks crisp so I was pleased.  Our pizza's were good.  The crust was excellent.  There are only a few places that get the nod from me as far as crusts go.  (I am a Boston girl and we Bostonians care as much about our crust as all those New Yorkers do.) The rest of the pizza, sauce, cheeses, toppings, were just okay.  Nothing special, but good enough.  Hands down better than any chain in the valley.  It's REAL pizza, but not nearly as good as every mom and pop shop on the corners of the town I grew  up in Massachusetts.
