If you are looking for gourmet ingredients and preparation OLD SCHOOL PIZZERIA is it! The pizza is enormous is size, quality and taste! Salad is also incredible! Be sure to try their homemade Rosemary lemonade!GOOD!

I have been meaning to try this place. The menu seems pretty interesting. I walked in, at a time, when I thought it wasn't too busy. I was wrong. I guess they had some big catering going on, and they seemed to be racing against time. Working in the F&B industry, I understand. I ordered a Calzone with applewood smoked bacon and spinach. Also, the one thing that caught my attention, Rosemary and garlic Knot bread. with their ranch, that had a hint of rosemary spice to it, best part of the meal. Great flavor, they say that they use a natural leavening dough, meaning everything is natural even the yeast, takes longer to cook, longer to proof, had a sourdough taste to it. Great appetizer. Next, to the Calzone, it was average. I don't know what it was but nothing stood out. I've had different types of ricotta. This one was not appetizing at all. Dough was a little undercooked. I am not sure if it's just my personal preference but I wasn't a big fan of their dough, as other yelper's are stating that they have really good pizza dough. Maybe I am just so used to instant yeast and high-gluten flour, that I maybe missing something. anyways,  What saved it was the mozzarella and the other toppings. Great portion with the sauce, and bonus points for using Cristofer Columbo tomatoes. Great product, as I have used those in the past. I might try some other things here in the near future, maybe a slice next time. Service was kind of slow, but like I said It seemed like they were busy in the back.

I'm back in Vegas and as soon as I got unpacked this was the first place I went. I took my coworkers who haven't been lucky enough to come before and of course they weren't disappointed. Started off with one of my favorites, the super great garlic rosemary bread knots that come with the actual roasted garlic cloves and rosemary sprig they use to flavor them. Super warm, super aromatic, and of course super tasty. My coworkers were hooked already, I just smiled and told them to wait for the pizza. Once that came of course they became the addicts that I already was and I knew they would fiend for more Old School. Of course they are hooked and we've already brought plenty other coworkers here just to watch that shocked look on their face at how good everything is. On top of that, still a really outstanding staff. Really nice people, real funny, they just help give this place a nice relaxed feel.

Also to the negative reviews. If you don't like this place for any reason, or think it's less than 5 star worthy than I truly believe you just hate food. That's it. There's really no other explanation.

Ok. This place is legit!!!! We found it on Yelp!!!
Thank you YELP!!!! From the Pizza Crust to the Burrata Cheese, was such mouthwatering experience. The New York meets Vegas Pizza was definitely our favorite. Our son is a Heath freak, but they even had Roasted Chicken and Rosemary Fingerling Potatoes.  Huge portions and huge taste.  We went back 3 days in a road. 
I think we gained about 3 to 5 pounds but so worth every little bite.  This place is a must on a Las Vegas trip.
Great pizza, amazing rosemary garlic knots and delicious salad. The pizza crust was awesome.

First off, the food is  damn delicious. The monster slice combos are a great, affordable lunch option. Stuffed wings are a good side or app, but you can't skip the garlic rosemary knots- they're accompanied by several pieces of spreadably-soft roasted garlic! The antipasto salad is loaded with fresh ingredients and flavor, and makes a good lunch for those looking for a healthy option. 

This spot is noteworthy in that they use naturally leavened dough, as well as organic and artisan toppings and ingredients. The whole pizzas are pricey ($20-30) but use quality ingredients.. and can feed an entire crowd. If you want to impress at your next Superbowl party, this is definitely your spot.

I initially felt that serving the pizza with a side of ranch dressing went against that whole "old school" vibe, but it's actually a garlic-mascarpone dip! Unfortunately, the service has been borderline on every visit. Most recently, there were three people working and 4 tables covered in trash and dirty dishes in the middle of the afternoon and the space is already small with limited seating.

That said, the great food will keep me coming back all the way across town, regardless. Someday I'll get around to the porchetta sandwich, the grilled rosemary lemonade, and that chicken dish, but so far I'm in love with the pizza and haven't been able to resist ordering that.

Best pizza in town, seriously. These guys know what they're doing. The 'Vegas Meets Italy' pizza is my #1. The garlic knots are also a must especially with that creamy white sauce they serve with it. YUM :P

Living full time on the road,  one thing we do miss is real...good...pizza. This place nailed it!! From the antipasto salad for 2 served in a warm, fresh bread bowl (why has this not been done before??!!) to the vegetarian pizza.  Small place, no flash. Great food and friendly service. We will definitely return to this spot!

Artisan pizza, This place is the real deal. You can immediately tell that everything here is made with attention to detail. This is how authentic pizza was intended to be served. Stuffed chicken wings were top quality as well. 

The place has a bit of a hipster vibe which I didn't care for but did not take away from the dining experience. Pricing was very fair and the portions were generous. One of my favorite pizza restaurants in Las Vegas. This place has earned its reputation. I will definitely drop by again.

I hadn't been home in 2 years and because of that I had created a loooooong list of places to visit (for food, of course - who cares about anything else?) and intended on visiting most of them during my vacation.

One of the places at the top of my list was Biaggio's. With everything going on, I just didn't find the time to do a lot of things that I wanted to, but I was adamant about trying a new pizza place. 

While looking up Biaggio's, I came across Old School Pizzeria and noticed it was much closer. We decided to save ourselves an hour of driving and we stopped in on a whim.

I took my cousin and her son, and we decided to dine in and split two large pizzas and bring any leftovers to our family.

We immediately chose the Calabrese and the Five Cheese. I like knowing that they let their dough rise for 36 hours. Awesome.

The kid that wanted CiCi's Pizza a few minutes earlier was in heaven eating Old School Pizzeria and his mind was somewhere else. He kept asking for more and more and more. Keep in mind - he is the pickiest eater I know.

I love their salame and the cheeses they put on the Five Cheese were top-notch.

We finished up, took our leftovers to everyone waiting at my Grandpa's house (aunts, uncles, grandpa, cousins, mom, dogs...you know), and they all started digging in. Apparently we didn't bring enough left overs for everyone, so my aunt called them and order two MORE pizzas for pick-up.

We returned AGAIN and this time I saw cannolis sitting on the counter, so I added 3 of those as well.

We were in a hurry, so we paid & grabbed the pizzas. When we returned, the pizzas weren't what we ordered. One of them barely had cheese and did not have the calabrese salame that we ordered. My aunt is Italian, so she keeps rolls of salame in the fridge. We sliced it and added it to the pizza ourselves. That part was disappointing. The other pizza was quite a bit smaller than the box. My aunt also ordered garlic knots...without the garlic. She's nutty.

They are becoming more popular by the second, the person making our pizzas was in training, and I'm sure they'll need to hire more people with the volume of food being ordered and made already.

I have high hopes for this place. Consistency is key. They will need to either expand or get more locations.
I don't live in Vegas, but I introduced my family to this pizza place on accident, and I'm sure they will continue to order pizzas here.

I had to try this place from recommendations from a fellow co-worker.  the outside is very underestimating as the inside is on a whole other level. It is comfy, cozy, and the music is awesome. keeps a positive train of thought as you wait for your pizza. the wait was long but expected as they make the pizza right in front of you.. Literally they have a glass wall and you can watch them make the pizza. I had no problems waiting as the final product was ridiculous! ! we had the 18" with cheese, eggplant, caramelized onions, sauteed mushrooms, roasted garlic, pepperoni, and olives. along with their garlic rosemary knots. the pizza was great, the marinara sauce was very flavorful but not overpowering.  the mozzarella cheese tasted fresh, the toppings were very flavorful and did not disappoint at all! pizza was on another level from others ive tried in my opinion and is highly recommended. the garlic rosemary knots are awesome. the knots are a bit dense and tough but after all it is a knot lol! but I didnt mind as the garlic and rosemary was very intense and was a great surprise as the knots ive had around town fall way short on the flavor category, not these though! They are perfect and a must try with their pizza. oh I also ordered their cannoli and I am currently waiting to try them as I am stuffed!! we finished half the pizza and there was two of us and I am satisfied! ! if you like pizza and havent tried this place, put your usual pizza spot on hold for once and go here it will not dissapoint!!

Update: so I had the cannoli!  It was good. It did however taste like a twist on what a canoli im used to taste like. It has the look. The shell is good and crispy, very dense shell. The filling to me tasted like a cream cheese/ cinnamon cream filling. It was good, just not what I expected. Try it out and let me know what you all think??

THE best pizza I've ever had in my life. Hands down that dipping sauce did change my life ranch is never the same. Super fresh ingredients crunchy amazing crust I can't explain to you how good this place is:) you have to try it yourself! Thank you guys!

Amazing pizza, great quality! From the same family that owns Nora's Italian here in town. Drop by and grab a slice, but not during dinner Friday or Saturday, they get backed up with to-go orders. Grab a cannoli too, they're awesome!

Really good pizza. This is my favorite pizza place in Las Vegas. And they have such great service. Friendly staff, clean restaurant presenting a very welcoming environment. Food was ok and prices were fair.

It's in the dough! The pizza dough is incredible. It's springy yet chewy. Crisp bottom and crust. The pizza dough has the perfect amount of salt and there has got to be some fresh garlic or garlic powder in there somewhere giving it such a full bodied mouth watering flavor. When the dough is this good the pizza makes itself. The sauce and cheese are great too and fresh. I sat next to the pizza making window while waiting for my order and the smell of fresh basil nearly drove me insane (in a good way). This place knows what it's doing. Fresh, delicious and made with passion. The only reason I give 4 stars is while the pizza is awesome it's just too pricey.

Passed by the place dozens of times and always thought it was out of business.  Tried it tonight and its really good.  Tried the plain cheese pizza and was impressed, good pizza and good value as well.

July 9, 2015: Our good friends recommended Old School so we battled the mid-day traffic to check it out. We walked in the front door and stood at the counter for at least five minutes before a young man finally, and hurriedly took our order. FIVE MINUTES we stood at the counter with no one in front of us and four different employees said to us, "We'll be with you in just a minute." Really? Then we realized that a tech from So. NV Health District had just walked in the door. Side note: When we walked in the door there were three dirty tables that had not been cleared. So the health district lady made the crew nervous. I get that but to put us off for over five minutes? Then I noticed the "B" Health District placard on the wall. It's always nice to see an "A". Food: They forgot to put a certain ingredient on my wife's slice and delivered two slices to me when I ordered just one. I wondered why I was paying $36 for three slices of pizza and two half-orders of garlic knots. Messy restaurant, B-rating, poor service, and the pizza is no better than our all-time favorite... (un-named). Would I drive from the Northwest to Craig & Cannery Row for pizza again from Old School Pizza? No. Oh ya, the guy behind the counter told us that the owner/chef is on vacation. Everyone needs some down time but Chef, find someone you can trust to maintain your business. After all, it's your name hanging out there.
Food was excellent and service was great ! Nice authentic pizza . Loved the geo salad and is literally the best pizza in Vegas ! You have to try it out can't wait for my next visit.

Recommend it!

Reasonable price for an artisan slice of pizza.
Good quality and consistency.

Clean and friendly staff.

This place is awesome!! They serve the best thin crust pizza I had ever had, if not the very best pizza. The crust was thin yet soft, the ranch dipping sauce made eating the pizza difficult in a sense that I didn't know which I liked better; pizza without the ranch was delicious and the pizza with the ranch was amazing, too.

5 stars in the sense that I need to call my dad and tell him about how amazing the pizza I had for lunch was!

I'm shocked how I have 8 friends on Yelp who rated this 5 stars. Maybe I went on a bad day??

I've been wanting to try this place for a long time since it was highly rated by friends, but unfortunately it was a disappointment. It was a 40 minute drive from my house one way, so for driving that far for food it better be good. A friend and I ordered for 2 couples and we spent $80. I think that is pretty high to feed 4 people for this casual of a restaurant where you order at the counter and sit down to wait for your food. I would be fine with the price if the food was outstanding. 

Let me start with the positive-garlic knots. They were amazzzzzing! Everything about them I loved, they were perfect. 

Now on to the not so good-the pizza

Carnivore Pizza-this pizza had a pretty good taste (and I hate tons of meat on pizza). It was greasy. I would never order this kind of pizza on my own but it was for my friend's hubby and my hubby. I ended up eating a slice of this one because I disliked the one I got. 

5 cheese pesto- I love pesto and I love different kinds of cheese, and I love when I order this pizza at most other pizza restaurants. What happened? The taste was bland, how can pesto be bland? The pizza was so overcooked that the crust had a crunch to it. Not a slight crunch but a crispy cracker fall apart when you bite it crunch. I like when the cheese is gooey and soft on a pizza, but this was hardened if that makes sense and all the cheeses became one taste. The whole pizza was a no go for me or anyone in my group for that matter. 
The pictures on yelp of this pizza look soooooo different than what I got, so I assume our pizza was just overcooked. We also ordered a slice of pizza that was around $8, can't remember the exact cost but I thought that was steep for one slice. She wanted the white anchovy pizza and it looked like fake pizza when it arrived. The plastic food look. It was weird. I think they had a slide of cheese that they had maybe baked earlier in the day and put 2 anchovies on top and maybe one other topping, but the toppings were sparse and since it obviously was not made as a whole pizza and baked with the toppings, it did not have a really unique taste since the topping were just placed on top. I like the idea of being able to order one slice of pizza of the one you want, but for the price this is too high and the pizza did not seem freshly made. 

Looking back, I was trying one of the chef's specialties because I thought those would be the best. I always like to try the basic specialty for my first time before I go ordering something different at a restaurant and customizing it to what I want. Maybe I should have just customized in the first place. 

My friends at the next table ordered the Pork Reigns and this was a greasy greasy pizza-did not like. 

We ordered the Bruschetta with burrata (sounded soooo yummy) and paid for it, then the guy who took our order came up to us and said they don't have it. We got a different appetizer that was bread with a salty salty spread that I could not eat due to the high salt factor. 

My other friend ordered an octopus salad that I tried and did not like, and neither did she or anyone else. She said it was rubbery and tough. 

What also irritated me was the guy who took our order came to our table and started quickly cleaning up and grabbing things and grabbed the garlic knots in a flash before I could say anything! He stacked something on top and by then, it was ruined. I was irritated he did not ask if we were done and just assumed and took the best part of the meal away! The garlic knots!!!

I really wanted to like it!
Love this place!! You can't go wrong with any salad..they have amazing pizza and garlic knots with a dip..sooooo good! You have to try it!! YUMMMMMY!!!!!

Saw the great yelp reviews and decided to give it a try. 
My husband called and placed the pizza order. I picked it up. The employees there are super cool, super nice. They even let me try the rosemary lemonade that's made in house. 
 
Got some paper plates, parmesan cheese, crushed peppers, and napkins to take home.
 
The pizza was DELECTABLE! We loved every bite. Couldn't finish the whole thing of course, but we'll save the rest for tomorrow. 
We'll definitely be ordering from here again!

Holy cow! This place is truly a diamond in the rough. North Las Vegas has the pizza place that I have been looking for. The service was great, very friendly. The food was amazing! The crust of our pizza was great. The sauce was perfect. The ingredients were bar none quality. If you like bacon I highly recommend getting any pizza with at least the bacon.
Pizza was absolutely delicious. The staff was friendly and the place was cute and cozy.
Love the monster slice with home made sausage and roasted mushrooms. Sour dough crust is the best.

OMG this is by far the best pizza in Vegas! The crust is outstanding! The servers were so nice. I had the vegetarian pizza special and it was excellent. They serve beer and wine too. There are only a few tables so service is great. So glad they opened another in the northwest. I can't wait to go again.

This used to be my favorite pizza place until today.  My husband & I always order our pizza online & pick it up which is what we did today.  My husband gets there & is told they don't have a pizza for him they don't know what he's talking about, then they realize oh we gave it to the previous customer who just left.  The previous customer comes back after he realizes it's not his pizza and since it's the biggest sized pizza box drops it all over the floor.  My husband asks for a refund & the the response was it's an online order so it'll take 3-5 days to go back onto your card but I can make you another one if you wait.  Really?  As someone who worked in customer service management the correct answer would be I'm so very sorry that this has happened & I will reverse the charges and make you a new pizza if you'd please wait.  Guess we have to find a new pizza place.

Surprise gem in the area, very authentic!  Very fresh ingredients, amazing flavors. Antipasto salad comes in a delicious bread bowl. Large pizza has 10 slices and  our family of five left satisfied. Friendly staff. Dine in area is small but a nice atmosphere.

Old School Pizzeria has delicious pizzas and fantastic service. There is something about their dough is very tasty.  Their prices are a bit on the high side but they load up the pizza with quality ingredients. I always get my pizza to go as it is on my way home but think they offer delivery. There are several pizza places in the area and this is my favorite. I've been wanting to try some of their other offerings but always end up with a large pizza.

Exceptionally authentic pizza.  It's worth the price.  I rarely stray from the "Calabrese" because it is the closest taste to homemade food (from Calabria, Italy).  And to put them way over the 5-stars, they make the cannoli filling without contaminating them with chocolate chips - original cannoli's are made plain or with candied fruit, not chocolate!  Bravo!  Keep it up!

I give this place 4 stars easy. They're pork pizza is rich and flavorful and they offer a huge size which is great for kids and parties.  Their mushrooms and topping seem super fresh and the garlic marscapone is icing on the cake.  I've been here at least 4 times and will keep coming back, it's even worth the drive for a nice date nite or lunch date.
The best I've had in Vegas...EVER! Such a small place with a HUGE following...everyone I work with LOVES  this place.

Things I love about Old School Pizzeria:

- Monster (and they mean it when they say it) pizza slices that were seriously, honestly, and truly the biggest pizza slices I've ever seen. The group of brawny construction workers next to us were moaning and whining that it was too much food for them (!!!) and I MAYBE ate half of mine. Major kudos to my boyfriend who conquered his whole slice. 

- The riddles on the wall. What a fun way to spend the wait for food! 

- The fresh ingredients, unique combinations, and amazing flavors. My slice of pizza came with this amazing salad that had a mascarpone garlic dressing -- I still dream about that dressing, and we ate there a week ago!

- Their sizes... Tonight, we are ordering the "OMG!" size pie for an informal dinner party. One pizza promises to feed 5 or 6 people. Where else can you find a pizza that big that still tastes amazing?!

If you're in the area, go go go! I just adore this little place.
The food here is absolutely delicious; the pizza with their garlic sauce is FANTASTIC!! We've been coming here since they first opened. Staff is amazing too and very nice!
Cool little spot close across the Cannery movie theatre. Worth a stop before you go watch a movie!

Just moved to North Las Vegas and oh man is it hard to find good food in this area! So happy I got to try this place out. 

FOOD:
Bruschetta (5 stars): Found burrata in North Las Vegas! Whatttt? And it was AMAZING!! Basically like a burrata caprese with bread on the side.  The bread was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, the olive oil and aged balsamic had so much flavor, the heirloom tomatoes were so sweet and basil is just always good. Everything went perfectly together. I was in heaven. Just get it.

Monster slice of pizza (4 stars): Made a custom pizza slice with mushrooms, garlic, and tomatoes. The pizza is thin and crust is crunchy underneath which I liked a lot. The tomato sauce on it was really good, and the ingredients tasted fresh. The slice is huge!  Had some oil accumulating on top so I just soaked that up to be a little healthier, haha. You can do one of their specialty pizzas as a monster slice as well. 

Rosemary Garlic Knots (4 stars): You can definitely taste the garlic, and there's a hint of rosemary which is good so it's not too overpowering. Comes with ranch. 

SERVICE (5 stars):
Everyone was so nice and really cared if we enjoyed the food.

If anything go on Tuesday for the burrata bruschetta and you will not be disappointed. Especially if you love burrata as much as me. They have other specials for the rest of the week too. Such fancy dishes for a pizza restaurant, love it. I'll definitely be coming back here.
One slice and rosemary knits 10.00 not worth it. Pizza was soo freaking dry. Will never go back again.

Is it truly that good? Answer: Yes, yes it is. Go, get the knots. Go, get the pie. Across the street from the Cannery Casino parking structure in a strip mall. Go. You only live once. This place needs to be on your piehole's bucket list. Full order of knots and a small pie with a fountain drink, less than $24. Worth...every...penny. Go.

I'm updating my review as the owner contacted me to resolve the experience I previously had. He was very friendly and very concerned with what happened on my visit to his pizzeria. 

I am very happy with him reaching out to me and asking for details about my experience. We wanted so much love this place and support little local businesses  . Plus, the lemonade is amazing and the decor is so darn cute. 

I am more than happy to go back and give this place another try on a good day. Perhaps, I just had a rare experience. With the customer service I received from the owner, I'm certain my next visit will be much improved. I look forward to trying a pie and more lemonade in the near future.
Staff was very friendly! Food was amazing! Took my kids with me and for being small they made it comfortable and easy with kids!
Great ,small ,friendly Italian restaurant. Our salad in the bread bowl was magical and the pizza was hot bubbly goodness. Definitely will be back

This place is so oooooooooooooh good! Everything is made fresh,  so expect to wait a little.  The staff is super friendly and helpful - if you don't know what to get,  just ask them. Also ... order the rosemary lemonade! It's super delish for a lemonade

My first time going to this pizzeria place and I was actually pretty surprized, the food was really really good. Lot's of flavor on the pizza, the garlic knows were amazing. They have puzzles on the board you get to try and solve and if you guess it right they give you a free canolli. They also gave us free dessert from a catering that they did which was really nice to go way out of the way for us. I will diffently be returning here. Prices are very resonable and well worth it.

I love Old School Pizzeria! This place has never let me down once since first coming here! I bought some stuffed chicken wings with sausage and a traditional 14'' cheese pizza. The chicken wings are about 5-6" long plus the chicken is tender and the sausage is sweet...but the best part is, NO BONES! [Just the end] 98% meaty! These wings are to die for! The pizza is perfect and my personal opinion is the crust makes or breaks the pizza and let me tell you OSP always delivers!

this IS the best pizza in las vegas. Hard to think this place is just down my office and i have always passed by almost everyday. no fuss menu and owners that are really passionate on their pizza. give this a try, you will not be disappointet

I am going to give 5 start to keep that rating a 4.5 or more! They are not exactly a 5, but not 4..4.5 is where the place should be! Great crust, great salad, great ranch, great service and a great atmosphere of a non corporate pizza parlor! The only place in Vegas that is in any league with Grimaldi's and you can get it by the (MASSIVE) Slice!

Oh man the pizza is delicious here! Fresh out of the oven when I got my order steam was just flying out the pizza as we cut it. The ingredients tasted very fresh and the customer service is pretty great too with complimentary dipping dressing. I loved the pizza and highly recommend and I will go back soon.

We stumbled upon this restaurant because it was close to where we were when hunger struck, but don't let distance be the deciding factor on whether to come and try some of Chef Gio's amazing food, just come.   The menu offers pizzas with a myriad of delectable toppings such as homemade sausage, caramelized onions and roasted mushrooms.   We each had pizza slices with cheese and personalized toppings.   They were humongous and delicious with fresh veggies and meats and lots of flavor packed into the sauce and cheese.  So good.  Dip one of those slices in their garlic marscapone sauce and you'll forget ranch dressing was even a thing.  And it bears repeating that the pizza slices are ginormous.  They are serious about size and no one is going home hungry.  

I also had a Gio's salad on the side.  (Tomato, cucumber, fennel, onion and mozzarella with a house vinaigrette)  the salad was perfectly composed with a great balance of flavors from the acidity of the dressing  and the cool creaminess of the mozzarella.  Just yummy.  (Also, if you order a full size salad it is served in a bread bowl.  Yes please!)

So glad we found this place and I will absolutely be back!  I am looking forward to trying their organic chicken dinner with potatoes and stuffing or one of the daily specials.  This place was a pot of gold at the end of my google search.
Outstanding family recipes. Flavors you won't find just everywhere like pizza with mozzarella, dates, goat cheese, prosciutto and arugila. We will be regulars! Very good!

The first time I went, it was absolutely delicious and couldn't wait to go back. The second time I went they forgot my cannolis. They do not deliver and I live a little over 20 min away so there was no point in driving all the way back to get them. When I called about it, instead of giving me a refund, they put a $5 credit attached to my number ( I paid a little more than that for them) and the food was not as good as I remembered it to be the first time around. I was disappointed in the results, so I have not been back since.

This place makes great-tasting pizzas and calzones made with fresh ingredients and old-school italian flavor.  We had the Pork Rules pizza and my sister-in-law had the Egggplant Parm calzone.  They have huge portions at reasonable prices.  Their salads are amazing too, served in a bread bowl.
The owner was super nice, and the free gelato (Yelp checkin) was a nice finish.
Delicious food and great value!

The pizza is great, the service lousy. I've picked up at least a half dozen times over the past six months, and I don't remember once the pie being ready when they said it would be. Twice the pizza wasn't even started (like tonight). The employees are nice and apologetic, but I'm tired of "we have an oven down " and "we are having system problems " excuses. You are making pizza, not putting a man on the moon. Hundreds of establishments in LV are able to do this for their customers.  I'm going to find one of those.

This is an excellent pizza place. It's small, but has a cool vibe and decor. You can write on the walls with chalk! You order at the counter, take a seat, and they bring your order to you.

You can order pizza by the slice (and it's a HUGE slice) or a full pie in various sizes. They have a menu of speciality pizzas or you can create your own. 

When our pizza arrived, it was tasty, but completely burned all over the bottom. We weren't sure whether or not to say anything. We eventually did and they immediately apologized (numerous times) and made us a brand new pizza. Which was just great customer service.

You can eat in, take it out, or even have it delivered via various delivery services. I'll definitely be dining here again when I'm in the neighborhood.

Im from Chicago and a Pizza fan.. I can eat pizza every single day all day long. This pizza is one of the best I have had.  Ever! (here in Vegas anyway).  Even though right in front of my face Owner Giovanni decides to pick up garlic knots that fell right to the ground and decided to put them back.  Yuk! Luckily for me, it doesnt stop me from coming back because I believe in 5 second rules.  Just ironic that he continued to do that despite the fact that I was standing and staring right at him.  Makes me wonder what other things he picks up from the floor.

My favorite casual dining place to bring clients, friends and family. Delicious thin crust, a good variety of fresh toppings and a friendly staff make this a place I'll happily return to again and again when in the area.
This was so delicious! Toppings are tasty and fresh. Pizza was served fairly quick, and the small was huge! Plenty for 2-3 and then some! Would definitely recommend, and plan to come back.

The atmosphere of this place as you walk in is amazing, there is a smell of fresh ingredients and pizza. We ordered a small pizza 2 drinks and a single slice. The pizza was amazing hands down some of the best in Vegas the only complaint is the prices are extremely high. 

4 out 5 price the only downfall.
The best pizza joints in the area.  Their carnivore pizza is better than any other meat lover's pizza I have ever tasted.

We came here because it's across from the movie theatre, and the pizza joint inside is pretty lackluster. We ordered a small pepperoni pizza and a half order of the garlic knots. They came with a type of marscapone aioli that was really tasty and kind of reminded me of ranch dip. The knots themselves are sourdough based and come with roasted garlic cloves and rosemary sprigs. So goood--I stole all the garlic! 
The pizza was really great--it had a slight char to the thin crust, enough sauce and cheese, a great texture, and the flavor was there. Everything was delicious. I wish I had room to try a cannoli or something, but alas. The garlic knots filled me up. 
We sat at the table next to the prep, so we could watch the chef whip up the pizzas. The drinks and silverware are self-serve, but they bring everything out. It's a quaint little place that has great pizza. Stop on in!

Every time I come here....they never have slices of pizza...thwy always want me to wait 20 min for 2 slices of pizza....i couldn't tell you how the pizza taste cause they always leave me hanging...been there 3 times and Every time I've left empty handed.....

The grilled Rosemary lemonade will change your life. I had a slice of The vegetariana, which was good but I really want to try Vegas meets Italy (but you'll need a group to eat it since it only comes in full pizzas).
Great place to eat, the Calabrese is one of our favorites. Place is clean and service is great. A bit small but worth the wait.

I have been on the hunt for GREAT pizza since moving to vegas. Not good pizza, not ok pizza... GREAT pizza. I think i finally found it in these guys. simply perfect and fresh. only down side of me is its far from my house. but absolutely worth the drive. probably better that its farther - otherwise i would gain 400 lbs eating here 4 nights a week :)

I so desperately want to give this place five stars but the tiniest of seating area prohibits me from doing so. With that said the food here is absolutely delicious. As noted by other reviewers it is on the pricey side but I feel the quality ingredients makes up for it. Again the "monster slice" is enormous and the deal with a drink and salad is awesome. I've also had the garlic knots and stuffed wings and they are equally as mouth watering. A way more authentic pizza place in the heart of North Las Vegas is a true gem!

The best cannolis in the world.  I don't even like cannolis.  I don't know what they do to the filling but it is simply amazing. I brought my mother and made her get one. She didn't want to but I insisted. She liked it so much she bought 2 more to bring home.  YUMMY!!!!
Great pizza! Reminded me of pizza I had in Italy. Very fresh ingredients. Loved the olives they use.

Best pizza I've ever had. 

Walking in, the pricing seemed a little high for what I thought was a small local pizza joint ($18 for a small pizza?). Nah. I was wrong.

CRUST: For their pizzas and garlic knots they use a sourdough crust that they let rest for days in advance. Every bite has that CRUNCH outside and softness inside.
TOPPINGS: All ingredients fresh and high quality. Flavors worked great.

I also got a cannoli here which was pretty great. Seemed like a regular cannoli but the chef told me they do some kind of deliscious twist on it, but I don't know enough about cannolis to tell you what and I forgot what he said. I was too busy thinking "holy ****, this cannoli is good".

I had a craving for arancini and this place came up. Unfortunately when I called,  they no longer make it.  :( however I was still craving old school Italian. So I called 20 mins b4 they closed and ordered a pie. Sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms and extra cheese. I was just hoping it would be halfway decent because I have a hard time finding good pizza after living in Boston ... and being Italian. Boy what an awesome surprise! Fantastic sauce, fresh and well seasoned, thin sliced sausage instead of that crumble crap and sauteed mushrooms! And to top it off, they piped me three fresh cannoli I decided I wanted at the last minute. My Pops couldn't say enough good about the crust and toppings. And the cannoli made his night. We def will be back. Hopefully they will have a special and have arancini again some day :)

I've lived by this pizzeria for many years and never thought about checking it out because the outside looks kinda sketchy, but me and my boyfriend where tired of all the same food places around us we decided to finally give this place a try. We called to put in our order but you can also go online, we ordered a classic small pizza  with pepperoni and it's good for 2-3 people (depending how hungry you are lol) it was about $15 bucks I think. It tasted great, you can definitely tell that it's all freshly made and it's honestly way better then the Pieology that's near by that place is expensive and the last time we went they pocketed the cash we gave them for the pizza in front of us (there employees don't care), so I'm glad I found a good pizza place to replace them, the people in this place seems like they care and are friendly.

Best pizza in town! For real!! I've been a customer since it opened and I've never been let down. 

Chef Gio makes his own dough. A lot of the meats are also house made. Not only is the pizza good, but so are the other dishes. The salads are fresh and the garlic knots are delicious. The canolis are the best I've ever had. I would eat anything out of that kitchen. 

The staff is always friendly and welcoming. Service is quick and the atmosphere is good. 

I recommend this restaurant to all of my friends and have never heard anything but good news. I've hooked them all!!! Seriously can't think of anything bad to say. I wish my stomach was bigger so I could fit more Old School in it. Give this restaurant a try, you won't regret it!!!!

I hail from San Diego, with plenty of old world style pizzerias. The Vegas Meets Italy is by far one of the most unique and flavorful specialty pizzas I've ever had. You might be spooked by the toppings, but trust me they make an excellent pizza become a superb pizza. The man at the counter bet me that I would come back before I return to CA- he's right, I will. A High five to Old School Pizzeria!

Bought a burned pizza, black on the bottom.  Took it back &  Dan replaced it free.  The 2nd one was still dark on the bottom.  Dan said it was undercooked on top & Chef Gio wouldn't let him sell it if he were there.  I said if it's too dark on the bottom & undercooked on top, there's something wrong with the oven.  Dan said what did I expect with a 25 year old oven?  I took the pie home & all my guests hated it.  Half the pie was thrown away because it was burned on the bottom.  I've had pies there that I believe were the best in town.  I think the problem is Dan's attitude/ego.  So I'm not going back until Chef Gio gets Dan under control or gets a new oven.
Pretty darn good pizza. I like their different selection of toppings. Cool atmosphere and very nice staff

i may not love pizza as much as other folks i know...hubby, ahem!  
i may not be able to eat pizza every single day for every single meal like other folks i know...hubby, ahem!
but i think i can safely say that i've had enough pizza in my time to know when i'm having a good pie.
and, boy, does OSP just tickle my pizza pickle.
that made no sense but i digress.

the dough is definitely the best i've had in vegas to date.
it has the perfect flavor, the perfect consistency, the perfect perfect perfect...it's perfection.
the garlic knots with that ricotta cheese whatever dipping sauce, i could probably eat a dozen by myself.
i've only had the pizza and the knots here but that's really all you need to have here.
i'm sure the rest of the food is great too and i'm sure i'll eventually get to other parts of the menu, but until then, i'm happy with pizza and knots.

now...when are they gonna open up more locations???
i think it's time. =)

This comment is way overdue (since the summer). My family and I were  looking for a great pizzeria and we searched on Yelp. Based on previous reports we decided to try this place. The food is excellent! The only minus is that the place is hard to find. Can't wait to try it again!

This place is by far the North Town's best kept secret. It is an incredibly low key locale with a deliciously and surprisingly high quality food. It's a pizzeria with the most authentic tasting and looking pie in the whole Valley, but their best stuff is the sausage stuffed chicken wings followed by crazy good chicken and specialty salads. It's a quaint and cozy rustic feeling, hole in the wall where "Vegas meets Italy", "The pork Reigns" and "old School is hardcore" all in one place. The staff is courteous, hardworking and very down to earth.  Hand picked by the genius, Chef Gio himself, just like the high quality pure food ingredients, the crew are an extension of his genuine hospitality. Oh and I almost forgot the Cannoli and the grilled rosemary lemonade are out of this world. You must get some just go before it's gone. You'll thank me later. You're welcome!

The crust wasnt the best.  It was like bubble gum. They didnt put any chicken on my pizza. It was basically a chesse pizza with olives. Mine you I order 3 toppings.  I can say they do put a nice amount of sauce on there pizzas. But next time im hungry ill get chipotles or my usual dominoes pizza. I wish that had chicago style pizza in las vegas. Home run inn would be blazing right now.

After my initial visit, I only praised the gelato at Old School Pizzeria. My first review is now obsolete because they no longer offer gelato. I've been back twice, and I still haven't had a memorable pizza experience, but I really enjoyed the rosemary garlic knots and side salad with mascarpone ranch dressing on my most recent visit. I was impressed by these items so I also ordered a cannoli to go. The crisp, homemade shell was filled to order with a light cinnamon-spiced ricotta cream and dusted with powdered sugar. With each bite, I was also dusted with powdered sugar. I'm sure that I will think of this simple, delicious dessert any time I find myself on this side of Craig Road.

They have also made some improvements to the dining area to make it more attractive. It's still a comfortable place to eat with children, as the chalkboard walls are a welcome distraction until your pizza comes out of the oven.

I love this tiny pizza place that offers giant pizza slices. Their OMG size pizzas are ridiculously huge! My favorite is the four cheese pesto pizza, which comes with toppings of pine nuts and Mediterranean olives (can substitute for plain boring black olives). The wings and cannoli are off the charts! Italian sausages stuffed wings with a hint of sweetness sprinkled with some pistachio crumbs. The cannoli has a cinnamon sugar coating (extra crispy) with again ...pistachio crumbs adding to the crunch in every bite. Now you know this place is "crackin"! 

While you wait for your food, take a look around and take in the rustic and hippish feel of this place. They've got fun riddles on the chalkboard wall for you to solve. The service is always consistently awesome, just like the food.

They offer wine by the bottle or glass and beer on tap. If you are a wine drinker like myself you can get the bottle of wine for almost half off if you purchase it to go. Yes....I said to-go!

If you are looking for an intimate setting (not big enough for large groups) and some real authentic Italian style pizza or pasta, look no further because this place has got way more than what you expect. You know they are authentic when you get a funny look for asking about ranch. Nope, they've got this yummy creamy and thick mascarpone dipping sauce for your pizza instead!

My son and I went to eat here.  First the guy working acted like we were bothering him, not very friendly or inviting.  The pizza was okay, neither of us were that impressed. It seems to be way over cooked, and that atmosphere inside was small and cramped.

Best pizza ever!!! Hands down!!! Gio and Darren and the rest of the staff are great! Anyone that puts less than 5 stars for their review of this amazing restaurant simply doesn't know what they are talking about. Can't wait to be back! Oh yeah and the garlic knots and cannolis and everything I've tried on the menu is outstanding so eat here and you won't be disappointed! :) I'm celebrating my wedding anniversary and Darren made the pizza into a heart shape for me to surprise my wife with! If you haven't been here it's time you do!

I honestly don't understand people who don't like Old School Pizzeria. I read some negative reviews and frankly, I am shocked by them. I've lived near Old School for almost two years and have eaten there several times. The food is always DELICIOUS. The crust is so good that you can eat it alone if you like. Their menu is superb and they offer unique toppings. My personal favorite is the Vegas Meets Italy pizza.  

A couple of notes: they occasionally run out of dough or toppings. And yes, the restaurant itself is small, with just a few tables to sit at. If you want cheap, ready-made, mediocre pizza, go to Little Caesar's. For superb pizza, come to Old School Pizzeria.

We have been here on two occasions, and if it were a little bit of a jaunt from our house - we would be here every week! The first visit we tried the Vegas Meets Italy, which was fantastic! Smoked provolone, pistachios, ricotta, prosciutto, date cream sauce - delicious! We also got the to-die-for garlic rosemary knots, and I got a salad with their delicious mascarpone ranch dressing. 

Most recently we couldn't decide what to order, (besides the garlic rosemary knots) and the gentleman taking orders suggested the Pork Reigns. I was hesitant, as it had salami and pork jowl, two things I have convinced myself I would hate. He assured me that it was delicious, his favorite, and that pork jowl wasn't where I thought it was located - it's a cut from the neck and shoulder, not what I refer to as my pork jowls when I grab my double chin. 

I am so glad I listened to him because the Pork Reigns certainly reigned supreme on our pallets!! The crust is perfectly chewy without being tough, and despite a plethora of pork bounty and cheese, the pizza was not the least big greasy. 


Our only dilemma here is what to order next time, and who gets the roasted cloves of garlic from the garlic knots?!
Best food . Dedicated staff. Carlos and Zeb are fantastic. The food is amazing, I love the stuffed wings. Give these guys a raise!!
I had the classic slice with the garden salad while in Vegas for work. It was delicious, will definitely be back!

While in North Las Vegas with my son, we were in the mood for pizza.  Saw this place on Yelp with the great reviews and decided to give it a try.  The ambiance of the place is very nice and we were greeted with a smile!  We ordereda small meatball and bell pepper pizza with garlic knots - DELICIOUS!  The crust was very tasty and tyre meatballs were freshly made.  Would definitely return next time I'm in the area!

We saw this little pizzeria at the last second as we were looking for somewhere to eat before watching a movie close by. We walk in and the decor isnt the greatest and it was small, but thats not really a concern for me as ling as the food is killer. My boyfriend and I ordered a big pizza just with pepperoni and garlic rosemary knots. He also bought a mason jar of housrmade rosemary lemonade. The food came in a timely manner. Unfortunately my boyfriend did not like the lemonade; it was quite bitter. The food, however, was quite good.
I love Yelp. We flew out of Las Vegas after Zion hiking. It did not disappoint! Get out of the chain fast food crap and stop here!
The pizza here is soooo good that I went to bed thinking about it. Now I understand why people order the biggest size pizza! The ingredients were fresh.

Imagine a tall Italian handsome Italian man telling you you can have it your way. My review just might be slightly biased. 

I came in when the place was closed.. I guess around three. The owner was very kind and accommodated me. I asked him for recommendations, and told him to make me something tasty. I had a vegetarian slice, a meaty slice and an order of garlic knots. I don't know if the items or on the menu or what they are called. I think he may have just thrown together some ingredients. 

The pizza is made right in front of you, and was still hot when I got home 20 minutes later. I can honestly say that I have never had pizza like this. The ingredients were very bold, and provided a unique flavor. I preferred the meaty pizza to the veggies pizza as the veggie pizza had some sort of broccoli that had a flavor too robust for my palate. The garlic knots were yummy. They were cooked with fresh garlic, and had an amazing sauce to go along. 

I will definitely return. I will probably not pay as much attention to the nice Italian guy, and choose my own slice. Which reminds me - one slice is more than enough! It took me three days to eat the 2 slices and the knots.

First time trying this place. I live in LA and stayed at the cannery and was looking for a good pizza place nearby. Ended up trying it with my brother and dad, the place inside is rather nice and casual, the staff is knowledgable and nice but the pizza and garlic rolls are just not what I'm used to. They had way too much Rosemary that basically took away all the flavors of the pizza, we had gotten a combination. My dad got a really good pork belly sandwich which was great but this is a pizza place so I would have expected much more from the pizza. The toppings were skimpy and there was a lot of sauce. This place has great reviews but it doesn't seem special to me, maybe because the food in Vegas is just bland and that's what people are used to. Anyways nothing spectacular, too much Rosemary in everything. I wouldn't go again.

I have nothing to complain about when it comes to this pizzeria. I first had their pizza for my birthday lunch and I can say it was the best pizza I've had that I've gone out of my way multiple times for a slice. The crust is amazing! It's almost like a sourdough crust. I could eat it all day! The customer service is great too! Kind and happy to be serving you. Seriously a must try!

They make the best pizza on the planet.....I won't eat pizza anywhere else. The freshest ingredients are used to create each pizza masterpiece and made right in front of you!! Check this place out!!!!!
Amazingly..., no comment. It's worth for y'all to come here and give it a try and you definitely will come back!
The owner contacted me and apologized as well as tried to fix the situation.  For this I give 4 stars, to me this means they care about their cutomers!

This to me is the best pizza in town! There are some close seconds but consistently, the pizza here is hot, great crust and the sauce is delicious. I am a fan of the simple cheese pizza and I have never been disappointed here. The owner is great and he is often seen being the one who makes the pizza.

super fast and oh my gosh their pizza is ridiculously goooood. dough is on the sweeter side than most places, but for some odd reason it worked and everything came together. . good service. fast. and fresh!

Found this hidden gem by chance.  We have only ordered take out 2 times but I'm sold on their business.  First off the pizza is outstanding !! My husband likes thin pizza and pretty fussy...he loved it.  I placed a order on line and the experience was crazy good.  Fast and the smoothest take out I have ever experienced.  My order was placed and picked it up in 30 minutes.  They send you a text telling you they are pulling it out of the oven !! I was pleasantly surprised by the COZY atmosphere in the restaurant when I picked up the pizza.  I definitely will go back and eat in their restaurant.

We just moved back to Vegas from Reno and couldn't wait to come back to Old School. The food is amazing, service is fabulous! Yes it's more expensive than Little Caesar's but you absolutely get what you pay for! Highly recommend this place! Fresh, fresh, fresh!

This is my official pizza place. I have been coming here  approx. once a month, for about 6-9months. 

The pizza is always fresh, new york style, served quickly. No complaints. 

But I decided to make this my official pizza spot because of the customer service. Every time I come in the same guy (i didn't catch his name but i will ask next time) greets me with an authentic smile (whether its lunch on a sat or right before closing time). Always makes pleasant conversation. Just a really genuine guy. 

Well a few visits back, I ordered the garlic knots (amazing!) and I asked for extra sauce (house made, equally AMAZING) of course he obliged. I came in again today, and he remembered my extra sauce! Its been quite a while since I ordered the knots so I really appreciate the gesture. 

This is the type of place you come to for the food and the atmosphere! I love this place.

if you're looking for vegas meets Italy this is the PLACE IT'S BOMB.COM everything is DELICIOUS we had the stuff chicken wings and had some of there freshly made pizza and its a must try !!!! I couldn't wait to stuff my face !!!!

I'm not going to go into much detail with this review because the other folks covered it all. I will say that this is the best pizza I've ever had in my life. There's something magical and comforting about it. Staff is nice and friendly. 

I'm looking forward to trying Chef Gio's new place called Pizzeria Monzú when I can make it over that part of town.

TIPS: The pizza pairs great with a bottle of Rosé!
Make sure you ask for some extra house-made dipping sauce. OMG!

I must be missing something here! What's all the fuss about? Is there a certain pizza I should be ordering?  I wanted to like this spot, but left a little disappointed.
 
Ordering by the slice is something I am used to at food courts inside of every mall in America. The difference is that the slices here are no joke!  One slice is enough to feed just about any person with a healthy appetite. 

I opted for a slice of pepperoni and sausage. Ok--here are the positives.....
The tomato sauce they use is light, flavorful, and what I have come to expect out of a good pizzeria. The dough is a good consistency and holds up without tearing or getting mushy.

What I didn't care for was the toppings they used. The pepperoni seemed cheap and greasy.   In other words, the kind of pepperoni you would find on pizza in the freezer section of your favorite grocery store. The sausage was fresh but lacked flavor. I ended up wishing I ordered a slice of cheese instead.

I will give this place another try, so I can sample the desserts that everyone talks about. The place is small and serves as a better take out place at the moment. However, it seems as though they may be renovating since the last time I was there. 

I am really searching for that can't miss pizza place in Las Vegas. I have been trying for 6 years and have not been successful.  Maybe next time, it will be better. Let's hope so!
Come hungry!!! Great pizza and service is great. Come here from Cali. Talk about OG style. Thin and tasty. Fresh ingredients and is made in front of you. New York style pie.
Best pizza in Vegas hands down. Real authentic and don't forget the desert. Creamy dreamy gelato after a hot meal is always a win.

Authentic & perfect Italian food in a quaint setting! Takes you to Italy for a few hours of delicious pizza, salads, calzones and Italian wine. The dough is homemade daily and the best I've ever had! The most friendly staff makes you feel at home while you enjoy some music, wine and indulge in the best pizza you'll have in Vegas. 5 stars all around!

I admit it, I'm a big fan of this place. The pizza is always fresh and really delicious and if you order by the slice then you'll notice that they are humongous. The staff is also really friendly and you can tell they are trying hard to make their customers happy which I enjoy. Nice menu selection that will keep you from getting bored and in addition to the Pizza's I highly recommend the calzones which are really delicious and gooey. This place is a definite heart attack waiting to happen but who cares, finding a good pizza joint is hard to fine and I'm glad I found this place.

Went to eat here with some friends and the pizza was great. The crust had that nice crispiness to it and the peppers we added gave it a nice kick to it. Excellent tasting food. We also had the garlic knots with a creamy sauce that was awesome tasting. 
Its on the other side of town for us, but we all agreed that the drive was well worth it.

5+ STARS! BEST PIZZA EVER!
This place is so good that I feel guilty that I've ever given anyone else five stars.
We had the garlic rosemary knots (as another yelper said, "just do it") and they are absolutely glorious and after eating a few realize that there were cloves of roasted garlic resting in the bottom of the bowl. Totally awesome.
My husband and I shared a small pizza. And we are both pretty hearty eaters and we're completely full afterwards.
We shared the Vegas meets Italy pizza and I cannot imagine even trying anything else because I will never be able to not order it.
This pizza is the perfect combination of flavors with each by giving you another surprise and getting better and better. It has smoked provolone, mozzarella, ricotta, pistachio, dates, heirloom cherry tomatoes, arugula, prosciutto, and date cream. !!!!!!
We were fortunate enough to show up at a time when it was not busy which apparently doesn't happen very often so we got the best seat in the house right in front of the chefs preparing our meal. And as if you needed any other reason than the fact that the food is absolutely outrageously great they cleaned the entire time we were there. The bathroom was also very clean and well-stocked.
The service was impeccable with friendly people who absolutely took care of everyone in the restaurant.
We will absolutely be making this a regular on our restaurant rotation.

Delicious pizza and the customer service is on point! The boys are down to earth and aim to please. There menu is is very interesting and well "old school" which I love. They have wine and beer. We got a margarita pizza a couple of Stella's and some cannolis which were really good. My kids were happy and entertained by the black board which they could draw on w chalks given to them by the waiter. I will have to go back to try the rosemary lemonade. Thank you for the pleasant experience :)

The service is always great the food is always hot and fresh the prices are great and I love everything on the menu you can dine in or take out not sure if they deliver but I really like the staff they are plesent and it's a great place to eat before going to the casino or movies.

This was bookmarked for a while as I've heard great things about it. Finally got around to going with someone. It was a lot smaller inside than I expected. Also, the price for a small pizza was $18 and a large pizza was $30. That's ridiculous. I'm no pizza elitist, but I've had my fair share of different types of pizza, and the Classic combo was nothing special. The rosemary lemonade was good, but I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon, especially as this is way out of my way.

Arguably the best pizza in Vegas. And been to NYC often know what good pizza is!  It's hard to find in Vegas.  This tops the list. Also porchetta sandwich is solid!  Garlic aioli for dipping is good quality.

Pizza is a passion of mine. I am a fan of all types and styles. I love thin crust, deep dish, brick oven, etc. That being said, this may be the best pizza I've had in Vegas. It's straightforward and built with very high-quality ingredients. My wife and I got a 1/2 cheese, 1/2 pepperoni and roasted bell peppers pizza. The service was super friendly. These folks clearly like working here, and we got our food quickly. The sauce was the star of the show. It had a clear and bright tomato flavor. A lot of sauces taste mostly like salt and seasoning, but this was all tomatoes. Incredibly flavorful tomatoes. The crust was also great. Crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. It was cooked perfectly. Can't wait to come back. We did have a wobbly table. Every time we leaned on it at all it tipped. I'd eat this pizza sitting on a chair missing two legs, with a tree stump for a table though. But seriously, they should fix that table.

The pizza here is superior, so tasty and 100% true to its name! The sauce is NOT the usual sugary, bland tomato sauce - it's savory and yummy, and the crust a nice mix of chewy and crispy and tasty, too! They have some very creative combo pizzas and the stuffed chicken wing is supergood. The salads are always fresh and the knots are great. The calzones are huge and worth the dough (sorry, couldn't resist!) and it's only 75 cents per topping added in. I never have ordered anything that didn't come out quickly and fresh. The pizza by the slice is huge, and the slice combos are very good deals! 

If you have time to eat there, the staff is very friendly and they play cute Italian music. I eat here every chance I get and am so glad it's in my neighborhood!

I get excited about any place that can pull off a pizza that reminds me of New Jersey. I had heard a lot about this place and was anxious to try it. When I walked in the smell instantly brought me back to being on the east coast. They had a lot of different options but I kept it simple with a pepperoni, a ham and pineapple, and some garlic knots. However they did offer such toppings as: calabrese, guanciale, dates, gorgonzola, pecorino, and pesto cream. They had some specialty pizzas or you could order these items alone as toppings. Very unique creations. The chef here really seem to put his heart and soul into the food. Mom and Pop business at its finest.

Amazing is all I really can say! Fresh ingredients, the best dough ever and don't forget the canollis! I've been going there for a while now and can't get enough. I work with a bunch of real Italians who showed me this place and they give it their stamp of approval. 

I visit at least one a week for their monster slice and knots. The only thing I don't like is rosemary on my knots but I just ask for it without so no big deal. It's a smaller place just across front the cannery. Don't be fooled by the outside, it's such a cute little place inside. You MUST try it!

My daughter just moved to Vegas and so we wanted to try some places close to her and we are so lucky to have found this gem! This is by far the best pizza I have had. Everything is made fresh there in this family owned pizzeria and everyone was super friendly. The place is small but can get take out if needed. Will definitely be back when we come back to visit our daughter!

We tried 2 different salads, both fab! We wanted to get the Vegas meets Italy pizza but it was sold out.... But we got the classic? Sorry forgot the name. Best crust I have ever eaten. Will be taking everyone I know here, was that good...

Single handily the best traditional pizzeria joint in town! Fresh ingredients with and old school flair! Their lemonade is the very best I ever had! Their friendly customer service is just magnificent and always makes me want to come back!

Owner Giovanni emailed me, apologized for my experience and offered to refund any overcharge.  He obviously cares very much about his business and his customers.  I don't want a refund but do appreciate that he took the time to reach out.  


This is not your average pizza joint.  Huge monster slices, grilled lemons in their lemonade, killer homemade ranch, awesome toppings: heirloom tomatoes, artisan salame, guanciale, pistachios, dates, want garlic?  It's not minced, they use whole cloves.  Pizza was excellent.  So why the 3 stars?  They messed up my order twice and I think overcharged me.  That or they are waaay over priced.  I wasn't given a receipt so I am not sure.  We came in for a quick bite before going to the movies.  I got the Monster Slice (with 4 toppings) and Knots special and my friend got a 1/2 order of knots.  We both got drinks.  Our total?  $36!  Yikes.  Nice older guy helped us at the counter.  He had a little trouble with the POS system and adding my extra toppings.  I got pepperoni, mushrooms, olives and garlic.  When our food came out my slice only had pepperoni.  I asked if I was charged for the other toppings I ordered and said if I wasn't I would just keep the pepperoni, no biggie.  They were super nice about it, checked and I was charged so they made me a new slice to go and gave me the plain pepperoni on the house.  Only problem that slice was wrong too.  Instead of olives they put onions.  I didn't say anything, they were so nice and wasn't going to have them make me another slice.  We shared a Grilled Rosemary Lemonade and Passion Iced Tea.  The drinks come in mason jars.  He didn't mention it and we weren't sure if we could take or should leave them.  The jars are pretty big, we ended up leaving them and not finishing our drinks.  If I had known I paid extra for the jar I would have taken it.  I learned later they take $1.50 off when you return the jar.  So if you get the tea or lemonade, take the jar.  That shit is good.  Don't waste it.  I am not in this area often but OSP is worth the drive.  I'll be back to try their specialty pizzas and I'm sure update my review.

I gotta give it up for this little pizzeria.  Working on this side of town can be a challenge for a foodie, and Old School Pizzeria made my day today.  I went with a couple of coworkers, and was more than pleasantly surprised.  

I split a 14" five cheese pizza with one other person.  The size was perfect for two starving fellas.  The crust was perfectly cooked; lightly crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside.  The inside of the slice was thin, while the outside was puffy and doughy. Perfect crust here folks, I enjoyed every bite!  Obviously the cheese was the highlight of this pizza, and it was an amazing one at that.  I have had a few five cheese pizzas in my pizza eating days, and this one is definitely the best.  All of the cheeses were high quality.  Lightly oily from the cheese itself, the "grease" level was moderate.  The ricotta cheese though... holy crap.  Just do yourself a favor and order anything with this ricotta cheese on it.  I've never had ricotta that tasted this creamy and delicious, almost as creamy as cream cheese!  

We also tried some of the pistachio gelato and cannoli. The cannoli was fresh and excellent, although not the sweetest cannoli I have had, which could be a bad thing or a good thing depending on your tastes.  Personally, I don't mind a less sweet dessert.  The crust was a dark brown and made fresh with coffee.  The cheese was fresh and lightly sweet.  The gelato though was a mind blower.  Words can't describe the perfect flavors coming from this pistachio gelato.  You gotta try this stuff!

Update: The "Roast Chicken" is actually Sous-Vide prepared chicken.  This is a special process that involves wrapping the chicken and potatoes in a vacuum seal and cooking in water.  This retains the juices of the meat and taters.. and it shows in the flavor. It is so juicy that the juices from the chicken collects in the dish as you eat it.  Yum!  This dish is very savory and full of garlic flavor.  Absolutely delicious and unique.  I noticed someone accused the chicken as being "soggy" or something like that, so I thought I would make this update to address this wonderful dish. 

I can't wait to start bringing my friends and coworkers to this little pizzeria.  It has trumped my previous favorite Italian/pizza in North Las Vegas and is now my go-to for pizza.  I'll be coming here frequently for sure!

I thought there were great portions for the price but there needed to be more seasoning for an Italian restaurant. Great service and awesome Ambience but when it came to the food it tasted very Bland or plain but the portions were absolutely spot-on

This place was pretty awesome! I really liked the industrial/modern decor, it was a welcome break from all the casinos (it was on the small end, however). I had their lavender lemonade which was delicious and just the right amount of sweet. If you bring the mason jar back you can get your next lemonade at a discount. I drank that while I waited on my 5-cheese macaroni and cheese and watched the people working there make pizza behind the counter. The macaroni took a little longer to come out than I would have liked but it was worth the wait and since they pizza oven/prep area is visible through a glass wall, at least I had something to entertain me. As you can imagine, the dish is extremely rich so I couldn't finish it....or make room for any of the canoli's they also sell. Definitely worth your time.

Not your average pizza joint, but I wasn't super impressed either. It's a cute little place, simple decor and chalkboard menus circling the wall. 

The slices are huge, probably 3x your average slice and it tasted good. My biggest complaint is that they really skimped on the toppings (which are $0.40ea) and the cheese... So its really a lot of crunchy crust. I  ordered pineapple, ham, and bacon. Pineapple was small and sparse and I got two very small/thin pieces of fatty bacon :/ . Kind of a bummer but it was definitely filling and satisfied my pizza craving!

I'm from Jersey so I'm a pizza snob off top.  I often preach about the qualities of a good pie to my husband (a Las Vegas native)- and this place makes good, quality pizza with premium ingredients. My husband and I came here for date night and LOVED everything we ate. We got the Hardcore Old School b/c we were feeling adventurous (he'd never had anchovies on pizza before =) and the Crazy Good Chicken, with the rosemary lemonade and a glass of white.  The chef was awesome and accommodating and took our questions with a smile. Cannolis were off the chain with lots of lightly sweetened cream and pistachios in a crispy sugar dusted shell. BONUS: Now my husband doesn't want to eat pizza from anywhere else!
I enjoyed a new experience AND upgraded my husband's pizza game. #winningatlife!
Took my sister-in-law to eat dinner and she loved the veggie pizza. She said it was one of the best and loved the garlic knots too.

Chef Gio really aspires to make a top notch pie. He prides himself on using "Calabrese Salame", which is apparently the original pepperoni. Works for me. The pizzas start off at 14" which is what the big chains like to call a large. I personally like the "Extra Big" (18"), and think the OMG (24") is just a bit big to be practical. I recently ordered a classic combo (the traditional everything-on-it sort of pie). Nothing about this was traditional (in a good way!). The mushrooms are marinated crimini mushrooms, his peppers are roasted, and the onions are grilled.. The side effect of all this yumminess coupled with a thin crust, however is a slightly soggy pie. A small price to pay for excellence!

But let's talk about the crust! I normally don't get excited about crust ( I usually feed it to the dog!). I noticed one day in his shop that he says he uses natural leavening, and on my last order I could really tell. It tastes just like sourdough. It is super light and airy, and just the right amount of chewiness. This takes 36 hours to prep, so his signs warn that one day he might run out of dough...

In short, I'm really glad Chef Gio has come to the North side of town, and really hope to see him succeed. He is super friendly with his customers, places a tremendous amount of care into his pizzas. Why order the $10 pizza from the big guys when you can have greatness?

There are few times when you get to witness greatness in it's prime. This place consistently delivers on quality, I honestly am surprised I have yet to have a bad experience. The two guys there are the dynamic duo. The garlic knots, what can say other than that's how a finger food bready food is meant to be prepared and presented. The roasted garlic, pine needles, and ranch dressing make for an all around fulfilling experience. The garden salad, wow I've never had salad taste like that. Cannoli at the end, best I've had since my last trip to little Italy in NYC. And hey, the pizza is bomb. No joke this place is legit.

The first time I tried their pizza about a year ago I thought it was great. The crust was good and the sauce and cheese were perfect. The last two times I tried it, it was chinsey, very little sauce and hardly any cheese. Like everything else greed sets in. Old school has become greedy in the their product, they have cut back to just ordinary and over priced food stuff. I'd rather get dominoes!

This pizza shop is great. It has an old feel with a new twist to it. The pizza is the best I've had in Vegas. All sauces in Vegas are a bit too sweet for my tastes but other then that, it's the closest you'll get to NY pizza. So my 5 star is basses on best pizza in Vegas, not the best I've ever had
The Pizza is awesome and there are so many variations. They even offer you lemon water while you wait and. can even watch them make your pizza!
best pizza in vegas!!! people are nice and you get your food super fast!!! plus you have to try their amazing lemonade!!!
Simple review: The best pizza my wife and I have ever had. Worth the trip from anywhere in Las Vegas whenever we're in town.
One of my favorite pizza places in Vegas! Everything is so fresh and yummy!! The special ranch sauce is perfection!! Definitely a go to place if you are craving some amazing pizza!
Wow, boy am I surprised to find such a great pizza place nearby!  Monstrous slices for a decent price, and you can't beat the sourdough bread. Yummy.

I would give them a 4 or 5 if they could ever make a pizza in time or correct. Once you get it if it's right it's great. But I have been here over a dozen times and every time I order ahead and come to pick it up rather it be online or talking to someone in the phone they mess up my order. It's not hard large pizza half pepperoni half cheese. If they don't mess it up then they say it will be ready in 20 mins and you get they 30 mins leather and they haven't even started your pizza. So you have to wait another 20-30 mins what's the point of having online ordering or even calling it in. They need to know their times and how long it take to make things and just make it right. Seriously 12-15 times here and I might say maybe just maybe only once has my order been right but that was only  because I came in and placed the order in the actual restaurant.

A small operation. two tables avaiable.Open kitchen. Too much garlic on the breadknots.Salad dressing same as the dip for the bread knots. So much that makes Your your eyes water.....Th Ziti i excellent.  Pizza average don't order meat topping if you like lots garlic.They must reduce the amount garlic..   ATM available.

So glad we checked this place out! We ordered a small pizza (which was big enough for two people) The pizza crust was so good, you can really tell it's homemade! The service was quick, a perfect spot before heading over to the cannery for a movie!
...i  truly cant explain in words ...how beautbvibrant and how alive this pizza... Hands down in my book this is the greatest pizza in vegas...and second to none ...

This place has some of the worse pizza I have ever had. They do make a extremely large pie but large dose not make good pizza. I did not enjoy the flavor of the pizza sauce which in my opinion ruined the taste. There staff is friendly though.

Oh My Goodness! I just ate the best Calzone ever! I was greeted with a rounding "hello" and loved the rustic decor with the chalkboard panels. I knew I wanted a calzone, just could not decide what to place in it. The friendly young man  at the counter suggested carmelized onions to complements the  chicken. We also added eggplant. 
Alll of that goodness made the car smell wonderful. I dug in to the calzone with rich mozzarella oozing out the sides. The tomato dipping sauce was the icing on the top! 
We are from New York, and miss real pizza. All of my east coasters this is the real deal! 

We also tried the rosemary garlic knots and cannolis. Equally as delicious. We will be back again!!!!

Yay! I just happen to be their 100th reviewer!

First of all, shame on me for not coming here sooner because they have been here at least a year and half in this nice location across from the Cannery Casino. Old School Pizzeria is just that. Old school. They make everything from scratch right in front of you. 

I ordered the Rosemary Garlic Knots and a Monster slice of The Carnivore. 

The Rosemary Garlic Knots were exquisite! I have had garlic knots before but these babies are now the standard I will judge others by. Let me describe it. Please have a bib or a napkin ready because you will be drooling. These are not your basic garlic knots. These knots are baked with actual rosemary leaves and real garlic cloves tossed in a light olive oil. I had them sit in the oven a little longer so it would make the outside even more crispy. When you take that first bite, it's comparable to one of those scenes you would see in any basic movie when somebody has a flashback and relives all those fun, awesome times, all in fast forward because by then that first bite is on its way to your stomach. Oh, and don't forget about the ranch dipping sauce that comes with it. Definitely did not come from a bottle. I assume they made it fresh because it was really creamy and made me want to drink it.

As for the monster slice of The Carnivore, the description is very fitting. If you refer to my pic, I put a pepper shaker right next to it so you can comprehend its dimensions. Now I have had good thin crust New York style pizza before, but this crust was SOURDOUGH! Now sourdough bread by itself I am into, but as the crust for the pizza? Stupendous! As you can assume by the name, it has all the meats they have available. From my recollection it had sausage, ham, chicken, pepperoni, and bacon. Usually when I get to the end crust, I just put it aside, but this crust was so good especially dipped in the ranch dressing, that it would make other sourdough bread jealous.

As an honorary mention, I gotta say that their bathroom is nicely decorated, clean, and has a fresh scent to it. It's so nice that I hope to God that none of those idiot hooligans jack it up with their sharpies and scratch things up. Memo to those low lifes: What kind of jerk are you to vandalize things and make it a sight for sore eyes? Anyways, sorry I kind of strayed off the beaten path there.
