So now that you got this far in my review, I just want to reiterate one thing. Whatever you get here, make sure the Rosemary Garlic Knots is one of them. The pizza comes in a very close second because it compliments the former. Sometimes, you just gotta go old school! Old School Pizzeria that is!

Yum! Found this place by chance and super happy we did. Hit the spot!!!!! It's a cute little place with friendly staff and great pizza. The homemade tea is great too! So happy it had little or no sugar in it.

My favorite pizza on my side of town. The crust is sourdough and all pizzas come with housemade garlic ranch sauce for dipping. My only complaint is I wish they had hot wings. That's just me though, I love wings with my pizza

Anytime I see four and a half stars; I'm skeptical. In my opinion very few restaurants deserve four and a half stars with 200+ reviews.  I often find that establishments with these numbers have a local cultish following which over rate the food.  

This restaurant deserves every one of the five stars.  The crust is amazingly crispy on the outside and sourdough chewy on the inside. The ingredients are chef quality.  The atmosphere and music is downright cool.  This is no run-of-the-mill ma and pa pizza shop, but a chef inspired gem.
Food is excellent. All fresh ingredients and worth the money. Service is just a good and consistently impressive. Highly recommend the garlic knots. Place never disappoints.

My new favorite pizza restaurant on the north side of Las Vegas. The ingredients are fresh, I love the music, and the employees are always friendly.  Its a small hole-in-the wall joint, with a small selection,  but the food is AWESOME!

The portions were extremely generous. The countermen (the guy who took my order and all the employees) were extremely nice. They were all pleasant and helpful. The pizza was okay, it could've been better as was the huge calzone. In my opinion the problem was not the sauce nor toppings, but the dough. In fact they're one of the few pizzerias to use quality black olives which is a huge plus in my book.

The mascarpone dip was freaking delicious as promised. You can't say you don't get your money's worth. 
BUT...
The baked 5 cheese pasta was UNBELIEVABLY, INCREDIBLY good...probably the best take on Mac n Cheese I've ever had. I could live on that stuff. 
The cannoli was also fresh and tasty and the guy was nice enough to pack the filing separate from the shell so it didn't arrive home soggy. 

I might go back for a second try especially for the pasta, but Darrin B. answered my wife's review kind of nastily thinking it was me. I should add that her review was written prior to tasting the pasta and cannoli so I don't agree with her 1 star either. His response to my wife's review which he mistook for mine was kind of insulting so I'll have to decide what's more important...my pride or that ridiculous baked pasta. Yum-o! Seriously!

Live in the area stopped by with my wife and kids and was blown away everything was good  we had the sausage stuffed wings to warm up  

And the pizza we got was the chefs choice the Calabrese
Overall experience was A1 

Ps they have beer too 


Pizza +beer sign me up ....
I have tried most high rated pizza places in town. This one I found on Yelp and it truly is the best in town. Fresh, fresh, fresh. Very authentic new york style pizza. Love it.

Walking in as a newbie and trying to read the chalk board menu was a little overwhelming until the guy at the counter, who was so pleasant, helped us out. I could tell he was really into all the products as he spoke so passionately about them and the process. We ordered garlic knots, pepperoni pizza, homemade (everything here is) pizza, an antipasto salad, porchetta sandwich and grilled rosemary lemonade. ALL delicious! They then treated us with the BEST cannolis! :-) GREAT experience!! We WILL return and ordered a large pie so the folks at home could experience this too. Great people!!

It's the best pizzeria in Vegas... honestly tho, if I want pizza I go HERE, I normally go here for birthdays because who can with stand this DELICIOUSNESS? I truly recommend going here, you can even take the pizzas to go if you'd like. They freshly make the pizzas here from scratch. Their ingredients are fresh and the interior design is very nice and classy. I think it's also a good idea to have a chalk board wall, but you can get chalk on your clothing if you lay against it which can get annoying. Overall this place is outstanding!

Nice neighborhood pizzeria popular with Nellis folks. Little pricey but worth the cost. Small dining room. I came after 1 pm so I'm guessing I missed the lunch rush.  I had the solo meal with a stuffed chicken wing which was delicious. Service was quick and friendly enough. Will definitely return!

FIVE STARS TIMES A MILLION!   If only this place were in other parts of town like Henderson or Summerlin....Pleaaase expand.  All of your food...and not just the pizza...is AMAZING!  Everyone should be lucky enough to eat such wonderfully creative tasting food.  If you haven't yet try the garlic knots, baked chicken, and fennel salad.  But my favorite pizza is the one with pistachios....YES PISTACHIOS!  OMG!  So good.  By the way, you can call ahead to hold the one big table for bigger groups...This is a very tiny place with only a few tables.  Don't miss out on this hidden gem.

My friend and I stopped in for lunch and I'm glad we did. We shared a large Antipasto Salad which tasted great. We ordered the Vegas meets Italy pizza and it was delicious! All the flavors in one bite was so amazing, one of the best pizzas we've ever eaten. This place is awesome! Service was great and staff very friendly. The establishment was clean.

This place is no joke. Food is prepared right in front of you and it's all fresh ingredients.  Atmosphere is great and the employees are engaged to provide service. I had the classic combo with a side of garlic rosemary bred knots. Outstanding.  They even came around with fresh cut prosciutto to sample. Definitely recommend

I came here on the recommendation of a friend and I was not disappointed. We shared a small garlic and mushroom pizza, an antipasti salad, and garlic knots. Everything...every single thing was a delight to my taste buds! Whole cloves of garlic on the pizza and in the knots. They make a ranch mascarpone sauce that is so good my knees would have went weak if I was standing. To drink I had the grilled Rosemary lemonade. So amazing! I recommend everything I had. I can't wait to try different pizzas but next time I really want a calzone. I will be back most definitely. Again and again...

If you are a pizza lover this is the place for you! 

Also! Incredibly helpful and friendly staff! Had a great experience all around.

Authentic, genuine pizza. Flavors were amazing, tasted extremely fresh and you can't beat that. We also tried their green salad which came in a bread bowl, their garlic knots and their chicken stuffed sausage wings. My boyfriend loved them and it's crazy cause there's no bone just sausage and chicken. Crazy how they did that. Service was exceptional and the restaurant has a very cool vibe to it. It's a small location but it was full of people and the prices are reasonable. Especially for the freshness and quality of everything.

You can't find flavor like this anywhere else. From the Grilled Rosemary Lemonade that comes in a huge mason jar, the Marscapone dipping sauce that comes with all of their pizzas, to the sauce in their pies.. Everything has such a unique taste that surprises you everytime you return. The staff is also super friendly. The menu doesn't have a big quantity but it really doesn't need to because everything they do they do right.

By far theeeee best Pizzeria in Las Vegas!! Great taste, quality and service!! Very consistently the best Pizza in the entire state... Dont miss out on this pizzeria period!! The owner is a world class chef, culinary artist and a great person!!! Enjoy all of the great flavors!!

Super busy Saturday night! So happy the bf and I decided to get food to go. Also incredibly happy that my favorite pizza place was packed! This trip to Old School we decided to try all new things. We ordered the five cheese Mac and cheese, the pork reigns calzone and the Mary's chicken. As always everything was AMAZING! Their Mac and cheese is now officially my favorite ever (and I make a damn good Mac and cheese). The pork reigns calzone was delicious. I prefer it as a calzone over the pizza...maybe because of the addition of ricotta. Mary's chicken was finger lickin' good with some tasty potatoes and stuffing. Overall another satisfying meal.

If it was possible, i'd give this place 10 stars. Hands down, the best pizza I've had thus far! This place seems pretty much like a hole in the wall and though it took awhile for our food to come out, i felt like it was well worth it. 

I ordered the monster slice and added bacon, ham, tomatoes, and garlic as my toppings. You could just tell everything was fresh and made from scratch. Even the side of ranch was a perfect addition to this slice of heaven. Wish we had a place like this closer to where we live

New to this side of town and I LOVE pizza so stopped by Old School. I was shocked at the tiny size of the place. 6 tables squished together. Plus the front window faces south so there is no way to escape the heat and sun. We ordered a pepperoni and veggie pizza. The crust was great-- light and airy. But I just wasn't thrilled out of my pants with the overall taste of the pizza. The veggie pizza seemed to have too many toppings-almost a bit overwhelming with some many flavors. The employees were courteous and the place was clean and tidy.
Best 5 cheese Mac I've ever had. Great pizza too! Right across the street from the Cannery. Don't let the small place fool ya. Great food!

Old School is a breath of fresh air in a neighborhood of crappy chain restaurants and limited choices. It's not perfect, but it seems to strive for something close to that. 

I've only ever had the pizza and the salads here. I tried to order a sandwich they had on the menu once, but they were out of chicken. The specialty pizzas are unique and very good, I love the one with pesto, although drawing a blank on the name currently. Veggie pizza has lots of toppings, even eggplant! My only complaint is the crust; it's thicker than I prefer. Gio's salad is okay, and the house salad is truly delightful. That mozzarella though... Damn. Yes, I'm salivating over a HOUSE SALAD. Great lunch specials, big slices of pizza, decent prices. 

Small restaurant, therefore limited seating. Good, quick, friendly service. I hope you choose Old School over Pizza Hut. Dig deep in your wallet and just do it ... and try the salad.
Best pizza in vegas...hands down. Incredible crust _ flavor, texture. Their combinations are amazing...cheese, sauces, dough ..made in house.
One of my favorite places to eat!! Service is always friendly and food is amazing. I always look forward to their pizza.

finally a place with good food in the northside of vegas!! old school pizzeria is for sure a hidden treasure. the staff is super friendly, the menu is amazing, pizza slices are huge, and evrything is authentic italian. you'll find everything from pizza to calzones to gellato. for someone who loves pizza, this is hands down my favorite pizza spot in vegas!!

Reading reviews one would think this is the best pizza West of the Mississippi.  This is far from the case and i feel sorry for the folks of Vegas if this is indeed the "best" pizza in town.  The pizza was average at best.   Ordered the specialty carnivore pizza and it was far from special.  Toppings and sauce were bland leaving much to be desired.  They charge a premium price for what is a sub par pizza.  Customer service was equally as poor as the pizza.  Hearing the way the couple after us was treated only confirmed the service I experienced.  High price + sub par pizza + poor customer service = won't be making the trip back or recommending to friends/family.

This place is amazing.   It is quite a drive for us - about 40 minutes but worth every minute.  Located right across the Cannery, this place puts forth some of the best pie I've ever had.

Love their sourdough crust - it's crispy and soft and chewy on the inside.   All the ingredients are top notch - I loved the marinara they used.   So fresh with a little kick to it.

They allowed us to call in the order so the pizza was ready when we got there.   They messed our order up and brought out a Pep. and Sausage instead of Mushroom.   It looked so good I was fine with the mistake but they brought us a side of mushrooms and when they found that they did make the Pep and Mushroom pizza, they gave us the second pizza free!

I would be giving this place 5 stars with or without the mistake.  I ll have to come back to try their stuffed chicken wings and their octopus potato salad.   The garlic knots were so comforting and filling and paired nicely with the garlic aioli.  It was much lighter, refine, and better than a ranch or other dressing.

We spent about $20 for a 2 topping pizza  and would go back any day of the week!

They were so good. Best pizza me and my husband found in vegas and we live here. I would recommend this place to everyone. They were very polite and helpful. I like that u can see them make the pizza. Great place that i will be bringing my children too for pizza.
Their pizza was really good, tasted fresh, and was just the way we wanted. And it was picky kid approved! Everyone worked super hard and were very nice!

This little place is wonderful. I think the best part is actually the service- these guys are so kind!!!! You can do a single slice special and the slice is huge! Amazing variations, including a vegetarian option. I included a picture of the gio salad which was amazing. Garlic knots, salads, soups, cannolis, and bottles of wine. Perfect place

I was impressed with the reviews on this pizza place, so I decided to try it out. I ordered the pizza solo meal. I had eggplant, olives, onion, and pepper on my huge veggie pizza slice and I chose the garden salad as my side. The salad has this delicious garlic marscapone dressing, which also comes with the rosemary garlic knots as a dipping sauce! I had to give the garlic knots a shot too based on all of the great reviews on them- definitely a must!!- I was further impressed by the service and passion for cooking of one of the workers--perhaps the owner's son? He enlightened me about the dough they make there and how it allows for a more colorful creation.
Out of this world delicious. When we're in town we have to pick up a pie & their stuffed wings from this place. Staff are very friendly.
Awesome dough, sauce and toppings.  Best pizza place I've had west of the Mississippi!

It was our first time ordering and eating, and to be honest we figured it would be just like any other pizza place. Low and behold we were wrong. I couldn't have been more pleased with service, atmosphere, and the food of course. We first ordered a full order of garlic knotts, folllowed by an OMG carnivore pizza.  And after taking the first bite of those delicious knotts we knew we had something special.  The pizza came rather quickly and of course it lived up to the hype! Scrumptious!!!

I can say that the staff was really open in communicating with my family.  We really enjoyed the questions they had posted on the wall, as it made for small talk and thinking from all. We will definitely be back for seconds!

Excellent pizza, likely one of the best I've ever had. The proportions and quality of ingredients were superb; for instance, there was just enough sauce but not too much, plentiful veggies and toppings but not so many as to overwhelm the cheese, sauce and dough. My husband reports that his half (my half was veggie combo and his a regular combo) featured a delicious medley of sausages/meats complimenting each other and the veggies. Every ingredient tasted fresh and crust/dough had a wonderful rich aroma. Can't think of a way this pizza could have been any better.

It's easy to overlook this place (it's right across the Cannery Row casino thingy in a small, very unassuming commercial building), but very much worth finding. We stayed at City Center on the Strip and it's only about 15-20min drive from Vdara/Aria/Bellagio area to this place and we'd recommend it for other visitors. What's neat is you can see your pie prepared behind a glass "exhibit."

This has become my favorite pizza joint. It's a cute and quaint family owners pizza shop with comfortable seating and decor. I love the Pork Reigns pizza and Antipasto salad. The pizza is made with love and are huge but thinner slices buttering with flavor. The salad taste exactly how you envision it! I love the friendly and quick service!

Old School Pizzeria is one of the most authentic and original pizza places I've gone to. I really admire and appreciate that they offer organic items on the menu. Their pizza, chicken, garlic knots and cannolis are seriously to die for!

This place is a trip! I love the cooks and the owner! True east coaster. First off we get here during lunch rush hour and there is literally a line out the door. So in my freinds infinite wisdom he asked the Owner "What's good here" the owner responds "Are you serious?! I don't have time for this and throws him a menu and says "It's all good..when you're ready to order get back in line" hahaha love it!" I ordered two slice... should of got one, they are huge!! Just FYI order the double (two slices) it's cheaper than ordering two single slices. 
  While we were enjoying our meal, a guy comes in thinking he was all "gangsta" and tell the cook, "Hey make me 3 of those!" The cook who looked like Popeye! Just looks at him then points to the register and says "Order there like everyone else!" then Mr Gangster yells at the owner..."Hey Bro!".. without skipping a beat the owner yells back "THAT'S CHEF BRO TO YOU!!". You can't have old school pizza without the old school attitude! Definitely coming back again

This place doesn't look like much from the outside but is surprisingly good and unique on the inside. I highly recommend the monster slice meal with a side of the antipasto (think salad with bits of game, cheese and olives + olive oil dressing), or a stuffed chicken wing, which is effectively a chicken with the bones removed and replaced with sausage I believe. Either way, great food for$20 or less usually.

Pizza was excellent!!! A little pricy in my opinion $31 for a large classic, feeds 3-4people but it was worth it. [Large classic invluded pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms,onions, and olives.] Was sble to phone in order & picked up our pizza to go.

Bar none. My favorite place to eat in Vegas. Everything, literally everything is delicous, fun and exciting. Perfect atmosphere and service. Garlic mascarpone sauce is outta this world. You won't be sorry, worth every penny.

Best pizza in town, hands down! The ingredients tasted fresh & delicious and the portion size is well worth the price. It was our first time ordering from here so we ordered one small Regina Margherita and a large build your own with housemade sausage, pepperoni and ricotta. We'll definitely finish the leftovers but a small of both would have definitely done the trick. I'll be back again!

Everything Chef Gio prepares is tasty, fresh, abundant. Best anchovie pizza ever bcuz they're fresh, not canned. Salads are made with love and the best cannolis you have ever had, hands down! Don't forget to try the homemade lemonade!
The pizza was phenomenal. We had half pepperoni half vegas meets Italy and if I wasn't so full after two slices I probably would've ate the whole large pie by myself!!!!

By far the best pizza place in Vegas, but they have other incredible dishes as well. My favorite is the Crazy Good Chicken. I've been missing this place, and Chef Gio, since moving away. A must have whenever I'm back in town!

So my fiancée and I were craving pizza and he mentioned this place. First off, I have to say I was impressed with the menu. There's a lot to choose from and it all sounds delicious in the descriptions. Secondly, I liked the friendliness of the staff and was happy we got there at a slow time, so seating wasn't a problem. 
I ordered a calzone with black olives and pepperoni. I was impressed with the size but felt it was lacking in olives and pepperoni. Tons of cheese, just the way I like it. 
The atmosphere was cozy and very nice. We will definitely be back soon!

Hands down, most amazing crust I've had. The place smells really nice, the environment has great, relaxing music, and the food is simply outstanding. Their sizes are pretty nice, large being 18" and their OMG being 24". The sauce tastes very fresh and the crust is not fought or mushy, it's well cooked and crunchy enough with each bite. The middle of the pizza was a little floppy, making a few ingredients slide off the slice, but that wasn't an issue on my end. Toppings were pretty delicious and fresh as well. I'm definitely planning on coming here again.
SOOOOOOOOO amazingly good!!!! The bread reminds me of traditional birote Mexican bread, THE BEST. Definitely will come back to this place, it's good, cozy, and the service is great.
The real pizza from Italy !! A bit pricier but well worth it! O and a 24" will feed the entire family ! Great authentic pizza.
Such delicious pizza! So fresh and tasty! Friendly staff, clean restaurant, and reasonable price. I love how they make the pizza right in front of you

I called in my order as we were driving through Las Vegas, and it was ready by the time we arrived (within 30 mins). They were so friendly on the phone, and made the ordering effortless. We ordered a OMG! size pepperoni pizza and it was delicious! Wonderful experience overall!

Really enjoyed the grilled rosemary lemonade, they give refills for a dollar less. Vegas meets Italy pizza is our favorite. They were nice in a takeout order to put the toppings in a separate container so the arugula wouldn't wilt. 

When we ate in the restaurant the pizza crust was so much more crispy... If you do carry out maybe put it in the oven a bit to toast up the crust.
My favorite pizzeria in NLV. A little bit pricy, but well worth it. The unique taste from the sourdough crispy really sets it apart from its peers.

Excellent food! Garlic rosemary knots are delicious and the "Pork Reigns" pizza is superb. Great staff who are friendly and attentive. There's a wall of chalk boards for the little ones and also a basket of toys to play with. I can't say enough about this place, it's SO good! Will most definitely be going back!!
Best Pizza this side of Las Vegas! I have not been in awhile. Came back today and they did not let me down.

I posted something very negative about Old School but within a few minutes of learning about the problem Gio contacted me and made it right.  In fact, he went over and above.

Still love this place and will still give them my business and promote them.  Thank you for straightening the issue out!

Old School Pizzeria serves decent pizza but it's no where near the best pizza I've ever had. The restaurant is pretty small and the lines (at lunch time) long, but the friendly staff do enough to make your experience enjoyable.

We ordered an order of garlic knots and 2 of the OMG pizzas for a group of 6 guys and 3 girls and found that it was more than enough which was fine by us because who doesn't love leftovers?!

Food:
Garlic knots - Basically garlic bread sticks. These were very tasty and I found myself wanting the garlic knots more than the actual pizza itself. If you're a garlic lover like I am then these are a must-try.

Pork Reigns - The pork reigns was definitely my favorite out of the 3 pizza types we ordered (we went 1/2 and 1/2 on one of the pizzas). With pulled pork, calabrese, sausage, and bacon this meat monster is sure enough to satiate any cravings the hungry carnivore might have. The pork meats all had a pretty strong flavor which was definitely a good thing.

Calabrese - This pie contained calabrese, olivers, and hot peppers if I remember correctly. The peppers were definitely a nice addition and I wish that they were added to the pork reigns. Overall the calabrese had a much more balanced taste than the pork reigns so if you're trying to go lighter this is definitely my recommendation. 

Five Cheese Pesto - I didn't actually try this one but the general consensus was that it was tasty however the ricotta was heavy; maybe a little bit too heavy. 

One thing to note is that all of my toppings kept falling off. This might have been due to the fact that the pizza was still hot and the slices so big. I also felt that the crust was too bland and didn't give enough flavor.

Overall: If you're hungry in N. Vegas and craving pizza, give Old School Pizzeria a try.
One of the top pizza places on Vegas! Perfect to eat there then go to cannery. The pizza has been perfect every time we go there as well as the garlic knots

Mediocre pizza at best, definitely over priced. Would go as far to say that Little Caesars pizza is better. Cashier was rude to top it all off. Overall pretty bad place to get pizza. DONT BELIEVE THE HYPE!!
Here is my final update...got the second pizza and it was delicious! Fresh with a crisp crust. Glad we gave this place another try, might even turn into one of our regular spots.

Okay so there pizza was pretty good, however I could do with out the half gallon of extra grease atop the pizza. Here was my main issue with this place: RUDE, IGNORANT, COCKY staff. First time I ever tried this place I ordered for pickup on their janky messed up "website". I ordered a HALF pepperoni and HALF just cheese. I wrote it in the "special request to the chef box" When we went in to pick it up, opened up the box, pizza covered with pepperoni. I brought it to the manager/owner's attention, I said "I special requested half and half on the website", the man looks at me and simply says "No you didn't." Like are you f**king kidding me, no I didn't? I could not believe the blatant rudeness and ignorance. So instead he gave me two jumbo slices of cheese pizza. Whatever. We decided to try again about a week later because it was late and we we're in the area, we walk in and one of the staff members that was there last time says "Ahhh, back again I see", in the cockiest voice and smirk on his dumb face. Idk why but it set me off so we haven't been back since. It doesn't matter how good a places' food is, customer service is everything to me, and if your going to be a d*ck then you lose my business period.

I called old school pizzeria and I wanted to order a Greek style pizza. You know one with tomatoes and black olives. Instead the guy told me that I was calling an Italian pizzeria and then hung up. Wow what service.

OMG!! So good!! The garlic rosemary bread knots are fantastic with just the right amount of garlicky rosemary oil and the ranch is the perfect kind of ranch. The kind that isn't too creamy or too dilly or too anything - just right.  And the pizza!! The pizza is out of control delicious! It gives Secret Pizza (at Cosmopolitan) a run for it's money!! The carnivore double slice sounds like a lot of meat (house made sausage, pepperoni, house made meatballs, Niman Ranch bacon, shredded chicken and ham), but there isn't too much of anything! Well, except pizza! The double slice was way too much for even me to eat. And I can eat!  We'll be back!

What can I say? Well it appears my first visit was just an aberration. I have gone back and got a pie for lunch with some co-workers and took note that they got the toppings just right this time! 

To flesh out my review a bit more this time I have to mention the nice sweet and fresh taste to the marinara. This time around I got sausage, pepperoni and Canadian bacon and it ended up as a real good mix of meaty flavors. 

A last note, their crust is very good, crispy outside and the perfect ooey gooey chewiness I crave in crust...add in the creamy dipping sauce and I was in food bliss all day long!

3/5 star previous with today's update of 5/5 should yield a 4/5 for me but OSP has tipped the balance of my opinion and I'm giving 5/5!
So good.  New England style pizza. You won't find better. I will come here every time I am in Las Vegas from now on.

This place is authentic and delicious! It's small on the inside but makes up for it in amazing pizzas and salads plus a wine menu that compliments everything nicely. Definitely a casual spot and would be great for take out too.

Among the Jack in the Cracks and Mickey D's on this side of town, this is the best spot to dine-in and grab a bite. Pizza is what they do best, but they also have other specialties worth trying.

Old School Pizzeria is a tiny hole in the wall shop. Unless you're looking for it, you'll hardly notice it while driving on Craig. There are daily specials written on a chalkboard slate that hangs from the ceiling, and one entire chalkboard menu wall. So far I've eaten here twice, and I've enjoyed everything I've ordered. 

Bruschetta (4 pieces): Crunchy slices of bread topped with mozzarella and balsamic oven roasted cherry tomatoes.  

Calabrese Pizza: Really, really, awesome pizza with a spicy punch. Don't doubt the spicy power of this pie, it really does have a kick to it. The toppings are Mediterranean olives, cherry and banana peppers, salami, and mozzarella cheese. I'm not a fan of olives, so I substituted them with caramelized onions. The thin slices of salami were the best I've eaten, and the crust was thin and crunchy. We were also given a side of garlicky sauce to dip our slices into.

Cannoli: Tasty, but it was a little tough to eat because it was hard to bite into.

Service - The service is quick and personable, but they do get a little annoyed if you want to swap out or omit pizza toppings -- I guess I can understand, considering how the pizzas are their masterpieces. 

Overall - In short, it's the best spot to eat at on this side of town.

We recently moved to this side of town, and for the whole have been disappointed by the dining in this area,  This hands down is the best pizza I have had in a very long time and is one of the saving graces to moving.

I have been visiting this places for a few years now, amazing quality pizza at a price that can be justified by the flavor and the atmosphere. The staff is friendly, always top notch service. It gets pretty busy at times, you may have to order to go if there is no seating space. Highly recommended.
Fair pizza. Good crust but they did not put much toppings on. Asked for green peppers and had three small pieces on a monster slice.

This place is AMAZING!!! Chef Gio gave us personalized service and talked to us about the art of pizza making. He made his dough right in front of us using fresh, all-natural ingredients. The garlic rosemary knots were a perfect prelude to an amazing carnivore pizza. We concluded with the cannoli--one of the best I have had. We can't wait to return!

Solid 4.5 stars. The place is cozy. It has a small leather sofa to sit on. Only no table to rest your plate or drink. The guy who helped me was great! 
Only problem and it's not a problem is its kinda pricey. 11 bucks with tip for 2 slices and soda. I got onion and pineapple toppings but still. However very very good pizza. 
I also tried a couple rosemary garlic knots. Very very good.  The pizza definitely reminded of good ole NY pizza. I like when you fold it the bottom lips "falls down". The passion ice tea,unsweetened, was delicious. I really did enjoy my pizza and if I'm in the area again I will go back!

I really wanted to like this place. Actually I wanted to love it. Seeing all the reviews for this place I new I had to try it. I didn't think the pictures looked appetizing but with 4 and 5 star reviews I wanted to taste the pizza and judge that myself. 

I started out with a "Side Antipasto Salad". It was very fairly priced at just $3.49 and came served on a plate that was annoyingly too big but it tasted good. Nothing wow about it but good. 

For the pizza I was impressed that it is made to order right in front of you. I wasn't however impressed with the taste. I ordered a 18 inch "1/2 Pepperoni & 1/2 Sausage pizza. When the pizza was brought to the table it was covered in grease. I used several napkins to mop what I could up. The first 2 bites I enjoyed the crust but after that it was just a greasy soggy mess. The pizza wasn't worth $17.49. I would like to give this place another try some other time since there was a sandwich that sounded interestingly good. I'm just not itching to get back too soon. 

They also offer calzones, sandwiches, chicken, pasta and desserts. If you have a large group then you should check out their family meal deals. Also that have a "Monster Slice" that is well, *monstrous*.  You can get the monster slices individually if you don't feel like a whole pizza or are just stopping by for lunch then you can combo it with a drink. Orders can also be placed online.

I came here because word of mouth. I ordered a Half order of garlic knots, a large pizza topped with sausage and mushrooms, and an order of the sausage stuffed chicken wing. I also tried the grilled rosemary lemonade that came with in a mason jar. The garlic knots was perfect with a flavor of rosemary. Next time I'll order a full order. The pizza tasted delicious And fresh. The cheese was superb. I also loved that there were puzzles, toys, and a chalk board for my two little girls to play with so it was very family friendly. Great eatery and will have to come back for more!

SOOOO GOOD! It can be a little bit expensive if you add a lot of toppings to your pizza but honestly the quality of the food is good that I really can't complain. We got a specialty pizza in the "OMG" size which was a LOT of food - our hunger was no longer a thing! They also sell home-brewed tea (which you can get a discount on if you bring in your own Mason jar). 

The vibe and atmosphere is also very nice and the size of the restaurant (while very small) helps to create a very intimate atmosphere and a closeness between the customer and staff. Definitely a place we will come back to in the future!

I find myself gravitating towards the pork reigns specialty pizza.  Sometimes dough can be undone but nothing a little oven time can't fix at home.  The owner/manager is awesome, he REALLY cares about his customers and product he's putting out. The garlic knots I do find myself unable to share with anyone else but myself.  Plan on going back as long as I live in the area.

First off: I don't like pizza. I was a delivery driver for a year and that turned me off to most pizzas forever. I hate going out to pizza places because they all taste the same to me. 
So how did I end up going to Old School? It was not by choice, but I'm SO glad I happened to try it by chance. Their pizza absolutely does not taste "the same" as any other pizza place I've ever tried. The number one complaint I have about pizza joints is the crust. Well, Old School makes their crust themselves and it is perfectly balanced: crispy, light, flavorful, a hint of sourdough. 
I had the veggie monster slice and Gio's salad. The veggie was filling, healthy, and the best part was that the variety of toppings made every bite slightly different, yet no ingredients ever clashed with each other. 
Gio's salad was similar to a caprese but the addition of fennel elevated it to a complex level. I added just a tad of the garlic mascarpone sauce, but the salad hardly needed any help.
My dining companion and I both strongly agreed that we will be going back to Old School soon... which is quite a shock for me, since I don't like pizza!

Service is the BEST. A hidden GEM! The food is amazing! This'll be the third time I've dined with Old School and they never disappoint. 

I see this establishment growing and expanding as long as your service stays the same. 

We had the garlic Rosemary bread knots which were delicious; the Calabrese delighted our senses shortly after. 

Keep up the great work Old School Pizzeria!!

Giovanni Mauro is a man with passion for his pizza, and you know Las Vegas is very fortunate to have him when he has followers from New York, Philly, and California wishing that he was closer to them....If you read the other reviews, I'm just the second Yelp Las Vegas reviewer....

I am pretty sure many of you have already tasted Chef Gio's cooking already but don't even know it...Does
Nora's/Nora's Wine Bar ring a bell??? Yes, Chef Gio is Nora's son, and we were very surprised he recognized us from our few visits to Nora's(Crazy Alfredo....YUM!!!!)

You can get Pasta, Salads. Paninis and Appetizers here, but  to come here and not order a pizza is a crime!

His pizzas come in 3 sizes-Large(14"), XL(18"), and OMG!(24") He has a few speciality pizzas, or you can customize your own. We got a  half classic combo, and half pork rules pizza(see pictures of menu items ) which was absolutely delicious! You can even chat with Gio as he makes your pizza right in front of you. He makes his pizzas the old school way by not using any commercial yeast in his dough,( it's better for you, easier to digest, and you don't feel bloated after eating his pizzas) and it goes through a 36-hour natural leavening process before it is ready. When he's out, he's out, and you have to come back another time.

Another thing to save room for is his desserts. Cannolis($1.99 each or 3 for $5)
Crisp, light , delicate, and the ricotta filling has the perfect sweetness.("better than my mom's", Gio says) he also makes gelato when he has the time, and we couldn't have come at a better time. His flavor of the day? Nutella :) at $.75/ounce or $1.90 a scoop, it was definitely worth the calories! Unfortunately, they ran out of tiramisu, but
that's a good reason for a return visit!

Before you go:

Old School Pizzeria is located acroos the Cannery Casino, next to the Metro PCS Store, cross streets are Craig and Lawrence

Cash Only....

Thank you Gio and Diego, we will definitely be back....ALOHA!!!


YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(116/365) "Old School Pie"

We came here so excited to have the same amazing experience we have had in the past. HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!!! We walked in to not being greeted then by a nasty attitude female employee we found out that they no longer offered family meals.  Sad, but no biggie. My daughter grabbed a mason jar of lemonade that was in a bin in front of this "nasty" employee and sat down to look at the menu. My daughter then says her lemonade tastes weird. Initially my daughter tried to talk to this horrible woman but was blown off. So when my husband tried to explain that she didn't know it was rosemary lemonade and that our daughter did not like it we once again were answered by a nasty attitude in response.  My husband then asked to exchange it for something else and was responded to with a bothered tone telling him "well". Due to the obnoxiously nasty employee we paid for a lemonade we returned and are back on yelp trying to find a place to eat. No recommendations for this place anymore. Very sad, but one employee ruined  Old School Pizza for us.
This is probably the best Pizza place I have ever tried, feels like you eating homemade Pizza, screw Pizza Hut and all. this place can't be compared..
Five Cheese Mac was the Pasta special of the day and was a pasta truly worthy of praise.

I'm writing this review maybe a week after my visit,  so apologies if it isn't very detailed. Their pizza is DELICIOUS. My friend and I ordered they're biggest pizza (OMG size) with cannolis and idk which I liked better. Usually I'm disappointed when I get cannolis from pizzerias but these were the best I've ever had. The storefront is beautiful and has a real pizzeria vibe. Their tropical tea is great as well! I'm surprised I've never tried this place or heard of it before! I'll definitely be going back to try other items on the menu (and of course, more pizza).

Yes!! Very delicious authentic pizza! Didn't venture outside of the regular toppings. But was very happy with the pepperoni, pineapples, and extra sauce. And the garlic knots are addicting! A side of their special creamy dipping sauce makes it so flavorful. 
Finally a great local pizzeria that is not downtown or far west side! The ambiance is cozy and clean with an enjoyable New York kind of style. Went home with leftovers and an order of tasty canolis. We will be regulars - for sure.

Such a surprise! We took the "Vegas Meets Italy" and it was a great flavor profile we've never had. The sourdough crust was a nice thickness and had a good crunch. The extra cheese was the way to go and the dates added an extra texture. This chef definitely knows his stuff. The staff was also very friendly. Will be returning!

Decided to come here after the movies across the street from Canery. Came around dinner time and it was busy, which means it's a good sign that this pizza place might be good.

Ordered a large pizza which is half carnivore and other half was vegetarian. The toppings were excellent! The dough was pretty good, just way too much crust and was little soggy in the bottom.

Pizza is very good.  Dough is light, crispy and yet still chewy. The stuffed chicken is really good. I'd go back just for the chicken alone. It's a very unique dish. Awesome service and prices are right on.

I'm a 17 year old girl who is turning 18 in two weeks. So I do know my pizza! Haha. I've been living in the area for many years now and I've always wanted to eat there. It seems like a very cute spot to eat! (which it is). My boyfriend and I decided to just eat at the restaurant. It seemed like a small coffee shop atmosphere. The workers were friendly. My only negative comment would be that the soda was quite flat. I don't know if it was the soda machine but it was just eh.

The pizza was INCREDIBLE! SO YUMMY! So rich in flavors! We ordered a large "carnivore" pizza with mushrooms and spinach. The total was about 35$. Quite expensive but TOTALLY worth it! I will be coming back very soon.

I could only eat 2 of their "monster" slices.  These people care about pizza.  The ingredients were awesome.  The service was authentic.  Finally, they've got seating where you can eat and watch them make the dough and prep the pizza.  It was decently priced.
I love this place! The crust is so flavorful... Huge pizza by the slice and only .40 cents a topping I always get the meatball!

Best pizza place in Vegas!!! All fresh ingredients dough is made overnight with traditional yeast.  We had a small 14" that was perfect for 2 people with Homemade sausage and meatballs on top and it was amazing. The service was also top notch. You order and pay at the counter yet the waiter checked up on us more often then most places. If your looking for a great pizza place in Las Vegas this is the place.
Pizza was delicious! Love the ranch! We're nice and full. Taking home leftovers. Kids loved it! We will be back.

Old School is my favorite restaurant on the Craig Rd corridor and makes the best pizza in the entire Vegas Valley. It's a great spot for a quick lunch, especially if you're at Nellis AFB. 

Chef Gio's crust is a superb sourdough base with the perfect mix of crunch and chew. He has a very creative mix of speciality pizzas or you can create your own. I love how you can see the "magic" happening on the pizza line through the plexiglass. I've also had the Crazy Good Chicken which lived up to its name; it's one of the most delightful chicken dishes I've ever had. The braised ox tail special (on Saturdays) is out of sight, the tenderest meat you've ever had. 

All in all, if you stop here once, you'll come back. It's a hidden gem in North Las Vegas, less hidden now that Yelpers are on to Chef Gio's genius. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Absolutely wonderful! ! I love finding something fresh n delicious. . I watched him pick the basil for my pizza.. the customer service just as efficient!  My new favorite pizza spot!! Fresh everything. . Love it!

This place is amazing!
Great garlic knots and handmade pizza dough! One of the best pizza places in Vegas

Just moved here from Cali where I thought my local pizzeria was bomb, but I stand corrected and thankfully so!!! And it's only 5 mins from our new home! I will very quickly become a regular, he'll I've already been twice in a 2-day period 

Everything is super fresh and the staff is awesome.

Amazing pizza. I mean really, really transcendently amazingly perfect pizza. The chefs here cure their own sausages, make their dough using sourdough starter, and offers daily specials as diverse as Mac n' Cheese and Octopus, you know you are either in for a real treat or an overhyped hipster experience. Luckily, this place is a treat from the get-go. Unpretentious, the efforts are focused entirely on the food. And the efforts are well rewarded. The slice of Pork Reigns pizza I had was an epiphany.

And then we came back for a second visit. We split an antipasto salad, and I had the Crazy Good Chicken (dark), while the wife had the daily special Mac n' Cheese. Wow. Just wow. Drive across town. Come in from another state. It's worth the trip!
So yummy!  The antipasto salad, regular, sits on the most amazing tasting roasted roll!

Ok, well, clearly I should have tried the chicken. If I was still in the area, I definitely would, it sounds scrumptious and that's even without the reviews here, just looking at the piks.  But, for whatever reason, I didn't, I ordered a "small" pizza with meatballs, $14.05.  Gotta say, it was not very appetizing.  The crust was burnt, and the "meatballs" were uh, interesting--are they suppose to be flat and a thickness of a half dollar (and just looking at them, the texture doesn't exactly start the juices running)?  Neither the pizza itself, nor the meatballs, were very tasty.  Wouldn't order the pizza again, but if I happened to be back up in that area, would definitely try the chicken.  Just wish I had done so, instead of that pizza.  Suddenly Papa John's (I know, I know) is beginning to sound good.  Sigh.  I miss that $14.05. Sniff.

Wow, couldn't decide where to eat and we yelped this place. WELL worth the stop. They're not kidding about having "monster slices" of pizza. We had ours cut in half and shared. Garlic knots...if Rosemary is your thing than these are AMAZING! And we topped it off with some of their cannolis...never had one but good lord was it yummy!!!

A little slice of comfort. Plus some (the cannoli). 

Food: 9
Service: 9
Ambience: 6.5
Selection: 7

Honestly, I didn't expect much when my friend invited me to this small place off Craig Road in front of the Cannery.  And I didn't really expect much once I entered either.  But looking at the menu, I saw that this little pizzeria had character.  Yeah, topics are 50 cents more on a slice (monster slice is gigantic by the way) and a dollar more for full pizzas, but quality definitely compensates.  I was about to get two monster slices (the only slices available), but the cashier advised me that people usually can barely finish one.  Skeptical at first, he was right.  I ordered the carnivore pizza with pepperoni, sausage, meatballs, bacon, ham, and chicken and I could barely finish the crust.  Be sure to get the altered ranch dipping sauce, which is a bit more watery than usual, but certainly an unassumingly amazing complement to any pizza crust.  Aside from pizza, they also have other Italian offerings dependent on the day.

Service was exceptional. It looked like the place was running only under two people. Granted, it's a small place, seating only about 15 - 20 or so, but it was always packed during the dinner time (stayed there about 2.5 hours talking to a friend).  Environment isn't too interesting-pretty plain. But the personalities of the employees really make the place.  One of the guys there was the owner, co-founder of Nora's Italian in Vegas on Flamingo.  He really keeps the Italian spirit alive, making sure the customers are enjoying their food and their experience overall.  Music was chill, a great kick-back from the long work day. There was a small tv showing the news.  All in all, with two staff up front, the place handled itself pretty well. 

Advice: Probably wouldn't come here for a formal, classy date, but would come here any other day.  Service was excellent and comforting, giving me that local business feeling you rarely see here in Vegas.  Food was mouth watering (honestly one of the best pizzas I've ever eaten with the best crust I've ever had).  Price point-rationale.  Come!  I wasn't about to get the cannoli because the guy at the counter said it would take 30 minutes to make, but my friend and I ended up staying past that time anyways, and the place gave us two on the house.  Crisp, sweet outer shell and a hazel-nutty, cinnamon-ny filling creating a churro-like taste. Pretty satisfying end to the meal.

As a self proclaimed pizza critic from NYC, this was one of the most delish slices of 'za I've ever had. It was hot, cheesy, and flavorful. The crust was the most perfect combination of crusty and doughy. It's worth driving four hours from LA to get a banging pie.
Lived on this side of town for a few years now and just tried OSP if you live around here stop denying yourself the best pizza in vegas

Best pizza I've ever had! The ingredients are fresh and everything is made in that kitchen, not brought in already prepped. I go here whenever I have a pizza craving. Staff is so nice and friendly. Love the atmosphere too. Recommend this place to everyone I meet.

Favorite pizza place in Vegas. Huge fan of sourdough. The ingredients are all high quality and fresh. 10/10 would recommend. I've had only positive interactions with the staff and the restaurant is modest and clean.

This is my favorite pizza place in Las Vegas.

Why? The pizza is fantastic. The crust is delicious and the dough is handmade in house. The sauce is also homemade and is different than any other pizza sauce I've had in this city. It tastes like exactly like fresh tomatoes. I'm having a hard time trying to describe just how much I love this pizza (and am getting seriously hungry in the process).

The grilled rosemary lemonade is out of this world, and the white sauce that they serve with the garlic knots is also something to try. (Get it. Fall in love. Dip everything in it. Take home as much as you can.)

The service is always great, the people behind the counter are friendly, fast, and seem to enjoy what they're doing. While this is definitely a tiny, hole-in-the-wall place in a kind of strange location for the fantastic things they're doing with pizza, the ambiance inside is cute. They play a lot of Frank Sinatra and it has good lighting. Not bad. 

I need to move closer to this restaurant.

Delicious!  Exceeded our expectations.  Instead of the predictable pizzeria fare, we dined on a gourmet-style of pizza and accompaniments.  My husband especially loved the stuffed chicken.  The pizza was excellent, particularly the sauce.  The rosemary infused knotted bread was exceptional, too, and a unique take on traditional pizzeria fare.  The only disappointing item was the cannoli.  The filling was somewhat sweet, but plain.  The addition of chopped pistachios wasn't enough flavor.  Still, it wasn't bad, but we had higher expectations after tasting the other dishes.  I highly recommend this place for casual dining or takeout.  The quality and unique style of their dishes took us pleasantly by surprise.

This is the second time I have eaten here. Today I ordered a small classic combo. It was delicious the pizzas are generously sized the topping ingredients are of top quality. The service was fast and very friendly. The dining area is immaculate. The staff makes all customers feel welcome. Old School is the perfect neighborhood spot.

This is the real deal Italian restaurant with real Italians, more than pizza! I do love their pizza too get it by slice (huge) good deal! Chicken is so good with roasted garlic potatoes, and macaroni & cheese is the best in Vegas! It is always hard to find a place with good salad, but they put this amazing aged cheese on their salad you can really taste difference. Good Eats!

Review yesterday was ambiguous so here's a clarification... Pizza and service was excellent... Fresh toppings and can see most of kitchen which is clean.... Have had garlic knots and the octopus salad (both great)...however this is not the "cheap pizza night" place...it is definitely worth the money and a great dinner...but u get what u pay for here...2 large pizzas was $60...

Something different than those commercial pizzas; Pizzahut, Papa Johns etc. Anyways this was our first time trying this and wow, this put our perspective of pizza to a whole new level. Cannoli was amazing as well. Enough said, just get your tail here and try them yourselves.

5 stars isn't enough to properly rate this amazingly, delicious pizza! My family had the Carnivore OMG size and the garlic knots. The pizza crust was super good, crispy on the bottom and cooked perfectly. There were whole slices of bacon on this pizza! Great ratio of sauce and cheese. This will definitely be our go-to pizza place.

OMG.  Authentic, Italian style pizza.  This place is incredible- even better than the pizza I had in Italy! I ordered a slice of the veggie- fresh heirloom tomatoes, kalamata olives, spinach, and giant cloves of garlic. Had that perfect thin, crunchy crust that I Love so very much. $8 for the slice but HUGE and well worth it! Great service and incredibly fresh ingredients.  

This is the best pizza i've ever had.  Without a doubt...I will most definitely be back very soon! Can't wait to try their salads.

Real sourdough crust, crispy on the outside fluffy and airy on the inside, fresh toppings, homemade sauce, whole Mediterranean olives, fresh roasted garlic, I'm in HEAVEN! I live in Henderson, and I'd gladly drive out here to eat this pizza again, any day of the week!

The pies and salads are delicious and I appreciate that the ingredients are fresh. In addition, each order is prepared when ordered and not just sitting around getting stale and old. However this poses a problem when the place is packed. Last time we went in each table was full and there was a line going out the door. The tables were dirty, silverware, lids and condiments were un-stocked and it took almost a half hour to even receive our salad. They were overwhelmed and short-staffed and it showed.

I must say that I've noticed a change since the first time we dined in about six months ago. At that time the owner was still cooking and it seemed as though there was more attention to detail. As long as the food remains delish, we will continue to choose them over any other local pizzeria. Let's keep our fingers crossed; North Las Vegas has been lacking in the good food arena for way too long.

A friend raved about this place and I can see why .. Very quaint and charming restaurant with pretty good food .. Let's start with the side salads ... Good lettuce to dressing ratio .. Not too soggy and pretty tasty .. We ordered the build your own pizza with pepperoni bacon and mushroom .. Small is enough to feed 3 people easily .. My only problem was the dough was very .. Doughy if that makes sense I'm typically a thin crust girl so it felt a little extra on the dough side and a little easy on the cheese side but overall a good taste .. The lemonade is to die for and they serve it in large mason jars ... The only thing I would do different is to maybe order my pizza well done .. And extra cheese otherwise a pretty solid place ..

This is a great pizza place.    I kinda feel bad though, cuz I rushed them to get our cannoli order on the way out.  I didn't realize they had to make it,  most places have the cannoli ready to go.  A bunch of Air Force guys were in there and we thought we'd have to wait for them to get all their orders before we could get our dessert that we ordered to go.   Kudos to the staff for being friendly when I was rushing them.
The stars are for the cannoli. Which is amazing and the ONLY reason you should come here. Though the crust was good the pizza itself had little to no flavor. A big MEH. Salad--also flavorless.

Amazing pizza with the most amazing live cultured crust. Their salads are different and superb! Their specials- like the stuffed chicken with pistachio crust are soooo good! I even ordered a whole pizza once to take on the plane with me for a gift. It's that good!

Oh wow, this pizza is incredible. Hands down, the best in NLV. Top ten in the city- and it has a chic, nicely designed dining room. The kind of place u would actually want to go on a date or with friends. Ambient and cool. The menu is impressive- it hints to what will be an experience where people who actually care and have tastes are making your pie. I am getting wordy here, but trust me the salad was fresh and not prebagged greens. No shortcuts. The dressing also was delicious and the crust of the pizza..., perfect! Also, the guys and lady who run the place are welcoming and clearly take pride in their food.  Great vibe, nice ambience, kick-ass pizza.

So i came one afternoon to see how good the food was the a/c didnt work in there so i took the food to go had got pizza by the slice for me and my sister and it just didnt seem very cheesy or saucey we got hawaian i guess when u order by the slice they just cut off a slice of cheese pizza and add ham n pinapple stick it back into the oven i was ok, i wil have to try this place again to try the cannolis and maybe a whole pizza as of now its not my top pizza spot.

I came in once and had a plethora of things.

Vegas meets Italy is, hands down, my favorite pizza. A little sweetness, a little saltiness, and a little peppery flavor from the arugula. And hidden gems of crunch from the pistachios? All my favorite things in one! Don't be fooled by dates in your food. SO GOOD. 

Also tried the Pork Reigns pizza. Definitely a kind of pizza to hip your carnivorous friends too! Delectably meaty! 

You can't go wrong with the burrata and caponata bruschetta. If you LOVE eggplant, this is a must order. Burrata cheese just melts in your mouth. How do you NOT enjoy it? I can order this and eat this with a sausage stuffed wing for my lunch. 

Now the sausage stuffed chicken wing? Topped with pistachios! Nom nom nom nom. Need I say more?!?!

Back for a second round with the boys at old school. It has been a few weeks since my last visit but they remembered me the moment I walked in. I love the product and I love the service. This time I ordered the Chicken, mushroom and spinach pizza absolutely amazing!

My whole family gets excited when I come home with one of these gigantic pies. The pizza dough/crust is amazing I love it. I have seen some talk about the toppings and some don't seem happy with the pepperoni/sausage choice. Generally I find pepperoni to be greasy by the nature of the product which is one of the reasons I have stop eating. 

However I have to say love the fresh nature of there products and I am really a fan!

This really is a North Las Vegas gem! I got the solo meal (pizza with half an order or garlic knots) and it was absolutely delicious. My mom had the salad which had fresh mozzarella. The atmosphere is absolutely wonderful and the old school music really sets the tone. The staff is friendly and the pizza is huge. Will be returning!
5  awesome customer serves! Sample the tea and lemonade, was very refreshing to drink on this hot day. Thought I was back east. The pizza was delicious. I will be back
Great service, delicious cannoli's, great pizza crust!  Place is a little small and it gets busy.

We stopped here for dinner at around 7pm on Christmas Eve.  It was the only non-chain place we could find open on the North side of town. We were soooo glad we found it!

For three of us, we ordered the large Gio salad ($8.99) and a large pizza ($20.75) with one half caramelized onions and roasted bell peppers and the other half house-made sausage and black olives.

The salad was absolutely yummy, and the perfect appetizer before pizza.  The Gio consists of Tomato, fennel, cucumber, onion, fresh mozzarella and a very good house-made vinaigrette.  I've never had a salad quite like it.  It was very fresh, and a wonderful combination of flavors.  I could have eaten a large one of these myself and just called it a night.

On to the pizza.  I don't usually gush about pizza, but I feel obliged to make an exception.  This pie is really special.  First, the crust is absolutely the best I've ever tasted.  It's a sourdough recipe and cooked to absolute perfection.  It's light, fluffy and wonderfully crispy in all the right places with just the right amount of chewiness.  The toppings were sublime.  I'm a vegetarian, but I snuck a little bite of the house-made sausage and it was quite superb.  The caramelized onions and roasted peppers were extremely flavorful.  The olives and fresh mozzarella were very high quality.

Service was excellent.  The man we ordered from was very friendly.  Salad arrived within just a few minutes and the pizza very soon after we finished the salad.  Price was very good for this high quality food.  Total for 3 was $36.97 including tax and tip.  They use Square for checkout, so you get a nice emailed receipt within seconds of purchase.

We arrived very hungry, and the salad and the large pizza provided us with plenty of food.  You could probably stretch it to four people and you'd have room for dessert.

This is an excellent little place to get some seriously high quality pie.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal.  If we're ever back in Vegas, we'll be sure to stop by.

Thank you!

So on a trip back from Utah our group was starving and needed a fast food place to stop in. Well we found old school pizza and decided to stop here. Walking up to the business we almost thought it was closed but when we opened their main door we were surprised to see one of the nicest decorated pizza joints around. This was was great and I would highly recommend if you are in the area. 

Their pizza here took me back to Italy easily, everything seems freshly made plus the slices are jinormous and one could be enough, however I ate two on my own. They make few teas and drinks that are in jars and are super tasty as well. The staff is really nice and helpful as well. Don't expect super fast service as they make everything fresh and fresh means time making it. 

They may need to do some work on the outside sign because it does not match the amazing food and atmosphere inside. I will be back here for sure!

I would say this is very good in comparison to chains and other pizzerias, however it didn't quite hit the mark for me. The crust is perfect and the sauce is nice and sweet, however the pizza was overloaded with toppings (compared to true Italian pizza) and I found that the cheese didn't compliment the sauce well. The garlic knots and dipping sauce were very good though. 
The space itself is nice and the service was good.

Great pizza. Love the ordering system online very thorough it sends you a text confirming your order is being made and then one when your food is ready. The garlic marscapone sauce was great for dipping. Although I thought the pizza was great I still have had some better pies... I'm biased because I've spent a lifetime in NY not to mention our pizza is so much cheaper.

This place is delicious!!! From Rosemary infused lemonade, garlic Rosemary knots, Gio fennel salad and not to mention the bomb pizza, this place is the one of my favorite pizza places in Las Vegas. I highly recommend it everything is excellent. If you live anywhere in the valley or your visiting please stop in. You order at the counter the service is friendly. I will warn they get busy so it may take during the peak hour a short while to get a table if you're dining in but that's just because it's that awesome.

What a nice friendly atmosphere.  Loved being greated with an authentic Italian "How you doing today?"

The pizza was pretty good except for the crust.  It was tough to chew.  I'm hoping that was just a fluke and will give it another try.

I would suggest they get a merchant account so they can take credit cards at the register.  It's inconvenient, not to mention an addtional fee, to use the ATM...even if it's in house.

We placed our order online and the pizza was just coming out of the oven when we arrived. It was incredibly fresh. The salad dressing is very tasty and the cannoli is amazing. I'm not a fan of the usual chocolate chips on cannoli so this order made me very happy. Perhaps it was the hint of cinnamon that made it so yummy. I'm not sure but I'll definitely be back for that cannoli!

Very authentic Italian food. Homemade sauce and they're homemade lemonade with iced tea was amazing. Definitely recommend if you love pizza and also the wine is delicious!!! Very friendly staff. Perfect to take the family

Gio and co. were amazing to us tonight! We had a group that literally filled the restaurant, and they were fantastic. Everything we tried was exceptional. The standouts for me were the Vegas to Italy pizza, the chicken and potatoes and the ziti. I can't say enough about that ziti!  I thought the hard boiled eggs would make it taste weird, but it was super! I also can't say enough about the atmosphere and the service. Definitely 5 stars on all fronts.

I've had this bookmarked since my last visit here for Thanksgiving. So I definitely had to check it out!! 

Walking in the place is smaller than I expected, but the cashier was very nice when we approached. We already knew what we wanted from Yelp pics. We ordered the small sausage/pepperoni, stuffed wings, & garlic Knots. 

Took about 5 mins for the garlic Knots which were tasty, fresh & hot. I don't think I liked the garnish on the knots tho (not sure the name of what that stuff was, but it thru the taste off). Stuffed wings came out next, they were fresh & hot too. We didn't enjoy them. The sausage it was stuffed with wasn't good. It was different & I'm glad I tried it. Then the pizza came out. I 4got to tell them well done so it wasn't as done as we like, but that was my fault. Pizza was piping hot, extra sauced. GOOD PIZZA!!!! 

Place isn't 5 stars, but with the good service & good pizza they're worth 4 stars.

I'm torn between 4 and 5 stars, but I like to see local businesses doing well (especially in North Vegas), so I'm bumping up to 5.
First of all, the place is pretty tiny; we brought a group of 7 for lunch and almost took over the whole joint. The ambiance is total local pizza place, and I give them bonus points for having cute riddles up on the chalkboard walls. Answer correctly and get a free cannoli!
The older lady up front was friendly taking my order, but not the quickest. A couple minutes later, Chef Gio (I assume) came up from the back and was much more efficient.
Of course, the main reason I'm giving this place high marks is because of the pizza - the crust was really good, thin chewy sourdough, and they have an excellent selection of toppings to go with the tomato-y sauce and mozzarella cheese. The slices are not premade, so you can get any toppings you want. I got the chef's special 'Calabrese' - calabrese salami, banana peppers, black olives. Yum! Plus, the slices are HUGE, so one totally filled me up. I added a side salad and a drink, and the total came up to a reasonable $7 (which I paid via CREDIT CARD on the ipad at the counter!).
Others in my group ordered the baked ziti, which I didn't sample, but looked really good and cheesy (minus points because it had peas in it - ew) and the meatball sandwich, which looked awesome and huge. We did not get the garlic knots, which seem popular in the rest of the reviews...next time!
Overall, thank you, Old School Pizzeria, for bringing some local flavor to the land of chains!

I've passed by this place a bazillion times since they opened and never stopped in... for some reason the name never drew me in. So yesterday I came home from work and my hubby told me there were leftovers in the fridge from the pizza place on the corner. Cool, I was hungry, and leftover pizza is always a good thing. I pulled it out, threw on the toaster oven, warmed it up, and (insert singing angels and trumpets blazing) IT. WAS. GLORIOUS. The sauce that came with the amazing garlic knots (with chunks of roasted garlic cloves!!!!) was better than a boring Ranch that I expected. The pizza.... the crust was actually flavorful, not just your typical white flour muck the big chains use. Almost like a sourdough. Amazing. The sauce was thick and also flavorful which was refreshing in itself. And the big chunks of, what was it, basil? that I found on occasion really sent my taste buds into ecstasy. And don't get me started on the meatball and sausage slices. I'll be here forever!! Why oh WHY haven't I ordered from you guys sooner???!!

Wow.  I've driven past this place for years and finally stopped.  The pizza is off the charts.  The bread is among the best artisan bread I have ever had.  The lemonade is very interesting and not like any lemonade I have ever had.  A small pizza fed three.  Prices are not bad.  A little high or pizza, but the quality makes up for it.  Toppings are also gourmet.  The cost of salads and sides is reasonable.  I'm going back as soon as I can.

If you are the sort of person who thinks Little Ceasars makes good pizza this might not be the place for you, but if you can tell a quality crust from a frozen crust you will like it.  I've had some high end pizza in my life and I'd put this place against any of them.  A real gem for North Las Vegas.

Old School Pizzeria has won my heart a couple of years ago, but not for their pizza.  Their Crazy Good Chicken is just that, crazy good.  This meal comes with two thick and juicy pieces of baked chicken (roughly 8 oz.), big chunks of potato, and stuffing. Butter and olive oils is then drenched all over it.  It's crazy thinking about how good this chicken is. Where else can you get chicken this good at a pizzeria?  So far, only here. If chicken at a pizzeria is not your thing, then get a pizza.  Each slice is huge, especially their Monster Slice at $4.00.  Toppings will cost you an additional $.40.  Their pizzas remind me of an old school giant pizza that you'll find in the streets of New York City.  In my opinion, I think Old School is better.  You can't have a meal here without trying their Rosemary Garlic Knots.  6 knots cost about $3 or $7.99 with a Monster Slice.  

The service is always great.  There's usually a line at Old School Pizzeria and it's mostly for take-out.  Keep in mind that Old School is very popular and it takes time to prep a pizza and even longer to bake their Crazy Good Chicken.  

Prices:
Crazy Good Chicken - $11.99 
Monster slice (little over $4 - $.40 additional toppings)
Small Pizza (serves 2-3) - $11.99
Large (serves 3-4) - $16.75
OMG (serves 5-8) - $24.99
Calzones (serves 1-2) - $8.99
Five Cheese Mac - $12.50
Meatball Sandwich - $10.00
Monster Slice & Half Order of Bread Knots - $7.99

Overall, I recommend Old School for their pizza and of course, their chicken. 

2017 Yelp Review #83

This is my favorite place to get thin crust pizza close to home. I love their super fresh ingredients and choices. I haven't had anything here I didn't like. Their dressing is delicious and so are their cannolis. I would highly recommend stopping in.

What a treat!!!!  I have to give this place as many exclamation points as stars.  This is the best part of living in this neighborhood.  From the artisanal pizza to the irresistible cannolis to the Rosemary infused lemonade, this pizzeria elevates everyday food.  They have something for all taste buds.  It is a must on your Las Vegas foodie list.  Worth the drive.

I absolutely LOVE this place, the service is wonderful from the moment you walk in the door. The ambience is wonderful and quiet , it small but that's good because it gives it a homier feel & Let me tell you this is the best pizza I have EVVVVVVER eaten in my life. This is the one place my fiancé and I call at least once a week! If your ever in Vegas please try it you will not be disappointed (or don't, just more for me!
Solid service! Delicious pizza! The young Hispanic kid at the cashier is an ultimate gentleman and scholar. Very very nice guy and clean place

Hands down, BEST PIZZA IN LAS VEGAS. If you like New York style pizza, then you'll absolutely love this place. I saw some negative reviews, and I honestly don't understand how someone could not like this place. (they must be the type that thinks frozen home pizza is the best, LOL) Since I tried Old School, I can never enjoy a pizza from anywhere else. I'm always disappointed and think "I wish I had Old School instead". Unfortunately I no longer live close enough to get it as often as I use to. Hopefully sometime in the future Old School will have a chain, one of the locations being in the Centennial Hills area. HAHA, I know unlikely, but a girl can dream right? ;D

Seriously this place does not mess around when it comes to great pizza. This is pizza to be savored. The best pizza I have ever had. It was a really great atmosphere, kinda romantic for mine and hubbies date night. The guy making our pizza was super friendly man can he make a good pizza. Totally worth your time and money, very delicious.

If you are looking for pizza that's delicious and more on the gourmet side then this is the place for you! The seating are is very clean and looks friendly and cozy. I like that you can see them making your food and that everything is fresh and tasty. You can tell they take time putting thought into their menu and it shows. I will go there many more times and encourage everyone to try them out. Their side salads  with garlic creamy dressing are wonderful because they aren't just bagged salad. Their pizza by the slice is like NYC pizza and customizable.

Living in Vegas for 3 months now, thought it was a pizza wasteland  Until we walked into Old School Pizza. Best pizza my wife and I have had in years. My wife almost cried because it reminded her of her Italian  grandmothers cooking. Thank you Old School!

I found this place on Yelp and decided to give it a try one evening when I was hanging out with some friends.

I ordered the Regina Margherita and I liked the very thin crust on it, but it was definitely lacking some serious flavor. 

I normally don't add any condiments to my pizza, but after eating this I quickly realized that it needed way more salt or some kind of seasoning to liven things up.

Overall this was not the worst pizza I've had, but it was not the best either. In all honesty I was a little bummed out to taste pizza that was pretty much flavorless. 

This experience won't deter me from giving this joint another try and next time I'll make sure to try something entirely different.

Old School has great pizza the sour dough crust and home made rosemary lemonade is addicting. The customer service is unbelievable, fast if you are not sure of what you want just tell the chef and he will tell what your having, I love it. The garlic knots and the crazy chicken are to die for...  I have sent many of guest to this palace of pizza. All who come from California and New York they agree with the great flavors and authentic yummy goodness.... Keep up the great work guys chef gio is the best...

We were in the area at our favorite movie theater across the street and decided to see if this place lived up to the hype. 
We walked in and found a clean well Kaye's out little place. First off loved the chalkboard menus hanging throughout. And you can see the entire kitchen. 
I tried the Porchetta Sandwich and I couldn't eat it fast enough. This was excellent. My Sons tried the Five Cheese Pesto pizza and the Carnivore. They both gave thumbs up and say it the best pizza they've had this area. We also tried the Lentil Soup and was blown away on how tasty it was. This place is now our go to pizza spot for the NW Valley.

It's with a heavy heart that I say goodbye to old school pizza. We used to eat here at least once a week. No care or effort goes into the food anymore. The crust is over cooked nine out of ten times when we order now. I hadn't eaten here in months but I had a bad craving for their knots and mascarpone sauce. I ordered a dozen of them so I would still get a few and be able to share lol. I literally got next to NO mascarpone sauce. Guys, cmon. I've been in the restaurant business my whole life. The saucer had MAYBE a quarter of an ounce of sauce in it. Completely unacceptable. Thank goodness I had stuff in the fridge to throw an aioli together really quick. Secondly, since when do all the toppings for the vegas meets Italy pizza come on the side? I can see the arugula for sure, as that adds a great crunch when it's not wilted, but ALL THE TOOPINGS? Completely ruined the entire pizza. At least I can always count on the salad being ok. What a shame. You guys used to be the best spot in the neighborhood and I referred everyone to you for pizza. Not anymore

I have to say this place is outstanding!  My boyfriend and I shared the Vegas meets Italy pizza everything was so fresh . Scamorza, mozzarella, ricotta, pistachio, chopped dates, heirloom tomatoes, arugula, prosciutto on a date cream sauce. Best Italian I've had by far. The stuffed chicken wings other homemade sausage was delicious as well.  I will be back  for sure !

I had bookmarked this place for months after hearing how amazing it was. Just a sidenote, I'm a huge fan of thin-crust pizza, crispy on the bottom and edges, and a sucker for a good crust. My fave crust is at pizzeria mozza--tastes like French baguette crust. 

I personally wan't too fond of the garlic knots-- they were sourdough based, and though I love sourdough, I wasn't quite expecting it in a garlic knot or an Italian place, or at a pizza joint. But it had good flavor, and the sauce was to die-for. 

The pizza had fresh toppings, but again, because the crust was sourdough, it didn't live up to my expectations. The crust had a nice crisp, but, I have other places that I prefer more than here. 

A quaint place, and the pizza takes quite a while to get made. The prices aren't low either if you order the supreme or set specials. Would I go back? I'd give it one more shot. I also want to try other items next time, like the stuffed chicken wings.
Lots of character, pretty good pizza however don't expect prefect , other items are good as well definitely stop by for lunch , you won't be disappointed

It's old school pizza. So..  gotta be good, right. Wrong. It's ok cuz cheese is delicious. But other than that it's plain tasting. Hard to make pizza plain. But they did it. So, I'm giving them 3 stars for figuring out a way to make pizza taste plain. 
Not an easy task.

Stopped at this gem on the way to Utah. The pizza slices are huge, unique, and delicious. Classic setting: simple menu, simple decor, and very cozy. The staff was very friendly and the service was fast. Worth the stop!

The only reason i am giving them 4 stars and not 5 is because we called in an order and 30 minutes later when we arrived to pick it up the cashier told us our order was not put in. However they did make it up by throwing in some free cannolies and lemonade. The pizza was really good! Had alot of toppings on it. The lemonade was delicious. A must try! We will definitely come back here!
