Not sure how to rate this.  The food was good but the atmosphere was to loud there was music and TV all the noise in the kitchen.  It was frustrating just sitting here.  Some of our food was burnt and the guy that was taking our order seemed like he was having a bad day and transferred that to me.... I did not enjoy myself here.  We are on a table that looked like particleboard.  I just seemed like they didn't want to put money into it...will not go back

We were craving pizza and wanted something local - not a chain! We ordered the Pork Reigns and Vegetariana pizzas. Both were very good. They were served with what I would call a garlicky ranch-like sauce, which is amazing!!! They also come with their marinara sauce on the side, which is slightly sweet.

We liked our food so much we decided to go back. The second time we created our own calzones. I especially liked the calzones! I'd recommend creating your own with your favorite toppings. We also ordered the garlic knots because of all the good reviews. I personally thought they were a bit tough to chew. Maybe we got a bad batch?! 

I'd recommend them if you're looking for something different. The quality of the ingredients they use to make their pizza and calzones was evident in the taste! Prices were reasonable too!

Super delicious pizza?! YES! 

Old School Pizzeria is seriously super yummy! Its right across the street from The Cannery on Craig and its not a huge place. The location, though far from my place, is pretty quiet and nice. Inside OSP it's VERY clean and bright! I love the chalk board walls and all the information throughout the inside. You go up to the counter and are greeted by the pizza maker and he gives you a quick run down of the menu. They have 3 sizes of pizza you can order, as well as single slices.

I chose a "big" cheese pizza and a side of garlic knots. You order off an iPad and it even has one of them card sliders on the side for convenience. Your receipt is also e-mailed to you! Santiago and I sat down to wait for our yummies as the pizza maker go to work. It was really neat seeing him knead the dough and get it ready for us. Before we knew it he was placing it into the oven and getting out knots ready. Whilst we waited Santiago drew on the chalk board and I watch tv. 

The pizza was ready in about 10-12 minutes and I asked for some ranch, which he informed me was actually homemade and mascarpone cheese and spices! YUM!

Off we went to Summerlin! I was a little sad because I figured the pizza was going to be gross and cold when we got home, alas it was still warm and yummy! Upon looking at the pizza you can tell its homemade and not the stuff from other chain places. On the walls it says the dough is made in batches every 36 hours so they do tend to run out. The dough here is perfect and chewy but not overly chewy, its seriously good! He put the right amount of sauce on the pizza as well as a good amount of cheese! The rosemary garlic knots were sooooooooo good! I seriously wanted more!

For the pizza and knots our total was around $14. I did also tip since it was 8:45pm and they were closing at 9pm. 

I will def come here again when I'm on this side of town! The cool thing is, even 2 days later the pizza still tastes amazing! 
YAY!

Our favorite pizza place in all of Vegas! Every time we go through town we have to stop. In fact, my husband and I discussed flying in just for the pizza here. I like the Margherita and my husband gets sausage/pepperoni. The garlic knots with the garlic dipping sauce is delicious also. The sauce on the pizza is so so good. We love to try pizza to find the best. So far, this place has been the best!

Awesome pizza. Not the normal slice and it takes a little longer than your normal pizza place but it's well worth the wait. They have a mason jar grilled Rosemary lemonade that's pretty legit as well!
Wonderful atmosphere with Excellent Food and the service was Great!  Simply Awesome..
My wife and I went here for dinner tonight and both agreed it was the best pizza we've ever had in our entire lives.

When you walk through an Italian pizza parlor and the smell of fresh basil is in the air and the chef is busy rolling out pizza dough right behind the counter, you know you've come to the right place. 

The previous business located at this restaurant was a small bakery and it was pretty run down, but the new owners have really cleaned this place up and I'm really impressed. I know this place is known for their pizza, but who could resist apple-wood oven-roasted half-chicken with roasted potatoes for only $6.99? It did take a while to cook, but that just told me it wasn't sitting on a heater since that morning and it was being cooked fresh. The smell of the chicken roasting in the oven was INCREDIBLE, and when I brought it to work ALL of my co-workers said the smell was amazing. I found whole roasted garlic and rosemary in my plate, and the chicken fell off the bone. Oh man.

It's almost lunch break and I'm heading back over there in a minute to try out their pizza. Old School Pizzeria and I are going to be best friends.
Took a bite from my Giant Pepperoni, pepper, and sausage pizza, and i was like "yup just found my new lunch spot."

Pretty good slice! This is a small mom and pop pizzeria with a lot of charm. The service is excellent and the chef is really friendly. 
Now the food: we ordered garlic knots, two slices and I had to try their cannoli!
The garlic knots are dipped in butter and have fresh basil on them, they also come with a side of house garlic sauce. They're pretty good but too fancy for me. 
The pizza, though not my favorite, is pretty good! The slices are huge! The sauce is on the salty side but blends nicely in the slice. 
Now the cannoli, excellent! I was pretty full after the huge slice (it's a meal in itself) but couldn't say no to a cannoli. It had a cinnamon flavor to it and was deliciously fresh! 
All in Ll, I def see myself returning here.
This was a great find! The restaurant is a quant little place and food was great! We ordered the OMG classic combo,  very good! We will definitely be back
Best Pizza in all of Vegas. Try everything though. Noting here is bad. Mac and cheese is one of the best dishes I've ever had.

They leaven their own crust for 5 days! It is so good, slightly sourdough-y and crispy and stretchy. And they default serve the monster slice with house-made ranch, and the garlic knots have roasted garlic cloves in there with them... I was really surprised at the quality of everything and size of the slice, it's a really good deal.
Pizza was good, but the lemonade wasn't my flavorite. Did not sit well with me. Don't really remember much else. But I remember not hating it.

The best pizza sauce!! Love the fresh basil on the pizza. The garlic knots are probably the best I've ever had! They were not over greasy like other places and the touch of rosemary is perfect. I love how cute it is inside too. It's very rustic and romantic for a small joint. I love the employees passion for the food and restaurant.

I'v been here several times. It's always fresh and delicious. "EVERY TIME". I tried about every thing on the menu during my visits. I'm here to tell you there isn't a better Pizza shop in town, And yes, I'm a local. I've tried them all.

I've been here twice now. Had half margarita & half pepperoni & sausage pizza the first time. Second time was the carnivore & the antipasto salad. Loved the salad. They chop it & put it in a bread bowl. Delicious! Pizza was good but a bit heavy. Will definitely try something lighter. Also had the homemade cannoli on the first visit. So good. Both times, the person taking my order was helpful & knowledgeable about the menu. Great pizza and great customer service. Only reason for the lack of a star is the parking but will always go back there.

Not impressed at all with the pizza.  Then again I am a New Yorker so I have very high standards when it comes to pizza.  This definitely didn't make my cut...I suppose I do need to edit this review though...it was sent only after eating the pizza and before anything else.   I still stand behind my not liking it.( to each his own).but the calzone was very good and the 5 cheese mac and cheese was phenomenal.  Based on all of the other 5 star reviews it is definitely worth a visit.

Rain and witnessing a drug deal go down in the parking lot did not deter us from trying OSP, and we are so glad we did!

I need this pizza in my life.
Where to start? It's not your ordinary pizzeria with items like "date cream" or "scamorza" and even a porchetta sandwich. 

Garlic Mascarpone cream? Yes, thank you for this delicious creamy dip for your pizza, fingers, whatever...you'll want to take shots of this stuff.

The place is small and comfortable. We sat in front of the pizza window to watch the magic.

They cure their dough for 1.5 days to give it a natural crunchy crust. It holds up to the cheese and toppings without going limp.

The sauce is perfect. Light & fresh pear tomatoes which is not overdone.

I can't wait to come back and take my North Vegas clients to lunch here. Helpers were right about this being a hidden gem!
Delicious pizza. Price is fair. Everything made from scratch. So come with time and patience. It can take little while for the food to come out. But you can count that it'll be fresh and tasty.

This is the best pizza in Las Vegas that I've tried so far. I really like the Vegas Meets Italy, which has smoked mozzarella, ricotta, fresh arugula, heirloom cherry tomatoes, prosciutto, dates and pistachios. The crust almost tastes like a sourdough, which is really good. It's so good I order the X-Large size, which is huge and $45.00. The service is always friendly. 

The grilled rosemary lemonade is good, as is the passion fruit tea.
Best pizza place out in Vegas period, great food and great service. The rosemary lemonade is to die for and the pizza is amazing.
Now I'm no pizza expert but this was some damn fine pizza.  The dough they use at this joint is very fresh and delicious.  It's just too bad that it's so far away from my side of town :/
Omg! Idk where to begin. Best place ever pizza was amazing and so was the customer service i totally recommend this place must order the chicken wings only two but worth every penny.

Although this pizzeria is out in North town, the food should be the number one reason to trek here from other parts of the Valley. It's a small pizzeria tucked into a small strip mall next to an auto shop.

Once you step inside you are in a world of pizza pies of olden days. As you approach the counter you are greeted by men working recklessly at their craft. If you arrive when they are busy, you will see the older men yelling at the younger ones, "Don't forget that cannoli!" "We've got more coming in!", and they all run about behind the counter in plain view. Definitely "old school". 

I placed an order for take out on their online ordering system (YES! I LOVE IT!). And when I arrived my pizza was nearly done. Also of note - the system will keep you updated via text message on the progress of your order. 

Ordered: One Large pizza (serves 3 - 4), with half ham, and half ham + hot peppers. An order of Garlic Rosemary Bread Knots, and One Cannoli. 

While I waited for my pizza I got a fountain drink, not long after the young man at the counter helped me out to my car and placed my order into my backseat for me.

When the pizza arrived at my home it was beautiful! Perfectly cooked with a thin, crispy, and somewhat chewy crust. Really, it was just that perfection of pizza crust style. Tomato sauce and cheese melded in food harmony. The ham placed on top of the pie was plentiful, and the hot peppers (red and yellow) were fresh and gave my part of the pizza that extra kick I was looking for. 

Rosemary Garlic Bread Knots were unfathomably good for just being bread and some spices. The rosemary is the simple star here - changing regular old knots into a savory, aromatic eating experience.

Last - I split the Canoli in half to share with my husband (what a nice wife I am!), and it had a flaky exterior and a creamy inside. Absolutely delicious! I wish only I had gotten two instead of the one. Well, now I know for next time!

Best pizza ever. Quaint restaurant that is small, rustic but works. If you're lucky you'll get a table so take out might be the best option. Call your order in and pick up if you're in a hurry. If your lucky enough to get a seat or can wait it's worth it. Great feel in the restaurant watching people and the cooks!

The pizza here is by far the absolute best in Las Vegas.  The source their ingredients locally as much as possible, use traditional sourdough crust and have a warm, friendly fly atmosphere.  This is the place to get a slice, or a whole pie!

This is some damn good pizza. But again, pricey! Thin crust, extremely fresh ingredients, definitely your more "high end" pizza joint for the area. They serve rosemary lemonade in mason jars for purchase....you can even bring the Mason jar back for a cheaper refill next time. Small place inside...only about 6 tables. But the pizza is amazing.
This joint consistently has great pizza. The staff is friendly and greet you at the door like an old friend. The seating area is a little small but the atmosphere makes up for it.

Best pizza crust ever! Naturally leavened pizza dough.  Seriously delicious food in a casual atmosphere.  I came here for lunch on a Friday, based on the Yelp reviews. The restaurant was busy, but service was quick. Can't wait to try meatball sub Wednesdays!

Have been driving past the Old School Pizzeria for months and keep telling myself-I have to try that place!  So last night was the night, while the ambience in the restaurant is nice and you can watch them make your pizza, their menu was ala carte only. No family meal deals or pizza/wing specials.  I ordered a large pepperoni/sausage pizza and rosemary garlic knots.  I was not impressed with their homemade sausage and pizza crust was tough to chew.  The garlic knots were hard around the edges and equally tough to chew, not enough garlic and way TOO much rosemary.  For 10 knots they put an entire sprig of rosemary on top which made a few impossible to eat. Was very disappointed!

Best pizza and staff in the city! Authentic and original! Will be back again soon!
We had 3 small pizzas for the 5 of us and that was perfect! The grilled rosemary lemonade was scrumptious!
Amazing the owner is super nice. Pizza Amazing, gelato is yummy and cannoli is to die for

This is definitely a little hidden gem of North Las Vegas. When you walk in the location itself is super small so I recommend taking your order to go or getting here early to snag a spot. 

Their food is outstanding! The pizza slices are giant, one slice is about the same as 2-3 normal pizza slices and the taste is seriously delicious. The dough is unlike any other place I've found in the valley, it is the perfect amount of crispy and tasty. They have some other great food options too like mac n cheese, garlic knots, meatball sandwiches and salads. They also have some pretty great lunch specials like a slice of pizza along with a side salad or side of garlic knots.

I highly recommend checking this place out if you're a pizza lover like me!

This is a pretty good pizza spot in North Las Vegas. Fairly close to the VA hospital and convenient for lunch. The large slice is more than enough for lunch. The crust is good, very similar to sourdough, and is slightly on the thicker side. Overall solid pizza place.

What a great hole in the wall. From everything to the decor, games for the kids. A huge chalk board for them as well. All fresh ingredients! Our favorite spot is the table in front of the pizza prep window. The gentlemen who was making our pizza was so friendly. He asked my girls if the pizza looked good before putting it in the oven! This is our new favorite spot!!! You won't be let down. Guaranteed!!!!

Came here on a whim as we were passing through Vegas on a road trip. We were craving pizza, but didn't want anything too fancy or takeout. This place was perfect! We ordered at the counter and got our food about 15 min later. They had basic toppings and some unique ones. We topped ours off with garlic and were excited when we saw the pizza adorned with giant cloves.  I'm not a big fan of crust and usually give it to my hubby. However, this crust was not shareable. I devoured every flaky last bit of it. The server offered us some garlic dip and I jumped at the chance because I never pass up sauce. This was some of the best pizzas I've had in a while!!!
Pizza was amazing. Wine is available to purchase. Great music and the staff was very helpful and courteous. There is no pizza joint in Vegas.

their omg pizza is seriously crazy. it's GIANT. I've been here twice. I solved all the riddles and they gave me a free cannoli. the second time I came I ordered a monster slice. it is definetly worth the $5. the slice is HUGE and the pizza sauce/pizza crust is TO DIE FOR

One of my favorite places in the city and a regular for work lunches. Quality ingredients, great service, and uncommon toppings like white anchovies and hard boiled egg. The monster slice and stuffed chicken wing are incredible. People say it's pricey but I've never left unsatisfied. Great portions. 

Also, the little bottles of almond and vanilla syrup for your soda are amazing.

Outstanding. Many times you have to choose between quantity and quality. Not here. Don't order two slices...I may never recover. Aside from having excellent food the staff is incredible and very polite which is certainly not what you get at most places. Highly recommended!
Pretty pricey ...got calzone for like 15 bucks I feel it should be a bit bigger cause I'm still hungry ..:( so for that over all 4 stars I should be full for 15 bucks ...

I am so mad at myself for not having been to this place sooner. 
 I loved it! It all started as soon as we walked in the door & were greeted by friendly staff who provided wonderful customer service.  We ordered antipasto salad,  pepperoni & mushroom monster slice & a meat lovers calzone. 
Every single ingredient was fresh, DELICIOUS and some even from local farms.  I wish more restaurants in Vegas worked this way.  
I can't wait to go back.
Awesome place with great food. Small classy and romantic.  Seems like it's in an odd location but that just means it's less crowded.  A little too expensive though.

This place has that pizzeria vibe to it for sure.  The best thing about this place is that it's right by my place!  The pizza is fantastic and you get quality in taste and portion size for the price.  The rosemary garlic knots are insanely good, a must have with your pizza.  A cool little hole in the wall with a few different size tables for different size groups to sit at.  The Cannery Casino is right across the street if you're staying there so walking distance is perfect.  Check this place out!
We still come here at least twice a month, so amazing!!:) My husband makes a quick phone call after work, I run and get it with my son and everyone's smiling faces greet and thank us:) LOVE IT!!

The first few times, this place was amazing. The last couple of times have been lackluster at best. I can't put my finger on it, but it just wasn't as good. I do like the crust of the pizza, but the rest, not so much. 

I do like the Chef Gio salad, but sometimes there's a little too much fennel. It also could use more acid, for my taste anyhow. The bead it sits on is awesome. 

The decor is kind of falling apart too, the chairs are rickety and while the pallet countertops are cool, they are a bit rickety too. 

I'm rooting for these guys to make it and hopefully they'll be in a position to open a bigger place.
Great little local pizza place... service was awesome. Staff seems to really care about the customers. Crust is Perfection with a slight sourdough taste. Yummy!
Great pizza. Sauce and dough is homemade and packed with flavor!  Service was great. Everyone was very friendly! We will definitely eat here again. Drove an hour just to try it!

Definitely a great pizzeria, thin crust pizza with a greasy top! We tried the pork reigns and definitely recommend it. The only downside, if any, is they make everything fresh so be prepared to wait at least 20-30 minutes for your pizza.

I first discovered OSP back in April of 2012. I've watched (and seriously enjoyed) seeing Chef Gio take on building this business after he left Nora's Wine Bar & Osteria. And just like Nora's which got rave reviews OSP sets the bar quite high for what a pizzeria can and should be. 

The dough is still prepared 36 hours in advance. The ingredients used are fresh, and your pizza is not made in some hidden back room. It's made right off to the side of the main counter where you can see everything that's put on it. There are no shortcuts. No skimping on quality. And the pizza you will find here is second to none here in Vegas. 

My 7 year old loves the huge slice of cheese pizza and his smile alone each time they bring it out to the table makes it worth the 45 min one way drive we make to get there. The garlic knots with roasted garlic and fresh rosemary and homemade sauce is a must try. If you're cautious stick to the Classic, but take a look at the chalkboard on the wall and the menu boards. You can go beyond the ordinary here and explore combinations of ingredients you won't find anywhere else. 

After two recent visits starting last weekend and the most recent being just 90 minutes ago, I'm going to put OSP back in 5 Star territory, and add it once again to my "Mythical 6th Star" list, for places that are so exceptional that 5 Stars just isn't enough. 5 years later I love OSP just as much as I did back in the day. Got no complaints (ultra rare for me), and nothing but love for OSP. Great food, great staff, might be a little crowded sometimes but that's because it's just so good.

I discovered this place by accident while looking due a nice pizza place on a date night and stepping inside I knew right away I was going to love it. The atmosphere is intimate in a family friendly sort of way and the staff exemplifies amazing service. When it comes to the food their garlic knots with sauce is to die for and their pizza is huge and delicious!
We  always heard about this place and we've been wanting to try it out. OMG so delicious!!!!! Best pizza we ever ate.

I had heard great things about this place and I thought I had to check it out. My first visit wasn't anything to rave about but I came in again tonight and the pizza was great. I ended up getting a slice with meatball and spicy Italian peppers and I also got a stuffed chicken wing. I didn't think the chicken wing was anything special, I wouldn't order it again, but it was worth trying. This is a good place to come for a slice and a beer.

I can't believe that I lived in North Las Vegas for over two years without knowing this hidden gem even existed. It's in a small strip mall building across from the parking garage of the Cannery. The guys are friendly, the place is very clean, and the food is awesome!  I've done work lunch with some fellow Air Force folks and the service was quick enough to make lunch hour. AND I've taken the family and everyone enjoyed their meal. The pizza is loaded, the garlic knots are buttery, and the chicken is falling off the bone.  Sweet and go anytime you're on Craig Rd near the I-15.
Pizza was really good when they first opened, the staff is really friendly and the toppings are fresh but the pizza was really greasy and floppy.

Decided to stop in and try old school Pizzeria and boy I tell you it was a great place to stop food was delicious I ordered a half margarita have vegetarian pizza and then their specialty chicken thighs which had a great flavor Rosemary sprig coming out the top the very wonderful presentation I love the intimacy of this restaurant and just the old school feel with a little hints-up upscale
Cute little pizza place. Lots of fun different combinations. We just got a cheese slice, and it was delicious.  I had to give my husband half of mine because it was so large.
This is the best pizza I've ever had. The customer service was phenomenal and the atmosphere was exquisite. I drive 100 miles just to eat here.

This is my favorite pizza in town. Authentic, well fermented dough and fresh ingredients. Doesn't get soggy and doesn't make my tummy hurt the day after. The staff is really friendly and efficient. Love their OMG size pizza. They also brew their own Rosemary lemonade that tastes amazing!!!! So yum!!

OHHHHHH Wow this pizza is so good today was my first time trying it somebody referred me, soon as I picked up a slice and it hung over I knew it was going to be good best so far yet I have some other places friends told me to try out but so far this place is winning!!!

Incredible! A little bit of a drive out side of down town Vegas, but well worth it!! Amazing pizza and the garlic knots are unbelievable! It's a hole in the wall, very casual environment, always busy, but tables become available pretty quickly. If you're in the Vegas area, this is a must stop!!
We LOVE Old School! They know my husband by name!  haha! They food is delicious and service is excellent! Their cannolis are the best and you must try their grilled lemonade!

Holy pizza!! You would never in a million years think that such pizza perfection would come from some place off of Craig in North Las Vegas. We'll...it does. I'm so glad we stopped in. Absolutely delicious! Amazing dough, sauce, toppings and service. We usually go very basic on our first visit to a pizza place. So we had a 14" pepperoni and a cannoli. It's so cool that you can see the chef work his magic. The staff is friendly and the cannoli was a yummy extra treat. They also make tea and lemonades in mason jars...love love love. Cant wait to go back and try everything else on the menu. So glad we found a new neighborhood pizza spot! Oh and they have pizza by the slice!!

Wow! That is the word I would use to describe this place. I came out from getting my haircut next door, and I was hungry. I looked up the restaurant and saw it's high rating on Yelp, and decided to give it a shot.

As I came in I was promptly greeted by a guy behind the counter making pizza . I threw up my flag of first time ignorance, and I was given a run down of the menu. After the menu was thoroughly explained I decided on the garden salad, the rosemary garlic knots, the double monster slice special, and the canolis.

The salad came out first, and it was so good, I ordered another one after I ate the first. All the vegetables were fresh and crisp. There was shredded cheese throughout that added a nice richness. The salad was already dressed, but it wasn't soggy. The nice creamy dressing wasn't the star but helped bind everything together, it still had good flavor though.

This was the first time I got garlic knots at a pizza joint. Bread side items normally seem like a waste to me, but I am glad I gave these a chance. I could taste the rosemary and garlic on them, and the bread was toasty on the outside while having a soft and fluffy inside. The "white sauce" that came with the knots was addictively delicious.

Then the two monster slices came. They lived up to their title, they could have been over 1/4 of a pizza. I topped one slice with sausage and one with pepperoni, and it is hard for me to decide which was better. I'll just say these two slices sold me, and I will definitely be back to order whole pizzas here in the future. They weren't greasy, they had a good amount of cheese, and both of the toppings had their own distinct flavor. The sauce was particularly good. It wasn't a sweet acid bomb, and had a good taste of crushed tomatoes and seasoning.

The only downside to my meal were the canoli. While the cream inside had a nice smooth texture with the perfect amount of sweetness, the pastry shells were fried too hard and had a burnt flavor. That single infraction would only bring my rating to a 4.5 star.

I am absolutely sold on this establishment, and I will definetly be coming back to try more items.

The food was excellent. We came here after reading an article about it online. It is on the complete opposite side of town we live in, but well worth the drive. If they had beer or wine, it would have earned the fifth star. The staff was very friendly and personable.

We ordered over the phone .. they told us 15 mins .. we got there within 20 mins. .. upon arriving about 8:00 pm we didn't walk out with our pie for about 30 more mins ( LG sausage, shredded chicken,  and roasted garlic ) let me tell you,  they closed their doors at about 8:25 (35 mins earlier than closing) and I witnessed 4 people coming to the door mad as a hornet they couldn't get in. 
  Want to understand their frustration?  
Let me start by saying their dough is hand made.  The sausage is prepared in house , so fresh you can taste it. The shredded chicken was juicy , and the roasted garlic was cooked just right! I'd be mad too had I not made it on time! The pizza pie was damn good!  
 To be honest , they can close their doors whenever they like. They got it like that. Just be sure you order plenty ahead of time. They have families and want to go home just like us. 

  I will be back ... and I will try the garlic knots I forgot to order !

The garlic knots are good with rosemary-delicious. The Rosemary lemonade, my boyfriend says was to die for. However, the pizza was mediocre. With a sourdough crust was cool, new. But the sauce tasted like tomato paste, I kinda wish I didn't order extra. We got chunks of garlic and chicken, it was ok. I tried to eat left overs and ended up just throwing the pizza away.

This is best pizza in town, hands down. (sorry Settebello!)

I came in here with my hubby on a weekend that we traveled to NLV. We make it to NLV every other weekend because my husband and son's barber is on Craig Rd. The last 2 times we tried to go here on a Sat, the place was closed for some odd reason. The first time their sign was being hoisted and it blocked the entrance, another time there was a personal reason. Finally, we make it on a weekend that they were open for biz.

The only bad part of this experience is that me and the fam weren't extremely hungry upon arrival. I ordered 3 slices of cheese and a side salad for 4 of us. We couldn't even eat the 3rd slice so we took it home (and I had to listen to Ray L. and Sydney B. fight over it for the next 12 hrs).

First let me address the salad. What a beautiful specimen of art and veggies!!! This salad was so deelish that I almost got too full for the pizza. When something is good most times I forget that there are other things on my plate. 

The pizza is heaven. I love the dough. It is a sourdough pizza dough and I haven't had it anywhere in town, only in San Jose (whoop, whoop, Toto's!). The sauce is so spot on I could probably drink the stuff after I take a bath in it. I simply love by-the-slice places and I hope this never changes.

The other items on the menu intrigued me. It is rare that I find a pizza place offering such delicacies as roasted chicken with rosemary potatoes. This type of cuisine really puts Old School a slice above the rest. I now look forward to the NLV haircuts every other weekend. The agenda begins with pizza, then haircut/eyebrow wax, and then Epic Thrift Store. I love those kind of weekends. PERFECT~!

Maybe I've just been spoiled with amazing pizza, but Old School's pizza did not amaze me much, but I'm going to attribute it to a mistake in choosing the pizza flavor.

The crust/dough could have been thinner in my opinion, as it became a bit too much to chew after the first piece. I had the Vegas meets Italy pizza and really did not enjoy having ricotta cheese and dates on my pizza instead of some fresh mozzarella. Should NOT have listened to their recommendations.

The staff here is incredibly nice though. You can tell that they are trying to make food with integrity. I will definitely come back here if given the chance so I can try other flavors.

Giovanni is awesome! The Pizza is even more Awesome! The most authentic pizza I have ever had in my life. I live 160 miles away, and I travel there for the amazing food, the awesome atmosphere, and Giovanni's welcoming smile! I'll be back!

We recently moved to North Las Vegas and thought we'd try this out. It is a hole in the wall. Right off the bat, Carlos welcomed us and let us try their homemade grilled rosemary lemonade and passion iced tea. We bought a Mason jar of the passion iced tea (which is a Arnold Palmer of goodness). I eat a lot and the combo filled me up tremendously. Their slices are monstrous!!!! Food is great, white sauce is awesome and the stuffed chicken wing is amazing. They really know how to maximize flavor with the use of some good herbs and spices. It felt fresh. Can't stress how much Carlos' hospitality made a difference to bring us in and the food Definately sealed the deal. Unique flavor, music and unique feel.

Their sandwiches and lemonade were really good but I wasn't impressed with the pizza. The dough was stretched so thin the pointy end couldn't hold itself up and the sauce was a little on the sour side. Good friendly service and nice atmosphere if you dine in.

I was seated at a charity dinner with someone that I ended up getting friendly with who was kind enough to tell me about Old School Pizza when she discovered I lived in North Las Vegas. I ended up trying this place out the next day after hearing about the amazing cannoli's this place has to offer. Turns out is three minutes from my house so I owe her a great debt  for telling me about this piece of heaven or a bill for the clothes I will need to buy after my waist line increases.
From the outside you would never guess what delicious food awaits but once you enter you quickly realize this isn't just a regular pizza place. They have amazing décor and fun riddles around. They have toys for kids to play with and tons of specials written up on the wall. 
We ended up trying the Garlic Twists and a pizza Half Cheese and Half Pepperoni plus of course Cannoli's.  They make their own yeast and it all tastes so freaking good. I can feel myself gaining ten pounds just thinking about it.
Everything was so yummy and the brothers who run the place are friendly and efficient. This is my new go to place for pizza. I can't wait to try it without my KIDS so I can eat some of the amazing stuff they offer that is more on the gourmet side of things. 
They take orders via ONLINE or in Person so don't hesitate to try it even if you live a ways away.

Chef Giovanni [sp?] just CALLED me personally to invite me to try his pizza fresh (not delivered as last time) and seemed genuinely concerned that we did not enjoy our experience as well as we could have.  I have to say, coming from California this NEVER happens and says a lot about this man's character....really impressed by him...NOW THE FOOD....Oh my slap your grandma goooood!  A serious feast...from salad to dessert the best Italian...so fresh...having been to Italy it was like being there again...GET the chicken...GET the gelato...but for GODS SAKE get the friggin cannolis or...well...you have missed a chance to taste heaven....not too much of anything...plenty of everything good...bring cash to tip...JASON and CHEF GIO deserve it and treat you like family...old school...the best school...manga!!!
The crust flavor was not that good.. but was toasted well. Nice cheese and the sausage topping was ok. Too much hype for this place. large servings of blah, so-so pizza...... NEXT!

Well the reviews are 100% right!! Incredible pizza !! The toppings are so fresh and flavorful you can taste everything,, nothing lost in the usual pizza mess! Sauce was on point! Best for last the crust may have been best pizza crust ever!! After the first slide I couldn't wait for another just to reach that bubbled up outer crust!! Great place fair prices! Wish I was in Vegas more often!! May go back tomorrow.
A super cool pizza place. Everything is house made. Bomb crust!! Next time we wanna try the sausage stuffed chicken wings! Yumm! It's gonna make a bomb munchies meal later.

So glad we decided to come here tonight. The pizza was amazing (and that's coming from someone from Chicago) !! We ordered the Vegas Meets Italy. The toppings were top quality and they pile on the toppings. The crust is also very good (I'm usually not a crust person! We got the small size and it was more than enough for 2 people.

The stuffed chicken wings were also good. The garlic knots and rosemary lemonade were alright. 

Service was good, staff was very friendly. I would definitely come back.

I lived in Manhattan and the Bronx for a time and after moving back to the west coast I starved for something to fill my New York Style Pizza Needs! Then a few months ago we were told about this joint. 

ITS
INCREDIBLE!

Everything I have tried here is divine. I love the pizza. It is the closest to how I had it in NYC. But the thing that blew my mind were the cannolis. They were just like I had them from my favorite little bakery in the Bronx. They fill them right in front of you so you know they are legit. And the cool thing is if you get the trivia question right on their chalkboard you get a free one!! 

The service is great! They are usually pretty busy but you are having so much fun waiting you don't even notice. 

O and I cannot explain how excited I am that a eatery as great as this one is in NORTH LAS VEGAS! 

Needless to say I am in love! I crave this place more than any other. I want it right now in fact... :D

So far my favorite pizza place in North Las Vegas. Handmade pizza with fresh ingredients put together right in front of you. I had the Vegas meets New York, very tasty with out of the box thinking toppings. I will be back.

Tried this joint from all the reviews.  Crust was horrible. owner should order dough from the people that supply PAPA John'... I will not be back to this place..  The cheese and sauce were really good,, can tell the quality of the cheese, i like either lisanti or grande moz cheese...  My issue is with the dough..  Fix the dough and this can be a great place...

7/10/12

I tried this place again,, mainly because i wanted to give them a chance.  I hate giving a bad review to business owners who are try hard to put out good food and are trying to make a living...  The dough was the same,  seems to lack gluten, I have made dough in the past, and i thought the dough we produced, gave us a great crust that most of us are looking for.  Unfortunately i do not like this dough... If they used my dough and the ingredients they use,, this place would be the best in N Las Vegas...  Lisanti high gluten pizza dough is what we used... Just saying... Hope this yelps

Great pizza! Was looking for something that I could actually reheat the next day if we didn't finish it and it still had flavor. It was a little more than I wanted to spend but it was well worth it. I had been getting the $5.99-$10 deals at pizza fast food joints and was getting tired of it. We just ordered online, picked it up, and WOW! Super huge! We stayed simple and got pepperoni and I only ate 2 pieces. Filling, yummy, cheese that actually tastes like something and it was cooked all the way through! Have been back two more times. This is our family's new fave!
I heard the West Flaming location is about a month away. Can't wait
Really great food! Probably the best pizza in Las Vegas! Highly recommend this place. I loved our fresh salad! And the garlic knots were top notch! A little bit of a drive but it's totally worth it!
Great find.  Just off 1 15 and quality of pizza haven't experienced since we were in Rome.   Nice atmosphere and staff too.
Super yummy amazing and great salads amazing atmosphere right across the street from the cannery must go to
Place is great! We had Vegas meets Italy pizza with bread knots. Amazing! Place has a great atmosphere. Definitely coming here again.

I like this place! Great staff and great food. I just wish they had the super quality of food in a restaurant setting. Man, this would be a great place for a date or special occasion if the atmosphere was a little more upscale. I highly recommend it if you are looking for some really good food and don't care if you order at the counter.

Yum for sourdough pizza crust! The slices here have a charred outside, but chewy inside...slightly thick crust...very good! They also use lots of fresh ingredients here.  We ordered a house made sausage slice and an eggplant + chicken slice....it was good!  Not mind blowing, but good!  Here is a pic :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/old-school-pizzeria-north-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#jFpRh-Y0c5IloIoq-GFLQQ

But what I really enjoyed here were the rosemary garlic knots! These were the best I've had...and were very addicting! I will come back for the knots alone!  Seriously, why are they so good??  Check it out!

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/old-school-pizzeria-north-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#_ToU4xH13toGvqOuTnOmLw

We finished with the cannoli, which are piped fresh to order, and have a great filler. A great way to end a good slice of pizza and knots!  Pic :

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/old-school-pizzeria-north-las-vegas?userid=eZZyuJDouIg4p-GYB3PV_A#uhfx6Rn0STZ7wtgah8OB7w

They also had a cool little nook area for the kids to play.  They had some toys there and my little guy loved the fire truck.  It is the little things that count!

Prices are good too!  Check them out if you are on this side of town :)

The Many times we've order from here we enjoyed it but today sucked! We order extra crispy but to my surprise I got extra burnt. I used to see the owner there really nice guy but now they got people who don't know how to cook to request at all. Please hire skilled people and then we will return our business there again!

First time here, had a warm welcome from the lady behind the counter. I just order  the monster slice + extra slice. Little did I know the monster slice is literally a "MONSTER" slice and I was good with just one slice, now I have lunch. Honestly the best slice of pizza I have ever had. Their dough is made the old school way, no commercial yeast, all natural leavening. Which means your pizza will be healthy & flavorful. Just a warning as well, their dough takes 36 hours of preparation time, they occasionally run out. But I can definitely tell you once you get a slice it'll be well worth it. So if your in the Las Vegas Area no matter where you are in Vegas, you must come down to old school pizzeria off of Craig and Lawrence across from the cannery casino.
We tried their pizza- half pepperoni, half sausage and mushrooms. Good pizza with a tasty crust!

This is the best pizza in Vegas. I won't get pizza anywhere else! My favorite is the Vegas Meets Italy, but you really can't go wrong with anything. The Chef Gio salad is a great alternative if you're not in a pizza mood. Try their ranch dressing for dipping! It's literally THE BEST ranch dressing I've ever had.

However, the last 2 times I ordered a Vegas Meets Italy, I didn't find any dates on it... That was super disappointing because it's one of the best ingredients on the pie. I'm not sure if they stopped adding them or maybe they are out of season (since they buy them local).

I love this place and have been enjoying it ever since I tried it. The pizza is made the right way, the garlic knots are amazing, their ranch is delicious, and their salads are fabulous. I've never had a problem or been disappointed and always tip well. Every time I have out of town guests we get our pizza here!

DO NOT MAKE THE MISTAKE OF NOT TRYING THEIR AWESOME RANCH.  Seriously, their ranch is soooo good.

Missed a movie across the street .. and to think I was going to have popcorn for dinner!  We ordered a salad which came in a bread bowl.  It was delicious!  Next we split a pizza with cheese and sausage.  There were a number of great looking specialty pizzas but we were in the mood for an old standby.  No prerolled, frozen crusts here--everything is freshly prepared.  Rather than us my packaged yeast, the crust is made from a sourdough starter.  It has a crunchy crust with a chewy crumb, a prefect crust for a pizza.  The tomato sauce has a fresh tomato taste with a hint of basil.  In short the food was delicious!

The ambience is relaxed and casual.  Chalkboard menus on the wall tell of all the food options.  Wine and beer are available.  Highly recommended!
Great pizza as to be expected. But the service was even better.  It's like going to have a meal at a friends house. Oh and the cannolis are amazing

As a New Yorker for 30 years I can tell you its as authentic as you will find here in Vegas. Chef Gio really knows how to harness the tastes of the old world. Its a bit more costly than other pizzerias but well worth the money

I have been to Old School one other time. I got the Crazy Good Chicken. It really was good, maybe not CRAZY good!. The other day I called and ordered 2 meatball sandwiches. A friend of mine wanted to try the food here and I always like to try an Italian restaurants meatballs. The sandwiches are  $10 each which is a little pricey but I figured, judging by the size of the pizza slices, they were probably enormous. Was I wrong! The "bread" was just pizza dough (kind of like a Stromboli but the fixins were put in after it was cooked) But I thought that's ok cuz the pizza dough is good. There was sliced meatballs on it (sliced like a topping for the pizza) and there was MAYBE one and a half meatballs worth of meat. The sandwich was pretty much a whole lot of pizza crust with a little bit of meatballs and sauce. There wasn't even any cheese on the sandwich, they never asked if I wanted any either. For $10, I think that is absurd! My friends sandwich was exactly the same. We were both disappointed. I have yet to try the pizza. The slices are huge and they make their own dough which tales 36 hours so they have a sign admitting they may run out of dough some days. The place was very busy, all the tables were taken & people were waiting but it is a very small space so people were everywhere. It seems like they are caught between being a take out place and a sit down restaurant. I have yet to go back, I sent them an email regarding my visit but I did not get a reply.

Best pizza we have had in Vegas! We really really enjoyed our visit and will be back.

The ambience is casual. The walls are covered with chalkboards. They have the menu on one wall, and riddles around the room. Even their pop machine has a chalk board! There are pendant lights hanging from fun pallet boxes. There are only 7 or 8 tables, just FYI.

Now to what really really matters- the food!

We got an amazing tropical passion tea in a huge mason jar. Yum! 

We got garlic knots. Half order was plenty for the two of us. They came out with garlic and roast art in the bowl. And dipping sauce. Yum. But the best part was actually that they were REAL sourdough bread. No yeast!

And the pizza - same thing. This places uses no commercial yeast. They let nature do the work. And the taste is incredible! 

This appears to be the same with most of their ingredients. The sausage is made in house. The cheese is real. Now I don't know the source for all their ingredients. Or their recipes. But what I had tonight was delicious. And I look forward to supporting this establishment during our time here in Las Vegas! 

Edited to add: service was good. The staff was also very pleasant during our interactions.

Yum, fermented dough is the bomb! 

What we got...
- Pork reigns monster slice: guanciale on a pizza is the best! It's like a better bacon. The rest of the meats used to make a Pork Reigns are also tasty. The slice does get a bit salty, but I still enjoyed it because the sourdough helped contrast it. That sourdough crust is so perfectly chewy and crispy at the end. The quality of all the ingredients on this slice was top notch.
- Stuffed wing: really flavorful. I love that they debone the wing for easier eating. 
- Gio's salad: so fresh and so necessary. Full of yummy fresh crunchy fennel. The grape tomatoes and balls of fresh mozzarella, fresh herbs, so drool worthy. 
- Garlic knots: wow! LOVE. Served with whole roasted garlic cloves and their house-made ranch. This is also made with their fermented sourdough, and it's so good. 
- 50/50 iced tea lemonade: tastes a bit weird to me, I think there's a bit too much going on in this drink and I didn't like it. It also feels a bit expensive for this drink.

Holy cannoli ! Eat dessert first! The food is incredible - I had four slices of pizza and I'm lactose intolerant. Zebediah was our waiter and he was absolutely wonderful. We came with a party of about 25 and the service was impeccable, the food was unbelievable, and he even recommended what is now my new favorite wine. 

Bring your family and friends  - it's worth it !

WOW this place is a hidden gem. I am so lucky that I live super close to it! They have one of the best sourdough pizza crusts and pizza sauce! I so far had the Pork Rules and 5 cheese pizza's and man... they are addicting!!! It's so hard to diet, when you have places like this around where you live lol. I wish they were open 24-7 so I can come here every other day for a slice of pizza after a long session at the Aria Poker room.
This Pizza, This Place AMAZING!!! Every time!! Vegas meets Italy my absolute favorite!!! Sounds a little crazy, the combination, I know but try it. BEST PIZZA EVER!!!

Ran in for the first time 10 min to closing and grabbed 2 slices of the best cheese pizza I think I have ever had. This is Grimaldi's but WAY better. The slices were HUGE. The crust was perfectly flavored and had the perfect mix of soft plus crunch. Seriously...it was amazing. The vibe is chill but classy. Reminded me of an Italian restaurant I ate at in Paris. Will def be back.

Very trendy atmosphere, very clean and pleasant employees, but I was not impressed with the pizza. The slice was huge! But the sauce was too tangy. I was disappointed but I ate the $5 slice. Maybe the other items on the menu are more tasty.

Delicious point blank!!! I have passed by this place for years & finally tried it tonight. My only regret is not trying it sooner! I will definately be a regular. The pizza was yummy, staff was very nice, and it was clean. Everything made fresh right in front of you! A must try!!!!

Went here tonight, great place. Our server (don't know his name), was a great guy he helped with everything, very friendly and a personable guy. Food was delicious, we got a build your own OMG! with half meat lovers, half Hawaiian type of pizza. The pizza itself is giant, absolutely amazing crust, plus the fact the use traditional leavening and no commercial yeast. The establishment was a bit small, so it would be hard for a big group to fit in there. Other than that, highly recommended!!

I love Pizza, Ive had it all over Las Vegas and other cities. I've got to say, this is a legit pizza joint. Hands down, the best pizza in the city. Now I cant have pizza at any other place. Those chain pizza places are a joke now.

This place is one of the gems in North Las Vegas. Their pizza is delicious and unlike any other. They have interesting specialties with topping combinations you wouldn't normally think of, but taste amazing together. The perfect example is the Vegas Meets Italy- it has the perfect balance of sweet (date sauce) and salty (prosciutto). Their dough is handmade fresh with no preservatives. Their rosemary lemonade and garlic knots are tasty as well. Definitely ask for extra garlic sauce!

The atmosphere and decor adds to the overall experience- rustic, quaint, like a true old school pizzeria. It's a perfect date night spot.

To top it off, the workers there are so nice and have the best customer service. Even when the restaurant is crazy busy, they still manage take the time to come out from behind the counter to personally deliver the food to the tables and ask how your meal is going. We asked for a to-go box from over the counter and the server actually came out to hand deliver it to us at our table. It was such a small gesture but we really appreciated the extra effort. 

There seems to always only be about three workers, and I noticed that the younger guy (didn't catch his name, but he's always there) goes above and beyond. He seems to do it all- he's the one taking orders, answering the phones, running the line, taking the food out of the oven, and even busing the tables. You can definitely tell that they all take pride in their restaurant and quality of their food.

I don't think you can get better than this. They were even featured in a Las Vegas magazine as one of the best restaurants. Definitely a must go!

sooooo i wasn't too pleased with it this time....the first time i had it the service was excellent and the food was delicious and fresh.....not so much this time....the customer service was bad...nobody greeted me when i came in and the pizza was super overly greasy and chewy...like eating rubber....i know pizza is supposed to have some grease but geez....we could hardly bite through it....Sad part is i actually recommended this place and now none of us want to ear here again... :(
Love their pizza! Fair price for what you get. Rosemary garlic knots are also very good. Stella on draft is always a plus too. Inside is very small but has a cozy feeling to it.

As soon as I stepped into Old School Pizzeria, I knew I was going to like this place. Located on Craig across the Cannery and nestled alongside a barber shop, Old School Pizzeria is a nice surprise. The menu is written along the walls on chalkboard, the lighting fixtures that dangle above the tables adds an interesting touch, and the seating is bench-style. We were warmly greeted by the cashier who took the time to answer any questions we had about some menu items. He came off a genuine person who was passionate about food - you don't get that often.

CALZONE ($8.99): This calzone was made with love! The calzone comes stock with 3 types of cheese. Toppings are an addition $0.75. I got mine with black olives, bell peppers, and mushrooms. The smoked and ricotta cheese were amazing, and the veggies were of the high-quality artisanal variety. Served with a side of marinara sauce. I was only able to eat half. 

PIZZA COMBO ($7.99): When they say Monster slices, they aren't kidding. This slice of pepperoni pizza was humongous! Thin crisp crust and perfectly cheesy. There's a few different combo options you can choose from, the mister got his with a half-order of garlic- rosemary knots. 5/5

GARLIC ROSEMARY KNOTS ($3.45): Probably the best garlic knots I've ever tasted. A half-order comes with 6 knots, each one brushed with olive oil and topped with rosemary and soft garlic cloves. You could literally spread a clove like butter on the knots. The side sauce served with knots was to die for. It wasn't ranch, but some kind of fancy sauce (the name escapes me). 

I regret not coming to Old School Pizzeria sooner. This place is officially my new favorite pizza spot!

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #264

Items Selected:
Garlic Rosemary Knots, Whole Cloves, Garlic Aioli (Half Order)
Vegas Meets Italy - Smoked Mozzarella, Ricotta, Pistachios, China Ranch Dates, Date Cream Sauce, Fresh Arugula, Thin Sliced Prosciutto, Heirloom Cherry Tomatoes
Regina Margherita - Fresh Torn Basil, Fresh Mozzarella, Heirloom Cherry Tomatoes, Tomato Sauce 
Cannolis

Located in North Las Vagas, across from Cannery North which is essentially just south of Siberia according to many Las Vegans, Old School Pizzeria had long been bookmarked for a visit, and stopping in after an early movie at Galaxy Theaters I found the small pizzeria just over half full - a couple of folks already enjoying a meal while others awaited to-go orders, an Air Force Squadron from nearby Nellis entering mere moments in my wake.

Small in size and modest in décor, the menu by Gio Mauro written in chalk with locally sourced produce and top-quality purveyors like Mary's Free Range Chickens featured prominently amidst options both classic and creative, a visit to Old School starts at the counter across from stainless-steel ovens and tempting with several individual orders plus several items to share the only question is where best to invest, my order of one appetizer, a 50/50 small Specialty Pie, and a trio of cannoli tallying just shy of $25 though a mistake in preparation would instead see two full pizzas arrive for the price of just one.

Using only naturally leavened dough, the sort which maintains great stretch and subtle yeast even when nicely charred, it was with a small order of garlic knots that the meal began and with ample butter serving to carry notes of rosemary high on the palate my original skepticism for accompanying "ranch" was quickly dispelled, the rich aioli far lighter than I'd ever expected...though perhaps best avoided for those on a first date as the garlic aromatics are indeed quite profound.

Having mentioned the small hiccup in my half-and-half pie it was after perhaps twenty minutes of surfing free WiFi that the first single-style pizza was served, and quickly offering to make amends with my second choice free of charge it was only at the Pizzaiolo's insistence that I finally agreed, the Regina Margherita served just fifteen minutes later and offering a whole lot of leftovers eventually gifted to a homeless man out front of Santa Fe Station en route home.

Speaking to the quality of both pies, and beginning with the crust as any great pizza should, one would be hard pressed to name a better electric fired pie outside of Dom DiMarco's, but with a crust even more crisp yet pliable plus far less 'branding' the smoky rim at Old School ups the ante substantially in both texture and taste, a similar compliment offered to boldly acidic tomato sauce virtually devoid of sugar on a Margherita that could have perhaps used a bit more time to melt the cheese, and even moreso to the sweet meets savory "Vegas Meets Italy" that finds fresh arugula providing an apt foil to thinly cut pork plus figs and their infused cream, the pistachios and ample ricotta rounding out textures in each hearty bite.

Limited in desserts, but offering cannolis that they proudly boast as 'filled to order' it was without hesitation that a trio was ordered and packed as if to go I assured the young cashier that such a thing would be entirely unnecessary, each crisp shell packed delicately with whipped ricotta and sweet mascarpone on par with those at Naked City for best in the city - a trio costing less than just one soggy pre-filled tube at Carlo's Bakery on the Strip.

Forgiving the mistake in my order as service recovery went well beyond what was necessary, I'll officially label myself a convert in naming Old School Pizzeria the best in a city with no lack of designer pies from which to choose.  Family owned and operated, without the benefit of a celebrity chef boasting ten ovens or an address including South Las Vegas Boulevard, Old School Pizzeria is the sort of place doing things 'right,' each hand crafted pie receiving careful attention and quality ingredients in a less than likely location well worth the drive.

Wow really good pizza. I didn't expect them to be so good and I'm not even a pizza person. We also got their garden salad and garlic knots. The salad was good I loved their dressing. The garlic knots were ok I thought it would be doughy-er but it's like their pizza crust in bread form. Prices are reasonable and I really like that this restaurant has personality. You'll know what I mean when you walk in. Great place to go for pizza and food in general. We will be back.

We had the pesto five cheese and it was really good. After eating half of it the person I think was the owner came to our table and said he had another pizza in the oven for us because the one he gave us was over cooked. The first pizza was good; I just thought it was a little crispy but nothing wrong with it. You can tell that they only want to serve the best food they can make. I can't say anything bad about the place.

I really enjoyed Old School Pizzeria. Everything from their pizza to their service was excellent. I ordered a small pizza (half cheese and half five cheese pesto), a half order of garlic knots, and 2 grilled Rosemary lemonades that came in a VERY large mason jar which you can take home, for $30. Everything was delicious. I really had nothing to complain about.

Best Pizza on the planet. Can't wait for them to take out a business loan, invest in growth, and take over the world. They have great salads and excellent pizza. I love how they always figure out a way to incorporate the sourdough in the dish if you're not ordering pizza. The slices are large and you can't go wrong with this top of the line pizza joint. I remember when they first opened and had a kinko's banner as their sign. A year later, still the same great food.

This place by far is the best pizza EVER!!!! I'm from Cali and I don't know any other place but this one that's the best. It's freshly made. The pepperoni pizza is sooo amazing , the crust is thin and crunchy. The pizza just melts and sooo yummy. Just absolutely amazing . I can't wait to visit this place again when I come to Vegas. It's about 25 minutes away from the strip, but it's soooo worth it. Trust me

Tonight, we got the Classic Combo pizza and the Vegas Meets Italy pizza.  They were both fantastic.  One is traditional and the other quite unusual.  The Classic Combo has pepperoni, sausage, bell peppers, mushrooms and olives.  Vegas Meets Italy had gorgonzola, ricotta, mozzarella, arugula, cherry tomatoes, dates and pistachio - unbelievably delicious!  The sweet and savory flavors complement each other. I remember the pizzas in Italy all had the same quality: they were not greasy because they use FRESH and REAL ingredients.  That's what you get from Old School!

As a fan of all things Nutella, I had to get the Nutella gelato.  It's creamy but light...almost like soft-served/frozen yogurt.  Lurv it!!!  Something good in North Las Vegas.  Yay!  Best of all, they deliver.

The pizza place that was previously in this spot went out of business a few years ago and I'm hoping Old School is here to stay.  I'm pretty sure they'll do well since they have great food.

Driving from Utah to Los Angeles and needed a place to eat. The yelp reviews were right on!!! The food was excellent and guys were very friendly. Definitely hitting this place up the next time in Vegas.

They burnt the hell out of my pizza! I know their crust is darker than most places as I eat here fairly often, but this particular time my crust was black and the cheese was dark brown and hard in several places. To make thinks worse I ordered from postmates so I paid $28 for a $16 pizza to be delivered, only to have to drive back there to get another one. When I get to the restaurant the manager has the nerve to lie to me and say " I told you over the phone our pizzas are dark" while there were 3 pizzas being cut behind him, and 2 pizzas on people's tables that looked absolutely nothing like mine . I didn't even ask for anything free to offset the delivery charge, or the inconvenience, I just wanted to exchange my pizza and get a i'm sorry about that man. Anything but a bold face lie.
Had pizza here many times, it is awesome the garlic knots and mascarpone suace are great!!!! The cannolis are to die for! Happy everytime we order here

We've lived in North Las Vegas for over 6years and this is by far the BEST pizza spot around. You can definitely tell the pizza is made from scratch. We've also had their amazing rosemary garlic knots with their special dipping sauce. I definitely recommend trying it out if you want a real authentic meal.

I really wanted to try this place since they use a sour dough culture rather than conventional yeast, it takes few days to prep the dough. I liked the restaurant it had communal tables. It also seemed like they use farm to table ingredients, I saw that they use free rage chicken for their roast chicken. 

So your order at the counter and then they bring the food to you. They have daily specials and the day I went they had the porchetta sandwich. It was $10 and for those don't know what it is I will explain. Porchetta is the whole pork belly with meat rolled with Italian herbs and spices then string tied and roasted till the meat is tender. It's an amazing piece of pork and hard to find. I have been longing to try this dish for a long time since I had seen it on food network. Definitely did not disappoint. They give it to you on a wooden cutting board with some au ju dip  that sandwich and it's so good. I enjoyed it more than the pizza. The bread was made in house, even though they use a sour dough culture the bread is chewy but very light and airy. 
Now the pizza it was good but I like that they gave you some house made ranch dressing to dip the crust which is tasty. 
I also had one of their salads the gio it was okay. 
Finally I tried their house made canoli which was good. 
Over all I had a good experience and definitely going back. The porchetta is only available on Wednesday as a special. 
Want to try the chicken next time.

I am always in search of a good pie. I have had this bookmarked for well over a year. It might even have been longer. Every time I was on this side of town; it was on a Sunday, and lucky me, they were closed.

Well, fate has finally worked in my favor! A Saturday at the movies gave us plenty of time to grab a slice of pizza. Yes, a slice runs a little over $4. Yet it is the size of my face! The first time I tried them, we got a regular cheese pizza. It was fantastic. The blend of cheeses gave the pie the right amount of salt. The crust was good enough to eat on its own or to use their crack "ranch". I am not even a fan of ranch and I liked it.

Since then I've tried the Las Vegas to Italy and the Three Cheese Pesto. Both are flavorful, but a simple pie is all that you need. Their mushroom and sausage is up there on my favorites. 

Good thing a friend works up there. It is totally worth bribing him with alcohol to bring down here.

Best pizzeria in North Las Vegas!  (Maybe even Las Vegas)  We always enjoy their garlic knots, sausage stuffed chicken wings, and their various pizzas.  The quality of their ingredients really shows in the taste of their food.  This is a must try if you like pizza and who doesn't?  Watch out on Friday and Saturday nights--it is often standing room only.

It's not often, actual just about never, that pizza gets thrown away at our house...but sadly enough it has happened a few days after our visit to Old School.

So we were coming back from a hike in Moapa, we were both hungry and tired, pizza sounded like a good option. We were gonna go to our go to place, Grimaldis but I knew we'd be passing Old School Pizzeria and have heard rave reviews, so we agreed to give it a try. The website has an online ordering service so while my husband was driving I was ordering. It sent me a confirmation text that the pizza would be done by 5:57pm. Well we got there about 5:50, so I ran in, it didn't seem too busy so I ran to the restroom before I picked up my order.
When I came out I stood at the counter for a few minutes before I was greeted and asked what they could help me with. I showed him my order confirmation on my phone, he couldn't seem to find it, then printed a slip, and whispered something to the chef. I heard the chef say it was in the oven. I was told it would be a few minutes, so I ordered a Coke and sat down, well it was about 15 minutes later when I actually got my pizza. They really didn't seem that busy, but watching the 2 men making the pizzas, I could see why it took so long, they were very slow!
First of all I have read many reviews on this place that say "This is a legit old school type pizza place", it's not at all. The inside is a bit "done up" for a pizza place, the cooks were definitely not Italian, they don't toss the dough old school style. Old school pizza places don't give you ranch dressing with your pizza. But I digress.
The pizza looked delicious. We got home and dug in and we were quickly underwhelmed. We got a Half Carnivore and Half Sausage. It was very "meh". We ate so we weren't hungry and hoped that in the morning the leftovers would reheat better. Oh and that side of ranch was not good, it didn't help the crust...it may have made it worse.
Well we tried to reheat it the next day, well there was no improvement. We both ate a piece just to eat something. the next day we collectively decided to throw it away, my husband will usually eat anything and he didn't even want it.
So the service and food was subpar, I will never waste my time with this place again.

Damn fine New York style pizza. Sauce was fresh and tangy. The toppings (pepperoni, sliced bacon and mushrooms) was wonderful... The meats and veggies obviously fresh. 

The house salad and the garlic Mascarpone dressing was unique and yummy (good for pizza bone dipping too)... But needs more veggies like tomatoes and carrots and less veggies like raw onions.  

Considering how much it all cost tho, you best be prepared to pay!

The poor guys at this place seemed to be having a day. First, the internet was down, so the order I placed online did not go through. No biggie, I'm not against pizza right out of the oven, so I waited. Once my pizzas were ready, it was discovered that there was only one cannoli shell for my three cannoli order...gasp! As I was about to be refunded for the cannolis, one of the guys came up from the back and asked if I had 5 minutes as he was making fresh shells as we speak. My fiance would not have forgiven me if I didn't wait. Five minutes later, I was walking out with hot pizza and fresh cannolis. The staff during this time were nice and accommodating, they even gave me an extra cannoli for the trouble, score! We ordered two smalls (which are 14"!), one with onions and the other with pepperoni and sausage. Both were fantastic and the leftovers reheated well. As for the cannolis, I am waiting for a verdict on that, but only two of the four were left by the next morning, so I assume they get a thumbs up as well. We will defititely be back!

The only thing that stops me from giving this 5 stars is the small dining area that can sometimes get a little crowded while people wait for their pizza (whether dining in, or dining out), other than that...This is by far the best pizza I've had in Las Vegas so far! An original New York style pizzeria that meets the hype.  The ambiance is so relaxing with soft Italian music playing, the menu creatively decorated on a large chalkboard on the wall, along with the ability to watch their pizza maker make the pizzas.  It comes out with the most amazing, crispy crust, packed with amazing seasonings..really cooked to perfection!
Went here a year and a half ago or so and it was OK. Today was something special! It was packed for a reason at lunch time. Highly recommended!

SO GOOD! Forget the strip, we'll be coming back every time we drive into Vegas. House made cheeses, imported meats, amazing fresh toppings. Each dish we tried blew us away. Vegas meets Italy pizza is in my top 5 pizzas ever! Salads were delish! Stuffed chicken wings were a MUST ORDER!!! My 15 old son had another order for desert. And top it all off with the best cannolis I have ever tasted, awesome! Service was friendly and helpful. Must go here!
The pizza tasted like pure salt and it was too greasy, I needed a lot of napkins. I also didn't enjoy the sourdough garlic knots. Way OVERPRICED
The online ordering system was way too much of a hassle for the mediocre pizza! The sausage was too spicy and the crust was too thin and too chewy. We will not get carry out pizza from them again!!!
Amazing . F*$&ingg delicious. Fresh ingredients and the crust is perfection. I can probably consume spoonfuls of the sauce. Just sayin.
Just had the best pizza, bread knots and service. Place was busy but so worth it. The crust is so yummy and the sauce they give you, I will totally save this place for my next time in Vegas

I LOVE this place... the garlic knots are the best I've ever had and I always get the antipasto salad (it is served in an amazing pizza crust)!!! I've been going here for years and the food is consistently delicious.

I have nothing bad to say about this place. I just noticed it about a week ago, and went there with my girlfriend. We both enjoyed the smell of the pizza cooking in the oven and the staff was polite. I enjoyed the pizza and garlic knots, but I really liked the calzone I got a few days later. The prices are better than most places in north Vegas. This is my new place to order pizza from. Give it a try

We ate here today and got the Big 14 inch , Pork rules (meet lovers with/pulled pork), Seriously put all the other pizza places to shame! Hands down one of the best in town. Me and husband had 4 slices each and it was just perfect!

Where do I start? From the moment the door opened and smell hit me I know it was going to be great. Get to the counter and we're welcomed like I walked into a family members house. We ordered the OMG (36 INCH) pizza Conover.  Basically the all meat pizza and an order of garlic rosemary knots. The garlic knots came out first the smelled great but tasted even better. The bread was some of the best I have ever had. Then the pizza arrives. The pizza stand is 3 empty gallon cans of peeled tomatoes. The pizza is the best I have ever had. You can taste the love and passion these guys put into it. The fresh herbs and spices. The sauce was great tasting. The toppings were fresh.  The atmosphere is like being in the kitchen of my best friends house. I have to say everything just perfect and  how I would want it. If I ever owned a restaurant. Thank you for the one of my best eating experiences ever. Can't wait to recommend and be back to dine again .

We came to this pizzeria after visiting the China Lights display.  This is far from our home but next to Craig Ranch Park. Best lemonade, best garlic knots and best pizza. You need to try their Hard Core Pizza. We are definitely going back even though takes us 40 minutes.
Awesome stop... fresh and unique. Not your typical pizza shop. Ordered some stuffed chicken wings to go!  Headed back to Oregon would defiantly come here again!!

Came here based on the reviews. 
I absolutely love the decor & ambiance! 
Staff was friendly one gentleman in particular, wish I'd have gotten his name..

Antipasto was delish! Pizza is pretty good. Lemonade (I got bc of reviews) was just okay, a little too sugary for my liking but the presentation was on point!

Well I have to admit I have never gone to north Las Vegas for a meal...probably because there are way more options on my side of town but since my friend always comes to my side of town I figured it'd be fair to try eating on her side of town for once. 

I was pleasantly surprised! The place is small and quaint, it's quite homey.. You can see your pizza being made which was cool, they have big bread bowls they serve their salads in, and homemade  cannolis!! The pizza was really good And the cannoli was ok too! I liked the place and will def. be back!! :)
Great authentic thin crust pizza with fresh toppings. The Vegas meets italy was fantastic. Large sizes. Small fed two of us

This by far has been the pest Pizza I have ever had. The food is very fresh and has excellent taste as well as value really enjoyed the dinner will be coming back soon you have to try this place you won't be disappointed with the quality and service

One of the better pizza we've had.  The place small but clean.  Service is excellent and the food is above average.  If you want wine you must take your own glass and pay dollars for the glass.  We will definitely go back

Great customer service.My first time here  with the family we loved it. We order a large pepperoni pizza  a three-piece stuff sausage chicken thighs, large side order of the garlic knots and everything was tasty. we were really satisfied with the food and the service that we will return again and try more of there menu.
Very good pizza, cool atmosphere and great service. Prices were very reasonable and the wait was typical for a pizza to bake.

Everything is amazing about this place! Atmosphere, the employees, and the food. I can't wait to come back. 
Even the music playing is so soothing. Thanks for a great experience.

This is what happens when you are too hungry too function so for the first time in your life you don't read people's individual reviews and/or look at photos on yelp...

You believe the menu that says that an OMG size pizza feeds 5-6 people. So you muster up the brainpower to do the math and order 2 OMG size pizzas for your group of 10 because I mean, 10/5=2 right? And I'd like to think we are big eaters.

SO WRONG. SO SO SO WRONG.

My boyfriend goes to pick up the pizzas and calls me with shock in his voice double checking that he was picking up the right order because apparently the pizzas are HUGE. I didn't really imagine how huge until they came home with the 2 boxes and we were shocked at how they even fit it in the car door.

Each pizza slice is 1.5 times bigger than your head. I'd say easily 1 foot tall and 8-9 inches wide in the crust! 

The pizza itself is thin and flimsy, so even though we asked for it well done, there is no structure for you to shovel this behemoth of a thing in your mouth. So I had to roll up the pizza onto itself and then later opted for a knife and fork. 

We ordered the Pork Reigns: House Braised Pork, House Made Sausage, Ham, Guanciale, Applewood Smoked Bacon and Salame Calabrese with Mozzarella and Tomato Sauce. This was the better of the two, although I did not find/see any braised pork at all.

and the Classic Combo: Caramelized onions, Roasted bell peppers, Roasted Mushrooms, Black Mediterranean Olives, House made Sausage, pepperoni, tomato sauce. This pizza was just okay. This one is definitely not as loaded as the Pork Reigns. The olives are fresh so be careful many of them still had pits!

The red sauce in general was full of flavor and so were all of the cured meats. The crust is definitely chewy and leaves something to be desired. And if you don't like rosemary, don't get the garlic knots, because they are packed with rosemary flavor.

For 2 OMG pizzas + regular size of Garlic Knots = $102. It was good but it wasn't the best. But we were grateful for how quickly it was prepared along with the convenience of something other than Mexican fast food in North Las Vegas.
Awesome pizza.   This is not Pizza Hut or dominos.  This is real pizza.  You pay for what you get.  Best pizza in town.  Real cheese and a little taste of Italy.

My boyfriend and I had this for dinner last night and it was one of the best pizzas we have had! We got a large (which looks like an XL) vegetarian and garlic rosemary knots, it was delicious. Definitely will eat here again.

After hearing all the positives about Old School Pizzeria I set off on the 7 mile drive from my office in hopes that I would find that elusive thin crust pizza quality I grew up with back east.

You enter the strip mall encased pizzeria and it is like walking into an italian pizza shop.  Rustic breads line a shelf behind the smallish counter.   The benches are stained wood.
