The smell of fired crust seeps out of the ovens.  OSP uses only natural leavening ingredients in their crust and avoids artificial ingredients like Xanthan Gum.  This means if you think you need Gluten Free products, don't go to OSP.  (See their website blog for their discussion of Gluten Free).

Blackboards hang on the wall with brain teasers and messages.  In addition to the garlic knots and breads, empty Cannoli shells are piled high. The counter is made of a stone slab with chalk outlines of pizza.  A slice is drawn on the counter so you can see the size of the slice you are getting.  The staff is very friendly and willing to explain the process.  On the counter is a paper with specials.  I opted for a monster slice (smallest size) and a stuffed chicken wing.

I can't tell you what I expected from stuffed chicken wing but the description of a deboned chicken wing stuffed with sausage sounded good.  A part of me feared getting a chicken nugget with a hot dog sticking out but if we don't try new things, we cannot be pleasantly surprised. 

Well, pleasantly surprised is not strong enough to describe how happy I was with the wing.  It was a large wing with a small part of the bone left in as a "handle".  The sausage stuffing was worth the extra wait while it was stuffed and cooked.  I could have eaten a dozen of these tender bites of delight.  I could have done without the bits of pistachio or pistachio similar substance, although it isn't a negative, I didn't think it added to it.  (for those with nut allergies be forewarned, the nuts are not mentioned in the description).  The sauce was light and flavorful but did not overpower the wonderful chicken taste with a slightly crisp skin that gave way to the italian sausage.

The pizza was flat with a crisp bottom crust and very fresh ingredients on top.  I had the homemade meatballs as my topping.  These meatballs appear to be cooked with love and care and are not too dense.  OSP doesn't skimp on the topping either so this one large slice was more than filling.  The sauce is sweet but the pizza could have used a bit more flavor.  Also, while I could definitely taste the quality of the crust, there was a slight burnt aftertaste to the thinner parts.  I did enjoy the thicker outer crust portion however.

For dessert, I opted for a cannoli.  I won't eat Cannoli's that are prestuffed for two reasons.  1) you never know how long ago they were stuffed and the filling is usually made of ingredients that have short shelf lives and 2) the shell becomes soggy.  OSP does it old school, filling the cannoli only after you order it and you can watch them do it.  It tastes as good as it sounds.

I also enjoyed the tea. They have jar's of unsweetened tropical tea and rosemary lemonade.  You pay for the tea and the jar the first time, then you keep the jar and if you bring it back the next time, your tea is 1.50 cheaper.  If you don't the jar is perfectly usable to package tea, preserves, or other items if you want to.  The tea tastes great too.

Finally, a shout out to the staff and owner(s?).  Everyone in the place was friendly and truly cared about what they were doing.  Although you can expect your pizza to take a bit longer here, you know it is because they are making sure your fresh ingredients are properly made, placed and cooked thoroughly.

The website offers some interesting cooking tips and blogs and games   The last event was October 2013 so I hope they post a new one soon.

Looking forward to doing it old school soon. (I have to, I bought the tea jar. )

I don't understand all of the 5 star reviews for this place. We have been looking for a good pizza place for a long time and we decided to try this place based on the reviews. I don't know what it was about the pizza but it just was not good at all. I ordered the vegetarian pizza and it had a strange taste. The prices were ok but I guess my taste buds are different.

Seriously - this is a real pizza joint!

I had the pork rules slice.  The crust is thin but not too thin.  The crust has a nice body too it with a crusty bottom, a bit of chewiness and a nice flavor. The slice was huge.  The pizza was topped with roasted pork, bacon, sausage, ham and pepperoni.  This is a great pie!  I know I could stop there. 

I checked in on yelp and cashed in on a free gelato.  Holy smokes - "I, Jason C. hereby solemnly swear to never eat regular ice cream ever again.  I do declare to eat only handmade gelato from Old School Pizzeria."  The pistachio gelato was that good.

I was ready to leave when I asked the guy behind the counter if those were "homemade cannoli shells?"  I asked because the shells were dark.  Real cannoli shells have a darker color because they are made with red wine.  It is rare to find homemade cannoli shells.  He said, "yes."  I said, "oooo I want one."  

Goodness - Authentic gelato and a real cannoli.  The pizza.  This place is legit.

Bring cash.

our second time here but it has been a few years since our first visit.  Our first time the slice was so greasy that the crust was barely crust anymore, hubby stopped in for a slice and some wings and got a dessert and brought it home didn't finish any of it and swore we'd never be back.  The past year or so friends have mentioned OSP a few times and last night we were looking for something 'new' decided to give it a try. This time was a whole new experience I ordered on line and went to pick it up pizza and them delicious balls of garlicky dough.!! Walked in and was waiting my turn in line and the pizza maker asked if I was ordering or had ordered when i gave him my name he repeated my order looked in the pizza oven and gave me an time estimate.  The estimated time when I placed the order was dang near spot on! While I waited the last couple of minutes and others came in to order or pick up you could tell that the two guys working have worked together for a while and do it well.  It was nice to hear sincere friendly chatter to themselves and to the guests.
Got home and enjoyed our grub while the center of the pizza is 'floppier' than our preferred we did really enjoy it for what it is, we're just not the fold my pizza type as per normal if we were or are to be this would be the pizza that convinces us :)

Keep it up OSP :)

This has been a bookmark FOREVER, so it was with much anticipation that I finally got to dine here with my b/f.  We arrived on a Tuesday afternoon for lunch and it was busy, but not so much that we couldn't find a seat.  We were greeted heartily by the guys behind the counter.  I already knew from other reviews and pictures that the Rosemary Garlic Knots were a must, so we had a half order of those (6 for $2.99) plus I had a monster slice with tomatoes and mushrooms.  The $4.60 monster slice is a large slice of pizza which you can add toppings to for $.30 each or 4 or more for $1.20.  The garlic knots lived up to the hype and I would definitely come back for those again.  The pizza itself was alright; I found my slice to be a bit too greasy.  I did like the b/f's Crazy Good Chicken, which he also ordered; I'd have that again.  For a first visit, we were very happy with our food; I'll be looking forward to more of those garlicky knots and maybe a calzone the next go-round.

Horribly rude staff. They lost my order, denied ever receiving it until I showed them the confirmation I received on my phone. When they realized they were wrong they scrambled to try and make it right which was ok, still took 90 minutes to get my order (only 10 minutes to actually cook the pizza, wtf?) garlic knots were soggy and had a weird tinge to the taste. The pizza was alright but the headache to complete an order with them and being treated poorly just isn't worth it. I don't think I'll be making the trip again.

Fresh ingredients make the food good.  The salad was made for us and not just pulled out of a bag. The treat of going for take out or eating there is the brain teasers on the blackboard.  we could not get this right- 'What gets broken but is never held?'   the right answer is so simple

Delicious, quick enough for a weekday lunch and excellent service!

We had the carnivore pizza and garlic knots, both were so fresh, awesome ingredients, and tasted fantastic.

The guys were super friendly and explained everything to us, and seemed genuinely grateful we had visited for lunch.

We'll definitely be back!

Pretty solid! Really liked the "old school" Italian pizzeria motif. Service was very friendly and the pizza itself was good. Def one of the best pizzas in this area. My fave was the ranch actually. It came complimentary with the pizza and it was super delicious

This is an update to my original review after having eaten here again on 12/26/15 - I dont know what happened to this place but it went downhill from our previous visits. They must have changed cooks. We always order the Classic Combo. This time there were hardly any ingredients on the pizza , hardly any cheese , and the pizza was the thinnist of the thin pizzas I've ever seen. It was so thin and also  mostly just sauce on crust that it sagged and fell apart. It was also kind of flavorless. Unless this place steps up their game again I doubt I'll be coming back. It's sad as I used to recommend it as being the best in Vegas. Now I'm embarrased to recommend it. I have to say that as it stands now the BEST pizza in Vegas award goes to Linos Pizzeria on Tenaya in NW Las Vegas right off the 95 and Ann rd.The following is my original review from over a year ago. - My family is an old Sicilian family and I am picky when it comes to Italian food. This place is the absolute BEST pizza in the entire valley. It doesn't get any better then this in Vegas. Fuggetaboutit !!

This place is really great and very authentic.  If you like thin crust east coast style pizza, there is just nowhere better, and they have some amazing unique entries.  The owner is clearly passionate about what he is doing over there, and it has a true Italian vibe.  The salads are amazing, and they have a chicken wing stuffed with sausage that is equally amazing.  I grew up on the east coast in the Philadelphia area and know good Italian pizza, and this is it!  I looked all over Vegas for this place, and I drive over there regularly.  The only feedback I have that is not overwhelmingly positive is that one night I was in there and the music was up a bit too loud.....normally it is at an appropriate level so you can talk to others without shouting, and normally it is the appropriate music...(i.e. Frank Sinatra, or classical).....for the place.  If I had three thumbs, I'd point 'em all up.  Dave S/North Las Vegas

This pizza establishment is a cross between almost upscale but very self help casual. 
The music, furniture and decor makes it feel upscale and the help yourself to drinks and order at counter makes it casual. 

There are very few tables, seven small to be exact.
and a counter that fits three. 
The floors are a bit dirty and the tables have plastic wrap on them. I'm guessing to keep clean up to a minimum.  

Inside was incredibly hot and uncomfortable, this is why I'm leaving four stars. I know it's vegas and summer but I've been to plenty of places that weren't that hot inside.  


The drink machine is one of those coke mixed drinks, I unfortunately don't like these. The coke always tastes terrible to me, even when I let it run before filling up cup. 

The staff was very friendly, the owners cousin Steve was super friendly, caring and was very attentive to all the customers.  

The pizza, I was recommended by a friend to come try it out. It was good, the crust was a little burnt, I however am picky about pepperoni and the pepperoni was actually very good! There wasn't a lot of grease from the cheese either.  I have to say the dipping sauce was pretty amazing!! 

The restaurant is kind of in a sketchy area but for sure try it at least once!! I know a lot of people that rave about it, my son is a picky eater and he said the crust was delicious and wanted to always get his pizza here!

Dank pizza!!!

Their dough is made in house and they have the recipe down!
 
It has a good amount of chew and softness to it with a touch of salt. And it's baked in a stone oven!! 

One of my friends recommended this place to me many times and them being right the st it was only right to try it! 

I'll definitely be back soon for a slice!!  

I regret not taking a picture. 

That slice didn't stand a chance.

Second time visiting this fabulous pizzeria.  The pizza, garlic knots and cannolis are so delicious; pure perfection.

Service is awesome, excellent customer service.  I guess I'll keeping making my 20 minute journey to/from in order to enjoy fresh, quality food.  No need to go anywhere else, this is the only pizzeria worth visiting and giving my business to.

My first time. Had the monster slice + stuffed chicken leg. It was delicious. What is not to like here. Everything looked good. I need to come back and explore the menu more. 

Yum Yum :-)
Sooo bomb!!! Pizza and those rosemary garlic knots are amazing!!! Definitely worth it

This place is one of the best all around pizza places I've been to. Homemade crust, homemade ingredients, and the best lemonade I've ever had.  Additionally, I'm not a salad guy but this place has the salads!

Great pizza!  Definitely old school Italian style, the marinara is made with fresh tomatoes!  If you are partial to American style pizza, this place may not be for you.  Nice guys too.  I wish they had beer on tap but it's cool that they let you bring your own.  We will definitely come back next time we're in Vegas.

After stubbornly avoiding this place for several months I decided to give them a second chance, and I'm glad I did.  This restaurant is located in a tiny strip-mall on Craig & Lawrence (accross from the Cannery).   Went on Saturday 9-26-15 at about 7PM to get some pizza.  

The place is kinda small but in an intimate, swanky-bistro kinda way.  The light fixtures are really cool, the lights are dimmed, there's some classy italian music playing in the background.  It's the kind of atmosphere that makes you instinctively lower your voice and act like a damn lady for a minute.  The atmosphere and food screams expensive but it's not at all.

So here's how it goes...you go up to the counter and order and they'll call you when it's ready then you go over and pick it up.  I really like their way of selling pizza by the slice.  Instead of making a ton of different pizzas and selling slices, they have cheese pizzas ready and they add the toppings you want and then pop the slice in the oven for a minute.  Genius.  

$8.64 got me a slice of cheese pizza and a small garden salad.  I love that the salad came already dressed and on the same plate.  The pizza had a great crunchy bottom and a gooey top.  A bit too much sauce for my liking but that's just a personal preference. AND THEY GIVE YOU RANCH DRESSING AUTOMATICALLY!! And not just any ranch...tasty ranch like wingstop.   I tried my friend's garlic knots and I was hooked.  I don't even like rosemary but them knots are legit.  They have an almost sourdough quality to them and they're buttery and basically irresistable.  I'm pretty sure I'm in love.  When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie, that's amore.

Yes, I am a fan of their pizza and believe it or not, because the crust is so delicious, the best pizza is their cheese pizza; the way good old fashioned pizza originated and was intended. If I need to add a lot of toppings it is because the good old basic pizza is not good enough. 

Con, it is very expensive pizza. Yelp rated is $$ it is definitely a $$$ pizza joint and the ambience is just a simple basic strip mall facility with limited seating and bright lighting.

We waited 57 min. for our pizza to be made and served and they weren't busy, only two other tables were seated, one party already had their food and one got their food shortly after we arrived. I bought one soda for my son when we got there because I am not a big soda drinker but after waiting and waiting we ended up going to the register two more times to buy sodas for others. You would think that because of the extensive wait they would have just invited us to help ourselves to the soda fountain but that was not the case. I just think it would have been a nice gesture for good customer service. Yes, the one guy at the register was friendly but they should probably rethink their business model.  When your menu prices are that expensive, you need to make people feel like they are getting value elsewhere instead of feeling squeezed for every penny.

Very Yummy Pizza!!
We are never unhappy with this pizza, it is always so delicious and everyone is super friendly. 
Highly recommend trying this place if you have not!!

I was pretty impressed w/ the food here.  The outside is a hole in the wall but once you step inside I started to get a better vibe about this place.

Calzone $12 - Exceptional - I was able to try the Calzone ($7.99) and add any toping I wanted (additional +$4 for unlimited topping).  I added bacon, sausage, garlic, extra mushrooms, pepperoni, and cheese.  While this wasn't cheap, it made up for in quality.    This thing tasted great!  It was cooked perfectly.  Baked on the outside, cheese creamy on the inside, all the meats cooked to perfection.  I was 100% satisfied w/ this dish.

Pizza slice -$4 - Above average- A "monster" slice of pizza runs about $4, and the name should be taken seriously; the size of the slice is about the size of a football!  I was able to try my friends pizza slice and it was delicious.  Thin-crust, crunchy, and not over the top oily.  Fresh ingredients too.  A slice by itself should make any person full.

Tips:
-Not good for large groups.  The inside probably houses about 15 people to sit.

What a find! We tried this before a show at the Cannery after a friend rec it. We had a salad and slice combo and i tell ya it was the biggest slice I have ever had. Delicious too!. Salad was very nice and fresh and the service was terrific too. There are a couple drawbacks.....NO wine or beer which would be a very nice addition. The other problem is that it is so small that it would be tough to bring a group of friends to show off this little slice of heaven in the desert.

Seriously.   Best.  Pizza.  In.  Vegas. 

You have to try this place! 

The dough is incredible.  Soft.   Flavorful.   Delicious. 

The quality of the ingredients is on point.   You can taste that they are quality and fresh. 

There are some interesting selections for pizza or you can build you own to suit your tastes. 

Of course there are negatives.   The price is pretty high for a pizza.   We got 2 smalls and paid over 40 bucks.   Also, the cooks are the servers so it wasn't the cleanest (I sat at 3 different tables looking for a clean one and my bf found dead and one live cricket in the bathroom.)

But overall I'd eat here everyday that's how good the food is and that's why they still get 5 stars!
This place has great pizza with fresh ingredients. The decor sets up a really nice vibe and the music compliments the experience. 9/10 will eat here again.

BEST PIZZA IN LAS VEGAS HANDS DOWN!! My family and I always come here before a movie and share a pizza and house salad. They have generous portions and the best part is the sourdough crust... it's THAT good.

I can't believe we have overlooked this place the entire time we lived in North Vegas. I had always seen this place on the corner of an awful little business building, and never once went in. I wish I had A LOT sooner....WOW!!!

The food here is beyond authentic. Everything is fresh, and the menu offers a lot of choices with most ingredients being organic, everything is homemade. Very reasonably priced and great portions. Love the "old school" feel of this place. We love the pizzas (both whole pies and by the slice) the salads, and the neat fresh lemonade they serve in canning jars. Fresh pizza dough and bread....YUM!

We have been back several times since discovering this place on a whim....The staff here is gracious, friendly and very customer service oriented. Every single one of them. Absolutely impressed every time. Anytime we are in North Vegas, this is our spot. My highest recommendation, it's great on every level!!!!!  :)

Great dough. Great sauce. Great ingredients, Great service. One of the best places for pizza in the city, state, and country. And that is coming from someone who lived in NYC for 45 years and visits regularly, and has tried at least 500 different pizzas over my life.
Also, the crazy good chicken is awesome.
Outstanding pizza! Great service! A definite must if you're in the North Las Vegas area. All the pizzas are made before you're eyes to order. The bread knots are also incredible.

In the old school pizzeria lives up to its name truly traditional pizza and fresh garlic cloves. We watch them make your food grinder cheese cut your meat and a fantastic restaurant. It just happens to be across from on of my favorite theaters app deal worth a trip. Cozy dinning area. The garlic rosemary knots are extremely addictive. More to follow.

They made some sliced tomatoes with homemade vinaigrette with fresh mozzarella.... Yummy!
Best pizza I've ever had! Classic Combo was perfect. Crust was crisp and light. Garlic knots and salad were super as well.

After seeing all the rave reviews, I looked forward to trying this pizzeria myself.  Living in North Las Vegas, where good dining out options are quite limited, a fine pizza shop is a welcome addition.  And, unlike many all-purpose Italian restaurants that serve pizza almost as an afterthought, Old School has a lazer-like focus on pizza.  Plus, it produces excellent-tasting pizza!

But before I get ahead of myself, let me backtrack a bit--because I started out with an Old School Antipasto Salad, which turned out to be salame, ham, Provolone Cheese, onion, black olives, tomatoes, peppers, Mozzarella Cheese, and lettuce in a large, hollowed out bread bowl.  It was huge and the combined flavors were excellent.  I wisely ate almost none of the dough, and would have been just as happy to have had all of the ingredients presented on a plate.  It seemed like a big waste of bread.

Just after I placed my order for an 18-inch Pepperoni, Mushroom, & Sliced Tomato Pizza, chef/owner Gio began to turn away, and seemed surprised when I mentioned a second 18" pizza for my wife.  I then told him that we "don't mess around when it comes to pizza."  We almost always order two larges, eat as much as we can, and gladly take the rest home for additional meals.  Plus, from my experience large pizzas taste better than smaller sizes, just like it is harder to get a Petite Filet Mignon done right compared to an 8 to 12 ounce Filet. 

My 18" Pepperoni, Mushroom, & Sliced Tomato Pizza was a little greasy on top (which I actually don't mind) but excellent New York style pizza with mild pepperoni, tasty flat mushroom slices, good cooked sliced tomatoes, and both Romano and Parmesan Cheese dropped upon a delicious red sauce--except some spots of char on the underside of the dough made parts of my pizza taste a little bitter.  Neither of the other two 18 inchers at my table--a Cheese Pizza and a Sausage Pizza with Extra Cheese--were noticeably charred on their bottoms.  The sausage on top looked a bit unusual, because it was spread in the form of thin, flat, and long strips rather than small elevated clusters; the sausage itself was mild.  The cooked pizza dough was just right for a New York style pizza--not too thick and not too thin, pliable, foldable, and with just a slightly upraised outside edge.  All three specimens were mighty fine pizzas!  

My small group of four also asked for some Cannoli and gelato.  For 4 dollars Chef Gio said he would take care of this for us, after which we were generously presented with three really excellent Cannoli and six small dishes of gelato, including Nutella (Chocolate Hazelnut), Peanut Butter with Coffee Crunch, and Pistachio.  Of these, the Pistachio Gelato had the strongest flavor; the Nutella was very good but not as rich as others I have recently sampled elsewhere; and the Peanut Butter with Coffee Crunch variety was fortunately muted in flavor rather than overbearing.

Be forewarned.  This establishment is very small in size, with seating for only 9 or 10 diners.  So I advise getting here before or after the dinner rush.  It will be worth the trip.  Only slight burning of parts of one of three pizzas precluded a five-star rating on this initial venture.

A solid 4-1/2 stars!

My GO TO pizza place in north Vegas. The staff have always been friendly, whether it was on the phone or in person. The pizza is so good, the crust reminds me of sourdough. (Which makes the crust the best part) their garlic rosemary bread knots are a MUST. Be sure to ask for extra white dipping sauce for them!

Wow. Up there with Home Slice Pizza, Austin. Quality, top to bottom. Chewy, fresh  sourdough crust. Beautifully designed sauce with a hint of basil. The meats are top notch. Safe to say it's the best in Vegas. The homemade lemonade doesn't let you down. Pride in ownership. Only complaint is the AC. It's always warm in here.
I'm from New York, so I know good pizza. That said, this is probably some of the best pie your going to find this side of the Mississippi.

Husband decided to order the OMG sized pizza here because even though the Large was plenty... I'd like  to think he was mildly curious because there was only 3 of us, and more MIL doesn't eat much. The pizza was great, NY style crust which is what we like in our house but the garlic knots lacked chopped garlic and seasoning so it was a miss but not enough to keep me away. Just had 4 cloves of oven roasted garlic with them which for garlic knots is weird to me. That part was my only complaint. Will order from again, not  h OMG size but a reasonable size for 2 adults.. if we do parties for our kids it will be the OMG because that size could feed an army!

Super impressed by this tiny spot.

I was invited to join a friend for dinner and I went a little nuts. House Garden salad, rosemary garlic knots, pizza. I ordered all the things. 

The parking lot is a bit of a squeeze, which was also a preview for the pizzeria. It's counter service with someone floating around to food run. The menu is written on chalkboards on the walls and also above the register. The staff is friendly and knowledgable, and I think they were just as excited as I was that this was my first time.

The pizza was delicious. I mean, it's pizza. I went with the Five Cheese Pesto and added their house-made sausage. Melt in your mouth good. The knots weren't as garlicky as I hoped, but they were fluffy little balls of bread heaven. I will 100% be ordering the Garden salad again. I'm not sure what the creamy dressing is, but I want to bathe in it.

I'm now plotting to get pizza from here, since reminiscing about this experience, tonight for dinner.

Thanks to Yelp we stopped into this place for a pie. The small size is gluttonous for two adults, the sauce is just the right amount of sweet and the pizza itself a hearty thin with great bones.  Oh!  I almost forgot, they serve with a garlic infused creamy dip with is an amazing compliment to the cost and knots!!  

The garlic knots are artisan sourdough  with toasted garlic cloves.   The dough, knots, cannoli are all fresh made.  The sausage is made in shop and sliced thin like salami, along with fresh roasted peppers and everything else.  

Old School is the perfect name for the product and service we received.  We come through Vegas with regularity and this spot is sure to be on the list for future trips being a quick hop from i15. Please support and #eatlocal you won't be sorry.

You can tell they take pride in the pizza that serve.  Everything was fresh & well made. We enjoyed the Classic Combo pizza & The Carnivore pizza & a Old School Antipasto Salad.  It was absolutely worth bypassing the strip, as we were in route to Utah. 
The decor is perfect repurposing pallets as bars tops for bar seating, & large cans as pizza holders.  The only minor drawback is that they only have about 4 tables which means you may have to wait for a table or take it to go. But either way, worth the wait.  
The next time we make the trip we are trying the Crazy Good Chicken & the Pork Reigns pizza.  Until next time....

This place definitely has good pizza and their sauce was my favorite !!
Inside was nice but I think they need a bigger venue, they get too busy to seat all their customers.

Went to Old School Pizzeria a few weeks ago with a dinner group.  What a wonderful experience!  They went an extra mile to accomodate us and really make our experience one we will none soon forget.  The food was delicious and the service was great!  I have been back already and will back again soon!
Thank you!!

Awesome pies!!!!  I have been here a few times, each time, different order, food was great!  The garlic knots are awesome with plenty of Rosemary.  Parking on the side street is easiest.  Buy by the slice or whole pie.  They also sell homemade ice tea in mason jars.
Best pizza in Vegas.  It smells like an East Coast Italian restaurant!!  I will be back to try other items on the menu.  Had to get the pizza again!

Pizza is amazing. I can't say enough about this place! Don't let the exterior or the location fool you, these guys are serious about their food. It's the dough, and the water they use to make it--out of this world good! Ordered take out ~2min before they closed (like peasants) and they STILL had great customer service and food quality. Run, don't walk to old school.

Went in to see Chef Gio tonight and was amazed. We had the Pork Rules pizza - we loved all the different pork toppings and the dough was brilliant. The Antipasto is served in a breadbowl and was better than I expected it to be. My real Favs came in some unusual places - Garlic Knots, Gelato, and Canoli. The ingredients and technique used in this casual establishment far surpass expectation.
There are some older reviews saying cash only, but we found today CREDIT CARDS ARE ACCEPTED!!! BONUS!
Let's keep local businesses going!

Had a lunch date here with my husband and I didn't want to go. I had just labored through three miles (running) and I didn't want to ruin what I had just accomplished with pizza. Wow, was I surprised! The decor is pleasantly surprising given the area. I had Gio's salad, the garlic knots, a cannoli, and the grilled lemon and rosemary lemonade! I could eat this over and over. I will definable be a return customer. The service is outstanding and it really feels like you are in someone's kitchen.
WOW! My taste buds are singing!!! Fresh! Flavorful! DELICIOUS!!!! This has to be one of the BEST pizzas I've ever experienced!

Great little gem hidden in the middle of a strip mall. Hub & I split a calzone and a cannoli. Both were delicious. You can tell they really use fresh, quality ingredients here. 

Only two downfalls that made this not a five star rating:

1. Ambience. Dining in area is extremely tight. There's only about 7 tables in this restaurant, and patrons extremely are rude. Taking up a table for an extra pizza box so no one can sit next to them? Ridiculous. 
2. Barber shop next door attracts ghetto people. I came out to find my car had been leaned on and hand prints all over it from teen kids playing around it. 

Great food. Crappy ambience and location. Might want to consider an new location if they want to continue grow their business.

Best pizza ever, vegas meets Italy simply does not tasty like any pizza! It tastes like an Italian fancy dish!!! AMAZING! And healthy too! The dough is delicious and it can be eaten by itself and the atmosphere is great! Definitely, one of those places you go once a week!!

The best pizza place I have or had it was so amazing. The dough is  the greatest I've ever tasted and extremely delicious better than any other pizza place I ever had! I just had a cheese pizza. And my boyfriend had some wings that were stuffed I honestly could go there again and again!

I don't live in Vegas, but my mother moved there a few months ago and was complaining about the lack of good pizza in her area. So I took to yelp, read the great reviews for Old School Pizzeria, and dragged my family over to experiment while there on a visit. They were not all too keen on the experiment since they tend to judge books by their covers, but am glad to report it was worth the trip...

Despite the plain exterior and the tiny interior, this place is a gem! I have no idea how people can find the slice and soda deal expensive...$5 and the slice is monstruous! We went for lunch and I could not bring myself to eat dinner, hours afterward.

The rosemary garlic knots are to die for, and my BF answered a riddle and got a free cannoli! All and all my family was quite pleased, ran out of there with a take home menu, and have proclaimed this place their new neighborhood pizza joint. 

Great find, thanks yelpers!

The pizza here is delicious. Today was my second visit and both times we saw the owner. First time he was seated next to is. We order the carnivore, and the garden salad. Both are very fresh and tasty. The salad came in a bread bowl that appeared to be baked in the restaurant. The pizza itself is pretty greasy due to the fact that it's all meat, but it still has that fresh meat taste. I had bacon on the pizza that I've never seen so thin, just melts in your mouth. 

I will be returning, and I would definitely recommend them over any of the big name pizza places.

So I've since left Las Vegas...but I can't stop thinking about the quality of ingredients at old school as well as the atmosphere. Bring your own bottle of wine, share with the chef and enjoy dinner how it should be.

Handmade pizza the way it was meant to be! Not bastardized and has fresh ingredients. My favourite is mushroom, garlic and olives. Their pastas are super tasty as well; however you haven't lived until you've tried one of their AMAZING CANOLES!!!!!! Crispy golden casing dusted with warm cinnamon and a rich creamy texture on the inside- not too sweet. I'm hungry!!!
